De communicatie was uitmuntend en zorgde ervoor dat alles zeer duidelijk was en het appartement gemakkelijk te bereiken. Mert was ook altijd bereikbaar en bereid om te helpen. De buurt is zeer leuk en gezellig en ik ben heel blij dat ik daar verbleef. Ook gaf Mert zeer goede tips over wat wel en wat niet te doen. Bij terugkeer zou ik niet twijfelen en sowieso daar teruggaan :) !
Delicious meals, kindly made and offered along with friendly care. Nice way to live as the locals do and experience the real deal.

Halis is a great host, always responded quickly to my questions. The room was comfortable, clean and located in a quiet residential area. About 15 minutes walk from metro and ferry stop. I would definitely stay there again!

Halis on suurepärane võõrustaja. Ta vastas alati kiiresti kõigile mu küsimustele. Tuba oli mugav, puhas ja asus vaikses elurajoonis. Umbes 15 minutilise jalutuskäigu kaugusel metroo- ja praamipeatusest. Võimalusel peatuksin tema juures taas!

I had an amazing stay at Mert's home. The first evening he cooked me a delicious dinner, which I didn't expect, and after we had a great conversation for  a few hours, he's a very interesting and open guy with a great sense of humour. The bed is very comfortable. On the last day I went to his school and enjoyed teaching his adorable students. It was a pleasure to meet and get to know him. I would definitely stay here again if I return to Istanbul. One more thing about the area. It's very local and you'll experience the real Istanbul life away from the tourist traps and selfie sticks.
I really enjoyed to stay with Mert. I hope to stay again with him when i go back to Istanbul.

name: Queen Room at Beautiful Upscale Organic Farm
summary: Honaunau Farm Wellness Retreat is a 7 acre farm and retreat with sweeping views of Kealakekua Bay.  The Queen Room is in our 3 bdrm guest house.  The room has an incredibly comfortable organic mattress, teak desk and large picture window. The guest house has lush tropical surroundings, fully outfitted kitchen, living room and lanai.  We offer farm tours, massage, classes, and wellness services.  Our place is a fantastic location for snorkeling, hiking, a trip to volcano and other historic sites.
space: Our Guest House provides a soothing and healing atmosphere where you can tailor your Hawaiian experience to exceed your expectations. It is an ideal environment for singles, couples and families who want to meet others interested in community and conscious living.  Our beautiful 7 acre educational farm offers a full spectrum of opportunities. You can choose to stay here and enjoy your space, take a tour or class and use this as a launching point for your Hawaiian vacation.  We have a variety of offerings to suit your dessired experience.   LOCATION: In addition to all the farm offers, we are about 10 minutes from the ocean with great swimming, snorkeling and many other activities.  We are located about 25 minutes south of Kailua Kona which has plentiful land and ocean based activities. PRODUCTS & SERVICES OVERVIEW  FARM TOURS  Farm to Table Tasting Tour (2 hrs w/ tasting picnic)- $65 per adult, $25 per keiki  Farm Tour - $25 per adult, $5 per keiki  WELLNESS SERVICES:  Massage - 60min
description: Honaunau Farm Wellness Retreat is a 7 acre farm and retreat with sweeping views of Kealakekua Bay.  The Queen Room is in our 3 bdrm guest house.  The room has an incredibly comfortable organic mattress, teak desk and large picture window. The guest house has lush tropical surroundings, fully outfitted kitchen, living room and lanai.  We offer farm tours, massage, classes, and wellness services.  Our place is a fantastic location for snorkeling, hiking, a trip to volcano and other historic sites. Our Guest House provides a soothing and healing atmosphere where you can tailor your Hawaiian experience to exceed your expectations. It is an ideal environment for singles, couples and families who want to meet others interested in community and conscious living.  Our beautiful 7 acre educational farm offers a full spectrum of opportunities. You can choose to stay here and enjoy your space, take a tour or class and use this as a launching point for your Hawaiian vacation.  We have a variety of
notes: Please take note: Hawaii charges a 10.25% Transient Accommodation Tax as well as 4.166% GE Tax on all short-term rentals. The taxes will need to be paid prior to or upon arrival as Airbnb does not collect them for the state of Hawaii.
transit: The public transportation is poor here.  The bus only loops the island on the main highway once or twice a day, so having a car is pretty essential for exploring and getting to the farm.  Hitchhiking is not uncommon, but not ideal for reaching less traveled spots and getting about in a timely fashion, so we don't recommend it as your sole means of transportation.
access: If you enjoy animals you will love hanging out with our milking goats, sheep, ducks, and chickens, as well as our two loving dogs and cats. You are more then welcome to walk around the farm and explore the abundance of tropical farm living. Please remember this is a working farm so there will be farm noises (i.e. roosters in the morning) and activity around.
interaction: We are more then happy to interact with guests and provide recommendations and answer questions.  We are also happy to give you your space if you wish.
house_rules: SUSTAINABLE LIVING & AWARENESS We ask that you are aware of the resources used while on the farm and encourage the use of organic, non-toxic and biodegradeable products. QUIET HOURS: 10:00PM-8AM We ask that you please keep the noise before 8am and after 10:00pm to a minimum. KITCHEN USE If you are not renting the entire house the kitchen may be shared with other guests staying with us, so please be respectful of this space. SMOKING Cigarette smoking is discouraged on the farm. LIABILITY The farm will not be held responsible for any injury or loss, resulting on the land to you.  If you get injured you must have insurance, and pay for any medical and other costs involved.  Everyone should be careful and act safely.  Again, if you are injured, it will be your sole responsibility medically and financially.

host.host_about:
Honaunau Farm Wellness Retreat is a place where we can engage with people and share in the abundance of a co-creative conscious lifestyle.  We love meeting people from all over the world right here on the land we call home.  We enjoy engaging conversation about travel, spirituality, holistic living, healthy food and current affairs.  We find people who use airbnb to be great guests and it is a pleasure to be a host in Hawaii because we have the opportunity to extend the magic and beauty of the island to all of them in unique ways.  We love our life and we love to share it.

Over the last two years, we have had our CBD hemp business, Mana Artisan Botanics, take off.  So we are now traveling often for work and have our guest experience hosted by our retreat manager, Ashley.  She shares our love of people and holistic living and is a gracious hostess should you need anything during your stay.

reviews.comments: My time on Steve's farm was absolutely lovely.  He and his housemates are very gracious hosts, and i felt very much at home.  The property is beautiful, very well kept, and an amazing place to just chill and watch the view.  I hope I get the opportunity to stay again!

My Girlfriend and I had a wonderful visit. Steve and the others where wonderful hosts and the house and farm was beautiful... fresh fruits, nuts, veggies, and goat cheese... hard to beat. Along with the beautiful view and the amazing outdoor shower.

The farm was AMAZING! We had such a great time. Steve and the interns were so welcoming and made us feel right at home. We had the opportunity to learn about sustainable agriculture/ farming and help out with the animals. The house was beautiful... especially the outdoor shower! Thank you so much, we can't wait to come back.
Steve and his interns were welcoming and generous with their love and knowledge of Hawai'i. The place was beautiful and well kept, a relaxing retreat.

We LOVED Steve's place. Steve's crew were so nice and inviting and super helpful with Island info. His place is in a very cool area, with the best coffee shop down the road. You are central to lots of attractions; Place of Refuge, Two Step (snorkel beach), Captain Cook Monument and the Ethnobotanical Gardens. And the best burgers at Annie's. The goats, chickens, ducks, cats and dogs were lovely and all the fruit was a bonus! The outdoor shower is amazing at night to see the stars! Thanks Steve!

We were planning a trip to hawaii to purchase a sustainable farm.
Our first choice was Worldmark who we are members, lucky for us they were booked.
Steve and his staff were friendly,and attentive without being to attentive which allowed us privacy and the enjoyment of soaking in all the place had to offer. The farm animals provide plenty of entertainment and the ducks will quack you up with their antics. and were a pleasure to watch.
Sipping fresh Kona coffee on the lanai in the morning while looing at the panoramic coastline view....WOW!.

The host was gracious and interesting. The farm was as advertised. It was nearly impossible to sleep the first 2 nights as the coqui frogs were deafening. Once exhaustion set in you get used to them you can get to sleep...until 4:30 when the 200 roosters start crowing. It is a matter of conditioning...city dwellers never hear the endless traffic or the sirens and country folk never hear the (Website hidden by Airbnb) I only mention it as a word to the wise. Otherwise not a bad experience. Loved the variety of fruits available.

I really enjoyed my stay at the organic farm.  It was easy to find, clean, safe, respectful,  peaceful, beautiful view, close to the bay and nicely decorated.   The hosts were open to sharing informaton and time, aswell as their great energy!  The interns were also a real joy to meet!  The animals, always special.   The sheep mama had two babies during my stay, Awesome!!   I had wished I had more time to spend there and learn, next time.   I highly recommend the experience!   Love and Light to that place!
Jennifer in Colorado

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the farm!  The property is beautiful.  The views are amazing.  And, the location is perfect for venturing off in many directions.  Steve, Melinda, and the farm interns were very welcoming.  We enjoyed their hospitality and conversations.  

Our recommendations:  
Eat a farm fresh meal or two-You won't be disappointed.
Shower outside-Well, it's just cool!
Sleep on the lanai, if you get the chance.
Visit with your hosts-They're great people.

Thanks for a fabulous time!

Jamie & Mercedes
Helena, MT

We got to the farm at night, which was a tiny bit tricky to find in the dark, but no big deal. Our hosts graciously greeted us. We spent two nights there. Most of our days were spent at the beach, but the farm was a beautiful place to come home to and to wake up in the morning. And especially with tasty coffee, fresh eggs and a view. Plus, there are tons of cute animals to cuddle with and pet--Leilani the pup, various cats, goats, sheep and baby bunnies!

Steve's place was incredible! He was warm, helpful and overall a great host to us. The farm is fabulous and everyone was super friendly and helpful with any questions we had. The rooms and outdoor shower are beautiful. I'd love to stay again for a longer period of time.

Really nice place. We had a lovely stay in the farm.
The hosts were really nice 
Wonderfull view and beautiful sunset on the lanai

We had a perfect time at the luxurious farm. Steve and Melinda are awesome and the community they had between the farm help and the other guests was awesome. Our room was clean and the lanai is dreamy. I loved falling asleep to the frogs and showering outside in the amazing shower.

I cannot wait to return again and wish I could have stayed a few more days.Thank you both so much!!

very well kept home and such peaceful, zen-like environment.  i really felt relaxed and slept so well during my stay there.  there's a great vibe about the place and was centrally located - easy to get to various diving/snorkeling locations including captain cook, the famous kona, and down south or to the volcano.  steve and melinda were very helpful and hospitable and made really delicious and healthy food.   this is different from other vacation rentals because they are actually sharing their home with us, and we enjoyed every bit of it.

we stayed at the really beautiful farm for 3 nights. Steve and Melinda were  friendly and helpful. we also enjoyed our stay with the other guests. we would highly recommend their farm for staying at the Kona side. hopefully we will be there in december again.

I had the time of my life on this farm!  Steve and Melinda are two of the most kind and considerate people I've met on the Big Island and I will always remember my time with them as one of the best experiences ever.  Their home is beautiful and the animals are all amazing!!!  Thank you both, again, for a fabulous time !!!  I'll never forget you :o)

Situé entre Volcano(1,5hr) et Kona (45 min.), la ferme est un endroit paisible.  La chambre est confortable et propre, l'hôte accueillant, sans être envahissant.  N'oublier pas d'apporter vos produits biodégradable et naturel (le nom de l'endroit le dit...).  On peut y prendre de petites collations ou se faire un café et entreposer quelques petites choses dans le frigo pour le lunch du lendemain.

Pour les adepte de snorkeling, le site est à moins de 10 minutes d'un endroits que l'on nomme 2 steps, non envahi par les touristes.  Facile d'accès (rare sur Big Island), le matin, on y voit tortues et dauphins (gratuitement) ainsi que plusieurs poissons tropicaux.  L'eau y est limpide.  En pm, la marée monte et les vagues se font plus importante.

Bref, un bon endroit à découvrir pour quelques nuits (sinon, ça fait beaucoup de km) et peu dispendieux.
The hosts are gracious, considerate and knowledgeable.  The inspirational and very well maintained farm is in a stunningly beautiful location with close access to superb snorkeling.  We loved it!

What an amazing place, a true little paradise. The house, the view, the hosts, the neighbors, the fruits, the vegetation, the smell and sounds, the pets, the outdoor shower, the nearby snorkeling and beaches made this a wonderful and memorable stay. Steve and Melinda are the best hosts imaginable and made us feel most welcome. 

If all that is not enough, their home also features the most comfortable bed in northern america! we know because we've tested them all :-)

Even without my own transportation I had a great time at the farm. Steve & Melinda were helpful and accommodating all the time. If you want to get away from the tourists & be surrounded by nature it's the ideal place!

Steve and Melinda's home was just the experience and setting we were looking for in Captain Cook!  They were very gracious hosts and wonderful to get to know. The house was very comfortable and the view of Captain Cook really could not be better than from the big lanai. 
Lani, the dog, identified us as friends after meeting us once and made us feel like we belonged there and the cats helped us to miss our own kitties less. There are animals everywhere (but not in the house) and if you stay there, you will feel you are truly in the heart of a real farm. We had a wonderful breakfast one morning and generally enjoyed everything about our 4 day stay.  We will happily stay with them again when we return to the Big Island!

Steve and Melinda were gracious, friendly, excellent hosts! Not only are they wonderful people, but their farm is a beautiful place to spend time while you're around Kona.  

One note - make sure to get clear directions in advance, because (Hidden by Airbnb) maps misses their address by several miles.  It's not hard to find once you know where to look!

Steve and Melissa have created a truly amazing place to stay on their huge farm. We were stunned by the view & all the fruits and animals on the farm.
Everything was very tidy, clean and neat. They made us feel very welcome and their instructions of how to get there were easy to follow. At night we were serenaded to sleep in our beautifully furnished room by hundreds of chirping tree frogs. A memorable stay.

It was the first time, we stayed with airbnb and we really liked it!
Steve and Melinda are very friendly, the room was great and the view was just fantastic... We really enjoyed walking around on the farm and see all the animals and plants.

Beautiful location! Unique experience! Steve & Melinda were as gracious as can be.  Excellent advice on where to go and what to do! Farm breakfast was delicious! Only wish we could have stayed longer! Have recommended to friends and would definitely stay again.

Melinda was an absolutely perfect host: warm, welcoming and full of radiant energy. She felt like an old friend the minute we walked in the door and made us feel perfectly at home on her and steve's beautiful farm.

The room and outdoor shower were heavenly...perhaps the best shower I've ever had!

My wife and I spent 3 days at the farm and we loved it. We would have stayed more if it had been possible but there was no more availability. The place is exactly as described in the airbnb ad: no bad surprise. Actually everything was better than we had expected. The property is big and well located, with incredible views over the ocean. Every room is furnished and decorated with style, in a kind of oriental way.
Steve showed us the farm around and was just wonderful. Actually everybody on the farm was great and we became friends very fast. Gabriela and Matias prepared us the best breakfast with products of the farm. We also loved the contact with the animals, Lani the dog, the cats and others. We also loved the huge outdoor shower.
Now we are back in Europe still very jetlagged. I don't know if my head is clear enough to really describe how nice it was.

Life-charging opportunity to reset and recharge the soul.  My stay was a stay in Paradise, to say the least.  Great people to be around who received me with the most loving heart.  The food at the farm is deliciously organic, the animals extremely docile, and the learning experience in doing the chores around the farm as well as learning more about Sustainable Farming were all some of the highlights of this Retreat!  I had no idea my mind, body and spirit would be this much nourished.  I called this trip a Rebirth.  Thank you for the opportunity to be ONE with Honaunau Farm.

This was already our second stay at Steve and Melinda´s farm, this time we came with my parents. Unfortunatly we didn´t meet them during our stay since they were in holiday themself. But their helpers gave us a warm welcoming and helped us whenever we needed something. We enjoyed our stay at the farm again very much. We like the atmosphere and their lifestyle. If you order, they prepare a super delicous, fresh and healthy breakfast and although it`s a bit pricy it´s totally worth it. Aloha Ozzy & Chantal

The sustainable farm by Steve and Melinda was an awesome place to stay on the Big Island. The place was beautiful and very comfortable. Their friends were awesome to even invite us for New Year partying around a camp fire.

We had a wonderful time at the organic farm. The location is excellent, close to great snorkeling places, eating (be sure to check out the coffee shack) and with a spectacular view from the veranda aka lani. 
The house is beautiful, spotlessly clean and our room with a private bathroom just across the hall had a very comfortable bed, close and everything we needed.
The farm itself is a wonderful place, with lots of different animals, from chicken, roosters and ducks  to little baby goats that were just born the night we arrived. The owners were on vacation over the holidays and the argentinian couple that worked as organic farming volunteers on the farm showed us around and they were just amazingly friendly and helpful, mahalo Gabs.
Both thumbs up for this oasis on The Big Island of Hawai'i

Steve and Melinda have a beautiful and luscious farm that they have graciously shared with guests. The house is very nice and big and quiet, with dramatic paranomic view of Kona coast. You just get lost in the nature and the sunset. Walking around the farm, we saw adorable animals and lots of fruit trees. We could easily find lilikoi falling from the trees that taste delicious. Everyone in the farm was very nice and friendly. We highly recommend this place to everyone exploring the Kona coast.

My husband and I stayed at this gorgeous farm on the southwestern side of the Big Island.  We were there for a combination honeymoon + friends' wedding trip.  We are so glad that instead of staying at a hotel or a resort, we decided to stay at Steve and Melinda's.  We stayed in the smaller guest room with the shared bathroom.  We loved that from our window we could see the flowers and plants behind us, the animals on the farm, and a bit of the coast.  It also felt very private even though we were in the main house at the same time as another (wonderful) couple.  Some our favorite moments were feeding the baby goats, having dinners with the other awesome couples, and eating breakfast on the veranda/patio.  None of the hotels' ocean view rooms can compare to the ocean views we had, while feeling like we actually lived there.  We loved their beautiful dog and adorable cats who were just too cute for words.  We came away having learned and discovered so much and we recommend their farm to anyone else considering doing something off the beaten path.  For my husband and I, it was truly paradise.

I just spent 10 beautiful days at farm (half with a friend and half with my husband) -- my only complaint was that it wasn't long enough!  Highlights include: a beautiful room with "jungle view" (and very comfy bed), a fantastic lanai with majestic view and the best outdoor reading/relaxing/chilling-with-the-kitties couch EVER, learning to make fresh, delicious macadamia nut milk, an outdoor shower in the late-morning sunshine surrounded by red hibiscus and the occasional peeping-gecko, bottle-feeding the adorable baby goats, and falling asleep to the sounds of crickets and frogs (which I loved so much that I recorded them for home!).  The other highlight was the people, who were so friendly, interesting and passionate about their work and the farm.  I would (and will!) recommend the farm to anyone, and hope to be back one day too!
Cool hosts, comfy bed, fantastic view and convenient location.

Our stay at the farm was a unique and a one of a kind atmosphere! The farm is full of life as well as our hosts! 
we really appreciated the opportunity to stay at the farm. Steve and Melinda are really great host and I highly recommend staying here!
A

My partner and I had a wonderful four-night stay at Steve and Melinda's farm. Their house is beautiful and relaxing, with a great view of the bay. Loved the animals, especially their friendly cats. Our room, bathroom and the rest of the house were clean and tidy. The hosts were very welcoming and helpful, and recommended places to see and eat. Location is great - very close to two incredible snorkelling spots (Two Step and Kealekakua Bay). Great value for the price.

We are grateful to have met Steve and Melinda.   It was so fun to learn about their ingenious farm and inspiring way of life.  

Buy their sheep and goat cheese, and especially their tree tomatoes!  It tastes like a guava, pomegranate, tomato smoothie.
Host was great, location was perfect; would stay again in the future

Steve and Melinda were wonderful, as was their farm.  They were both warm and engaging, with great conversation about farming, permaculture, and just life in general.  The site was beautiful, the place was clean and full of fun and interesting folks (and great cats and chickens and ducks!). Our visit was very enjoyable and their home was a great, community-focused base for us.

Just know that this is a working farm, and that Steve and Melinda are both (rightfully) very busy with their interns and the work. Steve and Melinda definitely went out of their way to engage us and spend time with us-inviting us to dinner and to a party for their intern-but the traveler/resident divide was ever present. That said, this place is best if you like being around great folks when they're available but otherwise are self-sufficient and ready to explore the Big Island on your own.

A lovely working organic farm with a great view of the ocean.  We had an awesome breakfast prepared by Stephen, not the owner, who we happend to know from his being the chef at one of our favorite LA restaurants.  Talk about farm fresh gourmet breakfast, it was amazing. Highly recommend it. The farm is a super laid back working farm staffed by happy young WWOOFERs. (Hidden by Airbnb) them. There is one small down side to this property though. Its noisy. You may want to consider ear plugs if you are a light sleeper.  The night noise are the frogs, the 4am noise are the roosters.  This is in no way a deal breaker, it is just the reality of a farm in Hawaii.  The upside is that you get to hang out on a super cool farm.  We never met Steve and Melinda, they seem to have been away. We were happily attended to by the other farm staff, who were lovely.  There are great places for coffee and snacks just at the bottom of the road.  There is very nice snorkeling and diving just 15 minutes away. I would recommend staying here. Two thumbs up!

Steve and Melinda's farm/home up in the Captain Cook area of the Big Island was a peaceful and lovely stay. We arrived late and Steve and Melinda were gone for the other night of our stay so we didn't get to chat much, but when we did they were warm and super informative in helping us plan our days. Their farm is lush and full of chicken and kitties, a great peek into sustainable living in a tropical paradise. The room we stayed in, the Trumpet Room, was clean and well-decorated, with plenty of hangers and closet space too. We had a shared bathroom that was also very clean and pleasant. Their home has amazing views of the Kona coast and wish we could have explored their property a bit more.

Steve & Melinda's farm is a great place to stay! If you're looking for an exotic alternative to big resorts and crowds that may be your place. Their place is very charming and super clean! And the deck with ocean view perfect for sunsets with a glass of wine!
We didn't get to see much of the hosts, but the room had a little folder with plenty of recommendations for food and attractions. Perfect to start exploring the Big Island!

Wonderful location.  A short drive down the hill is a wonderful place to kayak and snorkel.  I went snorkeling near '2 step' with dolphins playing around.  Captian Cook monument is a great place to kayak and snorkel.

Good coffee places near by.
The fruit and mac nuts on farm were good.

Steve and company were very accommodating, and the pictures and description do not do justice when describing how immaculate and wonderful the farm turned out to be.

If you're looking for a true getaway and a host with a warm personality, I'd highly recommend taking advantage of the Farm/Eco-Stay.

This place was a perfect place to land in the evenings after spending all day exploring the island. It's close to amazing snorkeling, and you can head out and return here for a quiet, relaxing stay.  Booked a massage with Melinda, and it was wonderful!!  The farm was everything I hoped it would be!  I look forward to returning to Kona and would definitely stay at Honaunau Farm again.  Mahalo Steve and Melinda.
Great view, wonderful farm, and friendly people. We had a very nice, comfortable stay.

Paul & I had an amazing time at Steve & Melinda's farm.  Their place is absolutely beautiful.  It's hard to put into words!  The view from the farm in the morning and at dusk is breathtaking.  Some of our most memorable moments on the island were spent with all the little critters on the farm!  Steve and Melinda were both so welcoming and made sure we were well taken care of.  One of our favorite spots on the farm was definitely their outdoor shower.  We don't get to take many of those back here in Seattle!!!!  It was so refreshing being underneath the warm water and out in the fresh air.  It is also very special to us because Paul proposed in the outdoor shower!  Such a romantic setting and very unforgettable for the both of us.  We loved Honaunau Farm and would definitely recommend it to anyone traveling to the Big Island.

The experience on Honaunau farms compliments the breathtaking view overlooking the ocean that cradles the Captain Cook area of Big Island. Waking up to the crisp magic air in the morning primes your spirit to fully embrace the abundant life and energy the island offers. Steve and Melinda's place is a very grounding environment making it perfect for early morning meditation and yoga. The atmosphere is one that allows you to drop all your mental distractions so you are able to focus on whatever you choose. The different plant and animals on the farm bring you back to a well rounded relationship and help to redevelop respect with not just the earth but the lifeforms we share it with as well. I don't just like the permaculture system they use for their farm, I love the care in which Steve and Melinda have integrated it so that we can experience the great majesty of life on a small scale that is literally easy to digest and compellingly captivating. Wait till you try the dried bananas and Macadamia nut milk they make on the farm. Amazing! Equally amazing are the individuals who staff the farm and the care in which they tend to the duties of such a vibrant existence. It seems that even the other guests are somehow called here to contribute to this farms existence reaching out to say hello to the world with such a welcoming and loving embrace. There are so many good things to mention. This place is a wonderful place to spring board off of to see the rest of the island and when you head back home, it will share with your friends and family the radiance as you tell your stories of all of these wonderful things that came together, at Honaunau farms.

Amazing energy radiates from both of them.  House is very lovely & has an amazing view of the ocean.  If you like permaculture, farming, & diversity, this property has it.  End of road makes it secluded.  Highly recomend!!

Our stay at Honaunau Farm was awesome. All the photos could not express the real beauty of your cozy place. We enjoyed it very much. 
The house and kitchen where very tastfully equiped. We are usually quite critical with almost everything, but you shocked us. I looked to Anja,....  and,... there where nothing to argue!!  Great!!! Thank you! We will recomend your place to our friends.

Steve and Melinda are very generous with their home and farm.  It is a neat place with a lot of great energy.  The remote location on the hillside made for a gorgeous view in the morning and the farm fresh eggs were delicious.  The room we had shared a bathroom and there is little privacy in the place, but well worth the price.

My stay on Steve and Melinda's organic farm was nothing short of amazing.  What they are doing, on the Big Island, is so inspiring, and it will stick with me, even after I checked out.  For starters, the location could be hard to find, BUT Steve and Melinda's directions are spot on, and if you follow them, you will not get lost.  Steve was there to greet me when I pulled into their driveway. He gave me a quick tour and overview of the property, and then set me off to go play with BABY SHEEP and BABY GOATS!  Cuteness overload!  This, of course, was not required of guests, but I was dying to hold the baby animals.  ;)  The fresh macadamia nuts and the postcard-like sunsets from the lanai added to the perfection of this listing.  If you ever stay here, be sure to use the outdoor shower as it as pure magic.  I highly recommend Steve and Melinda's farm for anyone who wants to experience the non-high rise resort side of Hawaii.  You will not be disappointed!

The Eco-lodge at Steve and Melinda's was like a dream come true. What a stunning place to visit. Before you even enter the house the property is packed with lush vegetation, flowers, fruit, herbs, trees and shrubs, decorated so thoughtfully with an eclectic grouping of statues, pots, shells and comfortable furniture to lounge in.... AND THE VIEW ahhhh it will take your breath away! Make sure to wander the grounds to get a full appreciation for what they have done here, and to play with all the wonderful animals meandering the property: ducks, chickens, rabbits, sheep, cats and the sweetest little old dog you've ever met. CAT ALLERGIES?  Not to worry. My husband has horrible cat allergies and the cats are NEVER allowed in the guest quarters, but do be aware that they are all over the lanai, and if you have allergies I to probably stay clear of any outside upholstery.. but seriously my husband never had a problem.

The guest house is just fantastic!!!! Two guest bedrooms, one with a private bath the other with a shared bath. A beautiful well stocked kitchen and comfortable dining and living room area for lounging, do be considerate about using  your hosts kitchen products - this is their private home so if you are doing cooking (beside spices set aside for your use) make sure to bring your own food. They did have coffee & farm fresh eggs available for purchase. Our room was thoughtfully decorated and VERY comfortable and VERY private... we really didn't want to leave. We also highly recommend using the outdoor shower, it's clean, private with beautiful views of the property - it takes a minute for the hot water to get running but once it is works like a dream. I'm a big outdoor shower fan.. and didn't once take a shower indoors

Melinda is also a very skilled massage therapist. My husband and I booked a 90 min massage each and did not regret a minute of it. I recommend you take advantage of her skills during your stay.

We plan on returning again and staying with Steve and Melinda - and probably for a lot longer next time.
Great farm airbnb. Clean, amazing views, share stories with travelers from around the world. Amazing avocados, eggs, and mac nuts. Steve is a wonderful host.

We had a short, but wonderful stay at the Farm. Loved the opportunity to stay and explore a sustainable, working farm, that was nonetheless comfortable, well-appointed and equipped. Standouts were the *beautiful* lanai and view, and the outdoor shower was such a treat. Wish we'd had a chance to meet Steve & Melinda (who were on vacation during our visit), but the rest of the farm community members were friendly, helpful, and easy-going. 
Definitely recommended!

The farm is amazingly beautiful and the house has a great view of the ocean.  It is definitely worth taking a stroll through the farm to get a view of all the animals & trees. There are two great take-out food spots on the highway within a block of the highway entrance:   Super J's and Big Jake's Island BBQ:  both are highly rated on Yelp and Trip Advisor.  Get to Big Jake's sooner rather than later because with all their customers, they can run out some menu choices.  At the house, for evening entertainment, you can watch your own Netflix on their big HD TV.   One of the most noticeable attributes of the house is that it is beautifully decorated, very clean, and has plenty of hot water for a group to get in a few showers in succession.  Steve is a great guy and I really enjoyed meeting him, getting a tour of the farm, and his helpful advice for the area.

Steve and Melinda's Eco retreat B&B at Honaunau was simply amazing, unique, peaceful and memorable.   The house was slightly up the mountain in a beautiful area just south of Kona.  Just far enough away from the touristy hustle and bustle of Kona but still close enough.  We didn't get to meet Melinda but Steve was  an awesome nice guy who runs an Eco farm and small B&B.   The house was good size, very clean and felt like a home.  Have to admit we got lucky cuz nobody else was there so we had the whole house to ourselves!  Our favorite parts was the outdoor shower,  beautiful large lanai & seclusion.  So, if you don't need the pampering resort or five star hotel feel this place is definitely for u!

Nette kleine Farm etwas außerhalb und oberhalb von Captain Cook. Zimmer (Queen) Recht klein aber ok für ein paar Tage; allerdings hätte alles etwas sauberer sein können: auf den ersten Blick alles ok, aber man schaut besser nicht genau in die Ecken (Zimmer, Bad, Küche)
Schöne Lanai mit super Ausblick, sowie netter Wohn-/Essbereich. Dank sehr guter Wegbeschreibung auch im Dunkeln gut gefunden, Melinda & Steve gaben wir nur kurz gesehen, da sie nicht im gleichen Haus wohnen. 

Leider sind die Frösche nachts sehr laut und man kann das Zimmer auch nicht komplett verdunkeln, wer also empfindlich ist: Oropax und Augenmaske mitnehmen!

This is the third time we've visited the farm.  It is a really beautiful piece of land in a gorgeous region of the island.  The view from the lanai is incredible.  The hosts are very calm and healthy people and quickly respond to requests.  I want to go back again already.  It is also conveniently located near some of the greatest swimming areas of the island, good healthy restaurants, and adventures in every direction.  I highly recommend a stay here for anyone interested in sustainable approaches to living.

We spend 3 delightful nights at Steve and melinda's eco-resort.   We shared their 3 bedroom guest house with various interesting and thoughtful guests,   even an informal party one evening.  Views are spectacular,   beds comfortable,   kitchen adequate for cooking meals,   and farm and animals a delight.  Steve and his workers on the farm were interesting and helpful.   Location is excellent for seeing south Kona area.  Be sure to arrive in the daylight as it is tucked away on a lush hillside and would be tricky to find at night.

Wow! What a magical spot! I highly recommend staying with Steve and Melinda at their retreat! A beautiful, clean home with sensational sunsets over the ocean can be admired on the porch, super cozy bedroom with a great sense of artful design,and a great kitchen with homemade organic food available from their farm. We were impressed and inspired by their wholesome lifestyle, and made friends with the other like minded travellers who are attracted to this kind of experience. A true Hawaiian sanctuary!

The pictures don't do justice to how beautiful and relaxing Steve and Melinda's place really is. They accommodated us at short notice and even upgraded us for the Christmas holiday. We did not have the opportunity to meet them, but their farm crew made sure we had everything we needed and showed us around the farm.  This is a great Eco friendly place to stay in a beautiful location!

Very nice place, and very unusual.  The hosts are nice, and everything is well kept.  It's a very tucked-away place, however, and not findable by my GPS, so one tip is to get there before dark (it's harder to find after dark).

Steve and Melinda's Farm was the best place we stayed during our stay in Hawaii.  Beautiful views, farm, and comfortable sleeping. It would be my first choice to stay there if we decide to visit the island again.

If you're interested in activities in the South Kona region of Hawaii, or just establishing the area as your home base for exploring other parts of the island, this is a beautiful place to stay.  This farm on a hillside offers gorgeous panoramic views of the bay below.  The guest house is beautifully furnished with ample space for cooking and dining.  My only disappointment was not getting to meet the hosts (I met Melinda as I was checking out) or getting an opportunity to learn more about their farm.

From the moment we entered the front gate and wound up the driveway past citrus and welcoming ducks, we happy to be at home.  Steve was a friendly host who gave us space to make the place ours for the time.  It is a beautiful Asian-inspired home, open, airy and relaxed.  We loved hanging out on the sheltered porch and comfortable living room.  The kitchen is well-organized and equipped with plenty of space for refrigerated and dry foods and we enjoyed the fruits the hosts provided for sampling.  I never used the indoor shower as the outdoor one is spacious and has a beautiful view up the hill and into plants. The bed was easy to sleep in with plenty of fresh air and ceiling fan. We loved our time on the farm.

We had a blast, as usual.  There was fresh fruit in the kitchen from the farm upon our arrival, and I love lilikoi, tamarillo, oranges, and avocados.  The farm is really interesting, particularly how they integrate the care of goats and sheep into the fertility the land.  The milk is delicious!  The view and sunsets, incredible.  The hosts are dedicated to the health of the land, people and whole community around Honaunau, and it really shows.  Also, the location can't be beat.  It is near bunch of good restaurants, close to some of the best swimming and snorkeling on the Big Island, and just up the hill from important Hawaiian cultural sights and heiau.  I've been three times and can't wait to visit again.  You can have a lot of fun, learn so much, and enhance your health without ever leaving the farm and surrounding areas.

Great affordable place to stay with a wonderful view and cozy surroundings. I enjoyed interacting with the other guests and we even went out for breakfast together at the Coffee Shack which was a treat. Good location for exploring south Kona, especially Place of Refuge and 2 Step for snorkeling with the spinner dolphins.

Steve and Melinda are kind and gracious hosts.  You can be as involved as you like in farm activities and classes, or not, as you choose.  The property was wonderful to walk, the house is excellent with great views.  Nicely equipped kitchen - though bring your own spices. The pictures don't do it justice.  It was great to watch fantastic sunsets from the spacious covered deck.  The cool mountain breezes were wonderful for sleeping at night.  

It is the perfect spot for access to some of the best sites south of Kona. You are 10 minutes to two of the most fantastic and special places on the island: Two Step beach is next to the second most sacred ancient Hawaiian site, The Place of Refuge, or Pu'uhonua o Honaunau and the bay there is great snorkeling with very good reef life and healthy coral.  It is next to Kalekekua Bay which is a marine reserve, you will need to read up on access, but snorkel or kayak tours, or kayaking on your own are well worth it.   Both bays are where Spinner Dolphins often come to sleep during the day.  If you snorkel at Two Step and find the Dolphins, please let them decide to interact, respect their need for rest after hunting all night.  It is a magical experience to be chosen by a dolphin for interaction, but do not pursue them.  

Honaunau is 90 minutes from Volcano National park and is also an easy drive into Kailua-Kona.  I highly recommend this wonderful sanctuary.

Our stay at the farm was so lovely! I am truly grateful for the experience. Our host and the community were very welcoming and kind to share their homes with us for the week. The land is absolutely beautiful, it was nice to be a part of and to be surrounded by the diversity of life. There were so many different plants it was really amazing and fun to go around and check out, and we also got fresh fruit that were so delicious. The animals were adorable, I loved loved loved the goats and sheep - I definitely would recommend the goat and sheep milk too! We could not have been happier with the environment, it was beautiful and peaceful. The house and the view were stunning, I really enjoyed the meditation space. We were also fortunate to join in on a communal dinner which was quite the treat! The farm is in a great location, easy to get to places and good to retreat back to after a long day.
Overall, we had a very pleasant experience during our time on the farm and would definitely come back and recommend to anyone! Steve was very welcoming and kind to give us some suggestions as to what to do and where to go, and whenever we needed anything was able to help. We are happy with the time we spent here, we loved every minute, and plan on visiting again.

We had a wonderful stay at Honaunau EcoRetreat. The view from the lanai is absolutely spectacular and rejuvenating-- our second morning we sat there watching the most beautiful rainbow arch from mountain side to ocean. The guest house has everything you need to feel comfortable and at home, not to mention being spotless and beautifully appointed. The outdoor shower was lovely. Steve and Melinda were busy, and very welcoming and kind when we finally caught up with them. It's super inspiring to see the farm in action and fun to watch the ducks waddle around. We were pretty surprised by the sound of the coqui frogs, but it's a fascinating part of the changing ecosystem of the Big Island and miss them now that we're back on the mainland. Highly recommend!!!

Amazing, peaceful place. We were welcomed right away by Steve showing us around the beautiful home. It is decorated beautifully. The kitchen is well equipped with anything you may need, just bring groceries, fruit is plentiful throughout the property so if you forget anything don't worry! We took a couple permaculture classes from Steve and the wonderful organic picnic that Melinda and the lovely care takers made for us on the balcony overlooking the beautiful ocean. This place is amazing for those looking to explore the world of sustainability. Whether you are new to the practice or fully involved this place is for you. I would highly recommend this farm for anyone who wants to get away from the town hustle and bustle but remain close enough to everything to make easily accessible. Thank you so much Steve and Melinda, we enjoyed your home and your time. Hope to see you again very soon!

Wonderful relaxing and inspiring  stay. Would not hesitate to recommend!
Thank you Steve and Melinda

Peaceful and lovely retreat center located on the mountain overlooking the sea. The lanai has amazing views and we loved falling asleep to the hum of the forest. This is a three bedroom house with a full kitchen and two bathrooms, plus a yoga/mediation room in the back. The host lives in a different house on the property.

We had a great time! Would recommend.

We arrived on a day when the hosts were gone, but they left clear and explicit instructions for us on access. They also provided information on local restaurants and attractions that was very helpful. This is a lovely place! We enjoyed exploring the farm, and the house was clean, serene, and quiet. Our room had a very comfortable bed and was screened by a jacaranda tree. The view from the lanai in particular is stunning. We had trouble tearing ourselves away to do other things.
Wundervolle Aussicht von der Terrasse. Wir haben den Aufenthalt sehr genossen. Steve war ein super Gastgeber.

Honaunau EcoRetreat Farm exceeded our expectations. We loved our stay here!!! It was such a peaceful setting, situated on a hillside with an amazing view and happened to be located in the middle of our planned snorkeling activities. The ocean view from the lanai was spectacular. We had farm fresh eggs and fruit each morning, and enjoyed watching the animals roam throughout the farm. We received a vary warm welcome from Steve and Melinda when we arrived and got to chat with them a few moments during our stay.  When we make it back to the Big Island, we will definitely stay here again!!

Steve and Melinda has an amazing farm up on the mountain. The house is nice and the lanai with a spectacular view is awesome. There are some animals on the farms that are fun to see. There are nice beaches, some restaurants and a good grocery store close by. 
Steve and Melinda live at the same farm but I only met them briefly. They seemed very nice and helpful.
Because of the higher altitude it's a bit rainy and the frogs are loud at night, so this is maybe not for everyone, but it was perfect for me.

We arrived to this oasis without the hosts on the farm. We figured things out and they had binders located in the rooms and communal areas that listed basic info including  their wonderful services to show the farm, tea ceremony, and healing work. The lanai (wrap around porch) had an epic view and we spent many hours lounging on the lovely spaces out there. I was impressed with all the little touches, elegant and homey. We stayed 2 nights and never met our hosts which was nice for privacy reasons but would have liked contact. I guess you have to leave the lanai, haha! I would definitely enjoy staying here again.
A lovely retreat. I was traveling solo, looking for some R&R and Steve & Melinda's fit the bill perfectly. Relaxing on the lanai, eating fresh fruit from the farm, enjoying a wonderful massage.
This organic farm is my wife's favorite place we have stayed. We loved the privacy and awesome view deck. The cricket and frog serenade in the evening is a very relaxing way to fall asleep.

My husband and I loved our stay at the main house. We stayed in the Queen size room and our window looked out on a very private and lush garden, so we were able to keep our window open at all times. We loved relaxing on the Lanai on a sunny afternoon, or during a tropical rainstorm, after our day adventures. The kitchen was well equipped, and our last morning there Emily made us a breakfast that was amazing (had I realized how great it was going to be I would have had it every morning). She gathered fresh food from the garden and made sunny side up eggs, chard and mushrooms, purple sweet potatoes and red potatoes, avocados, fresh tangerine juice, star fruit, bananas, and a fresh mint tea. The views from the Lanai are wonderful: tropical forests, the bay, and sunset. The afternoon sun hits the porch. The location is close to the best snorkeling and dolphin hangouts on all the Hawaiian Islands: Keleakakua Bay, Ho'Okena, and two step Honaunau.
Had a great time at Steve and Melinda’s. The place has a peaceful and calm feeling and great views of the ocean. Would recommend this place to anyone.
A true treasure! Wow. The space is beautiful and clean. The host were extremely friendly and welcoming. We could have imagined to stay for weeks.

Hosts were very kind and friendly. I could stay relax like at my home.
Their farm is so nice! Lots of fruits and animals

It is a place with lovely animals, beautiful fruit trees and scenery. Silva's massage made my mother happy. Thank you very much. Three days were too short, so I really go to here again this year with my family :) see u again soon~!

My husband and I stayed four nights, but wished we could have stayed longer. The guest house is beautifully furnished and clean. Words can't accurately describe the beauty of the views from the Lanai. I booked a permaculture class and farm tour with Ashley and Jeremiah...they are very knowledgeable and gracious. Ashley even offered to stay in touch and send me more info. Silvana' was very quick to respond to our messages and is a talented massage therapist!  TOP NOTCH!! Look forward to staying at Honaunau again!

The place is gourgeus! It exceeded our expectation. The property is beautiful! The house is very well equipped, we really appreciated be able to use of kitchen, such a big plus. And the view is breath taking!! We were very well welcomed! there were fresh fruits, coffee, macadamias waiting for us. Savana, the woman that take care of the house is such nice person, was always available, very nice and caring. We wish could stay longer there! Could not be better! We loved!

People were lovely and so helpful and the property an adventure for my nature-enthusiast partner. Fresh farm-picked fruit was a great treat. It's a tropical farm, so be aware of mosquito exposure. The common area was stylish and beautiful during the day and sunset - breezes and view. Would enjoy staying here again.
Accommodations are as advertised.

name: Great studio/NOT a shared space
space: Remodeled with all the upgrades. Queen-size bed, vaulted ceilings, cherry wood cabinets, and granite countertops. Offering modern conveniences for those vacationing with laptops FREE secure wireless internet connection.   This unit is on the second and top floor.  The pool with hot tub is just a few steps away from the unit, as well as the two always clean, gas barbecues in the common area. Relax on your private lanai (balcony). Complete convenience.  Sandpiper is minutes away from Princeville Center, the local super market, stores/shops, restaurants and gorgeous beaches. Just down the road is the St. Regis Hotel with fine dining, a luxurious spa, and breathtaking patio bar open for nightly sunsets over Hanalei Bay. Princeville is also home to two world-class championship golf courses.  You can expect this condominium to be exceptionally stocked (see amenities list) - small frig, microwave, toaster oven, Keurig, beach towels, traveler guides, local sightseeing and restaurant and games.
description: Remodeled with all the upgrades. Queen-size bed, vaulted ceilings, cherry wood cabinets, and granite countertops. Offering modern conveniences for those vacationing with laptops FREE secure wireless internet connection.   This unit is on the second and top floor.  The pool with hot tub is just a few steps away from the unit, as well as the two always clean, gas barbecues in the common area. Relax on your private lanai (balcony). Complete convenience.  Sandpiper is minutes away from Princeville Center, the local super market, stores/shops, restaurants and gorgeous beaches. Just down the road is the St. Regis Hotel with fine dining, a luxurious spa, and breathtaking patio bar open for nightly sunsets over Hanalei Bay. Princeville is also home to two world-class championship golf courses.  You can expect this condominium to be exceptionally stocked (see amenities list) - small frig, microwave, toaster oven, Keurig, beach towels, traveler guides, local sightseeing and restaurant and games.

host.host_about: I am a resident of Kauai.  I purchased two vacation rental 10 minutes away from our house as college investments for our two children.  We love living in Hawaii and are very happy to share that experience with visitors.

reviews.comments: Great place to stay if you are on a budget. Very nice and comfortable bed. Catherine is enjoyable to work with. I even messed up our reservation and overpaid and she sent me a check for the difference. I would recommend this place!

My wife and I had the best time while at Catherine's condo!

Simply a fantastic location on an island in the middle of all the wonder of the Pacific Ocean. We couldn't have asked for more.

And as far as Catherine, goes, well, she responded to every email I sent her - even early the next morning after she had been on a camping trip - and guided us to one of the best beaches we've ever been to.

It's a great place to stay if you're looking for a quiet getaway at the edge of the United States.

Our stay at  Catherine's studio was fabulous. Check in was simple,directions and location easy to find and conveinent.
We had everything we needed for a enjoyable week. I will tell my friends and family to use airbnb for travel plans,and I highly recommend  Catherine's studio.

The studio itself is nice and is exactly as described.
Nice furniture and excellent bed.
The pool and jacuzzi are welcome after a long day of hiking.
The negative point is that it's poorly insonorised and you feel like you share the same room than the neighbours, which is annoying when you have to get up early in the morning.

Great location and the place looks just like the pictures.  It did get warm at times without the AC, so we had to leave the windows open which meant getting some more noise than we had anticipated.  Light sleepers beware--the walls were really thin and heard most of what our neighbors were up to when they were in their homes or walking around.  That said, the rate is great and can't be beat.

The communication with Catherine was very good, she replied always very quick. Our stay at her place was fabulous! It's a very clean and nice appartment. It had everything you needed! we enjoyed the evenings on the balcony. It's located perfectly. the grocery store is not far as well. We will definetly recommend the place to our friends.

We had a excellent time at Catherine's studio. The Check in was easy and convenient. The apartment is very comfortable and we found everything we needed to have a perfect stay. We can highly recommend this place!

My wife and I had a great time in Kauai and we really liked the studio apt/room that we stayed in.  We'd stay there again if we ever go back to Kauai.  Because of our busy schedule during our stay we really only used the apt for eating and sleeping.
Everything in the description of the studio was accurate including the amenities, location, etc.  There isn't any A/C but that didn't bother me at first.  However, the 3 days we were there (early October) was unusually humid so the ceiling fan helped cool things down just enough.

Still overall, we had a great stay!  Thanks Catherine!
Fabulous facility.  Absolutely perfect for our needs.  Communication with Catherine is second to none.
Very clean. As was described. Surrounding noise a bit annoying.
Great place, modern setup, easy to find, and beautiful location!

Catherine was fantastic, she had everything prepped and setup for our honeymoon stay.  The room included many practical supplies such as paper towels, a day cooler, silver ware, and other odds and ends that were quite helpful, even a wine bottle opener!  The bed is ultra comfortable, nice TV, neat clean, well decorated, and has a large shower.  Catherine was very friendly and helpful and we had an amazing stay in Princeville.  if you want to see the real Kauai and pretend you actually live there, this is the place to go!

We had a great time in this Princeville studio! It's a great spot for exploring all the wonderful spots on the north shore and beyond. The bed is super comfy and wifi very fast. It was nice to come back to such a comfortable place at the end of a long day. Would definitely stay again!

This was a cute little room for a great price. Nice balcony to sit out and read a good book on the rainy days. There were many thoughtful extras such as coffee maker, microwave, mini fridge, and beach towels, dishes, TV, toaster-oven etc. The closest laundry mat was in Kapaa which is over a half hour drive south so keep that in mind when you pack. The pool was being renovated while we were there, but no problem since we went to the beach most of the day anyhow. As many other visitors have commented, the noise is an issue. The walls are thin and you can hear every detail in the room next to you. The neighbors at the time were quiet at night so it wasn't a problem for sleeping. The bed was very comfortable. Parking was an issue if you arrive after 8pm when the lot tends to fill up, otherwise plenty of spots during the day. Overall, a great experience!

I stayed in Catherine's condo for three nights in mid February and quite liked it. The roosters (ubiquitous in Kauai) weren't in the vicinity at all, and the bed is super comfortable. Catherine is really great and dependable about communication throughout as well, both before and during my stay there. Highly recommended for singles and couples visiting the north shore.

My partner and I stayed here for a week in August, 2014.  We chose this unit without knowing too much about Princeville or the North Shore. However, we were so happy when we landed. Princeville, while lacking in charm/character, is beautiful and quite close to Hanalei which we spent a lot of time in. There are also beautiful beaches close by which are a bit more secluded compared to the tourist packed ones.  There were lots of conveniences close by so that was handy too.

The unit itself was actually nicer and larger than we thought it was going to be. The lanai was really big too. And like others have said the bed was sooo comfortable. We met Christine briefly during our check-in which was actually a chance encounter as she had mistakenly let another couple into our unit thinking it was us! This was resolved quickly and without issue, but had we arrived later that evening it might have been a problem, as she had emailed us a new code for the lock box and not having a travel plan on my phone I did not get the new code before arriving. We could have arrived late at night, with no access to the lock box and someone else in our unit! Alas, that did not happen.  The phone was not working while we were there which was an inconvenience for us in trying to confirm some things locally.  I emailed Christine to inform her, she said she would look into it but we never heard back, nor did it get fixed during our stay.  Also, a family moved into the until next door during a couple evenings of our stay, who chose to watch movies loudly with all their doors open.  It was essentially like being in a movie theater in our room.  This combined with the sounds from other families/people in the units, makes for a bit of a noisy stay, albeit not all the time.  The one thing we were wishing for though was air conditioning.  We knew the unit did not have any going in, but it was soooo hot.  The fan did nothing to cool things down, so really we did not spend too much time in the room other than to sleep, when it did cool down a bit.

Although we weren't 100% satisfied, for the price per night, this unit was overall a good deal.  We couldn't find anything even close to this price for the space/location. Think about the importance of quiet and coolness before you book, and if they are not must-haves for you, I would say this will be a great space!

Very nice property, especially the pool and hot tub. The suite was great, and very comfortable. The bed and linens were luxurious. The lanai was spacious and nice to sit on. The bar fridge and toaster oven also convenient.
Very nice and clean studio. We had a great time! The equipments are top notch. Definitely recommended :)
The studio was very clean and comfortable. The Sandlpiper condos were in a nice neighborhood and close to Hanalei. I'd stay there again.

We loved how easy it was to check in. With the key lock box we could show up on our schedule and not have to worry about coordinating meeting times. Everything we needed was provided including a cooler and beach chairs which were incredibly useful! The location was ideal for us. Being north shore lovers we were able to easily go to all our favorite spots while bing close to the local grocery store and some very good restaurants in the Princeville area. We would stay here again without a doubt and would recommend this studio to anyone looking for a great location on north shore!

Catherine's studio apartment was central, modern, and ample for two people. Although Catherine's communication was good leading up to our trip, our stay got off to a rocky start when we tried unsuccessfully to access the lock box on the front door with the code she had provided. Initially unable to reach Catherine by phone or text, we stood outside the complex with growing concern, but she eventually returned our call and provided us with the appropriate code. 

Once inside, we could not find the 'local phone' that was advertised in the condo description, but all of the other amenities were as described. The bed was quite comfortable, although the top sheet smelled as if it had not been cleaned recently. The walls were also very thin, so we could hear conversations and television programs from our neighbouring units.

Overall, Catherine's studio apartment in Princeville was a reasonably priced and decent place to stay for a couple of nights. With so much beauty in the nearby north shore of Kauai, these minor issues did not affect the enjoyment inherent in our overall trip.
Great place. A 5 minute drive from the nearest stores or bars but Princeville is pretty small. The room was not too equipped for long stays (no oven, dish soap etc) but was good for a short weekend

The neighborhood was great!  It seemed like everyone had vacation rental.  Airbnb didn't give us the instructions to get the keys to the room, but we called Catherine and she was able to text us.  We didn't realize that check-in wasn't until 3pm, not any earlier.  Important to note that!

Description was accurate. It's a very good deal. Bed was comfortable and you get a lot of "condo" for the price, including access to a hot tub and swimming pool. Place was clean upon arrival. I'd definitely recommend Catherine's place for those looking to stay on the Northshore.
Perfect location! The studio is clean, new and delicious! I truly recommend! Aloha!!!
This place was great for an on the go couple ready to adventure the north side of Kauai!
We had a really excellent stay at Catherine's studio. It was very quiet, clean, and beautiful. We would definitely consider it again if we come back to Kauai.

Catherine opened her door to a great studio for us. The studio is in a great area and has very easy to access many beautiful parts of the island. If you do come in at night the parking can be tough and finding the turn off the main road was difficult in the dark. Plan of (Hidden by Airbnb) maps from the airport. The pool and spa area is a nice touch and is in such close walking distance from the studio. We really loved everything about this. Bed is very comfortable and the studio was a great home base for the many adventures Kaua'i has to offer! Great stay for a great price!
Great place!! The studio was modern and clean- perfect for a base on the north shore.

We had a very enjoyable stay here. The studio was very welcoming and clean. It was very nice that beach/pool towels, dishes, shampoo, etc were provided. We had no issues and it was a very pleasant stay! Thank you!

Catherine's place was conveniently located in Princeville (a really great part of Kauai). The place suited us well for four days, with a nice size and clean studio. The bed is comfortable. There are a few kitchen materials; however, these aren't enough for any real cooking.

We spent a good time in this studio . The place was very nice , newly remodeled and beautifully staged . The host provided all necessities . Large covered balcony worked great for having breakfasts . I wish we had more time to use great community pool .

Although we did not get a chance to meet Catherine, she ensured that our stay was comfortable, enjoyable, and hassle-free. The bed was super comfortable. The apartment was well-equipped, with extras such as dishes, beach towels, a cooler, and beach chairs that made our stay all the more pleasurable. The suite is also situated in a very nice area of Kauai. The drive to the west coast is about two hours so we only visited that area of the island once during our five-day stay, but the north, east, and south shores gave us plenty to see and do. The only downside is that because there are no sealed windows (some of the window are screens with blinds over them), you do hear the roosters crowing quite early in the morning.
Catherine's place was just as described. Very neat and clean. Pool and spa were great, overall the complex was well maintained. Great value!
Very nice place. Great location for the north shore. Close to the Queen's bath which was amazing!

This place is GREAT!  The host is excellent, and the location is pretty alright.

The two things I would like to have known before getting in, there's no freezer (we had to purchase ice for our cooler), and no Air Conditioning (when we were there, the fans were plenty to keep the room at a nice temperature).

Neither of these are deal breakers, though.  We would definitely stay here again.

Fine, little studio with basic amenities to make breakfast. Nice to get beach towels, chairs and a cooler. The area is a resort, so not much personality or cozyness here, but it has a supermarket nearby and is conveniently placed to explore the North Shore. Bring earplugs as the neighbors (and their tv) can be heard easily. We never met Catherine, but our communication was good. Sounded nice with the pool, but we sadly did not have time to try it out during our three days in the studio. Breakfast on the balcony, however, did we do every morning. No vistas at this price range, but it was nice to sit outside.

Wonderful location, beautiful room, all of the necessities are there including beach chairs and a small cooler. Parking can be a problem at night sometimes though, but we were able to work around this easily.

We loved our stay here! The location, amenities, and price were exactly what we were looking for while on vacation in Princeville. The studio was so clean and comfortable. It was also great having access to the hot tub and pool.  We would definitely recommend this space as well as look to book it again for a return visit to Kauai. Mahalo! :)
Great stay! Well kept place. Good location. Very comfortable!

My boyfriend and I rented this space for two nights, we absolutely loved our stay in Princeville! The place was perfect for the two of us and was equipped with everything we needed. The first day was rainy, so we enjoyed time in the hot tub, making friends with the neighbors. There is even a great grill that we used to make some delicious Opah on the second night. Everything  was perfect, thank you!!

Nice studio at a bargain price and close to everything on the north shore. The place was clean and convenient, check in/check out was very easy. Parking wasn't a problem, and the pool was clean. Only issues were that the microwave rotating plate did not fit the model (but I only used the microwave for heating water), and the keurig machine was broken when I arrived. Overall, a relaxing stay in a nice place at a great value. Be aware that there is no freezer and no air conditioning though.

I've never met Catherine in person, but had no problem checking in and out by following the directions she provided. The place is what you see on the pictures, no surprises. I initially liked the look of furniture and the price (not a fan of Hawaiian style when it comes to furnishings). I was not disappointed, it's a tasteful little studio. The bed is very comfortable. Everything worked out great. I would definitely stay there again and I highly recommend you do too.

Perfect location, close to everything. Comfortable studio, comfortable bed and clean bathroom. The lanai was great to enjoy a night cap. We were comfortable with the windows open and ceiling fan. We would definitely come back!

We had a wonderful stay at Catherine's studio.  It was a perfect home base for the 4 days we wanted to explore the north shore of Kauai.  It had everything to make sandwiches to bring with us on our adventures and a small refrigerator to store some snacks.  The bed was comfortable.  We arrived at night and it was  a little confusing but we were able to find our way. Overall we would stay here again, it was lovely.

ok stay, place wasn't anything spectacular but fine for price. walls are very thin, there was a rowdy group next door and we could hear all conversations as if in the same room.

parking was difficult in evenings after sunset, there are a limited number of free spaces while the rest are reserved and we got a ticket from parking on street.

We loved our stay in Kauai this past Memorial Day week. My husband and I stayed in Princeville for the first time. 

Pros: The apt was very cute and met our needs. The bed was SUPER comfortable and the apt was clean, tidy and functional. There were two beach chairs, a cooler and beach towels available to use! The pool and hot tub are located VERY close to the apt. Blue-Ray disc player allowed for a fun movie night! 

Cons: LOUD next door neighbors. We could hear their TV through the walls. LOUD (Website hidden by Airbnb) 5:30am every day. (Note: bring earplugs) Washing dishes in a bathroom sink is hard to do (only sink in the apt). Curtains are inadequate for windows...light pours through at 6am (Note: bring sleep eyewear). Of course, the roosters had already woken us up by that time :) 

All in all, decent place to stay for the price! We will certainly be back.

Place has no AC and host has bad attitude. Host failed to mention in the description of the listing that there was no AC in the unit.  When we arrived to the place and saw there was no AC I called the host. She said that she "did not mention in the listing that the place has AC." Well... she did not mention otherwise either and when I go to a tropical island where the temperature is 85F with extremely high humidity I do expect the AC. Instead of trying to work it out the host said "why don't you just check out right now?" I could not believe my ears! I just flew for 11 hours and that was the welcoming I got! We ended up staying (3 nights) and then moved to Lihue (South of the island). It was impossible to stay inside the place during the day - place would get so hot! We did not like the area either, if you really have to go to the North of the island I would suggest to go in Hanalei area.
Great spot in Princeville! Comfortable bed, easy access to the North Shore from Princeville. Will definitely stay here again, Catherine was super quick to accept our same day reservation.

The studio is clean, comfortable, and cozy, and only a short drive from Hanalei Bay, Queen's Beach, and other North Shore attractions. There is no A/C and no real kitchen (there is a fridge, microwave, and toaster oven), but this was not a problem for us as we spent the afternoons on the beach or eating at several of the great restaurants in the area.

It was a really nice studio. There is enough space for two. We did also enjoy the terasse. The only thing we could complain about, was the fan. It didn't work that strong, so it got really hot in the studio. We did enjoy our stay very much though! Thank you Catherine!!

Exactly as described, matched my expectations and equal value to its cost! Kitchen amenities were just enough to be able to make ourselves simple breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Access to the pool was great too! My only complaint would be that the fan could only move at an awfully slow speed, making it more tortuous to watch than functional. However, the breeze from the balcony door made sleeping easy with little discomfort. Also, the Princeville area is lovely, so glad we were in walking distance to the Queen's Bath since there was such limited parking over there!
Room was as described, easy to access with plenty of parking. This was a great staging ground for our Kauai adventures. Would recommend.

The Studio was perfect for me and my husband. Nicely decorated space and very clean. The ceiling fan stopped working, I called Catherine and it was fixed by the time we got back to our room. Our neighbors were noisy, but overall was a nice place to stay
Very comfortable studio, but very hot despite the fan. Directions to get there were very clear. Thank you!

Great little studio if you plan to be out and about while you're in Kauai. It was very well kept and comfortable with a nice balcony to get fresh air. The only drawback is the lack of AC so check the weather forecast for your visit- it wasn't an issue for our stay at the end of August.

The location is perfect- close to Queen's Bath, St. Regis hotel (great for happy hour) and hikes/beaches on the Na Pali Coast.

Catherine's studio was the perfect budget spot for our vacation. Cozy, comfortable, nice patio, it definitely met our needs.

Perfect location in Priceville, close to the north shore (where you want to be), very close to Hanalei (food, shops, kayaking, everything). Beaches within a 5 minute drive (Hideaways, Queen's Bath,  Sealodge Beach).

Only knock is that it was unseasonably hot in Kauai (a little over 90) during our visit. Way uncomfortable hot really. The fan helped a little, but still, it was too hot to sleep most nights. Most places here don't have A/C, so we didn't anticipate having it, but you might want to pick up an extra fan if it's super hot when you visit (not common).

Nice amenities, like beach towels, MP3 clock for music, beach chairs, a little cooler for your use. We spent 11 nights and found parking in the complex 10 of them. Great pool, hot tub, and BBQ area. Grocery store within a 5 minute drive (albeit an expensive one).

This is a great unit if you're on a budget, and not too particular. A few little awkward things like washing dishes in the bathroom sink, but so minor compared to the splendor of the area. Be aware that you're in a beautiful humid area, so you might find a cockroach or gecko running around inside. It really isn't a big deal. Let it back out. But I know that bothers some people (hotels have them too).

Highly recommended!

When we arrived in the late evening, the appartement wasn't cleaned by the responsible company. After informing Catherine, she managed it very quickly. The bed was pretty comfortable, the "kitchen" was minimal, but everything useful was there.
Very good apartment. Well equipped, clean, balcony, swimming pool, well located,... I recommended you Catherine's apartment

We had a wonderful time staying here. The room was very comfortable and had everything we needed. I really loved the personal touches such as the beach towels, chairs, and cooler. There is a lovely balcony where you can enjoy a cup of coffee. The mattress was very easy to sleep on as well. Great location too! Will definitely be staying here again for our future Kauai visits.

Couldn't have asked for more with this place! The place was in such a nice location, clean and so big for a studio. The ease of checking in and out is a dream, it feels like your own apartment as there is no shared space.

I was a very last minute booking, and Catherine was quick to respond and finalize the booking. The studio is spacious, well equipped and located in the heart of Princeville. I was pleasantly surprised and will return again. This is a great value in a vacation rental Mecca.
Mahalo Catherine!

We spent two nights at the apartment - it was beautiful, very clean and in a safe area. It was spacious and we got to enjoy evenings on the large balcony. It was a great location to explore the north coast of Kauai. We'd happily stay here again.

We had a lovely time, the condo was all that we needed.  The bed and pillows were wonderful and the place was very quiet.  We found the condo to be very clean and inviting and would definitely go back.
Nice and clean place. A bit difficult to to get the key out of the box and open the door. Great location to explore the North (Na Pali coast) of the island.
Very responsive to all requests, no hiccups, great vacation!
Truly perfect place to stay on Kauai! Very beautiful room, comfy bed and very clean! We loved it and recommend it very much!
It's a very nice and clean appartment.

Really good place!!! The studio has an excelent size, with a really confortable bed and facilities as microwave, eletric oven and mini-bar.
