house_rules: Photography and filming must be approved by owner. Location rates are separate and different from overnight guest room rates. Inquire if interested. Gatherings/parties must be approved by owner and event rates may apply. Inquire if interested. Non-guests must be approved by owner before entering house. All personal items must be kept in guest rooms and not in shared spaces. Shared spaces must be left clean at all times, not at the end of your stay. No confetti or glitter allowed. House quiet hours: 11 pm - 8 am (violation will result in additional fee of $100 an hour)

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: We are thrilled to welcome people into our house.  It's just the kind of place that we would want to stay if we were visiting New York! We enjoy meeting interesting, creative and passionate people from around the world and sharing our love of Brooklyn and New York City with them -- the history, food, art, architecture, and music. What we offer is a room in a beautiful house. We are relaxed and welcoming. We ask that our guests make themselves at home (and we do all we can to make them as comfortable as possible). Staying with us is like staying with friends or family (who can cook well). We do not have locks on room doors (although we do fully respect our guest's privacy). This is not a hotel or a bed and breakfast "business" (no teddy bears or pot pourri). It is sometimes elegant and sometimes casual. We like vintage furniture, street art, local food, and all kinds of music ...  an urban sensibility. It's 'real life' in this house -- we have dogs who are enthusiastic greeters, teenagers who are in and out and friends who stop by. That said, we try really hard to make each guest's stay wonderfully memorable. Please read our reviews. We have had amazing guests!

reviews.comments: We want to thank an owner for her hospitality. Everything was very comfortable and the house is very beautiful.

I can't say enough about my and my mom's experience with Doug and Jessica. They were warm, welcoming, accomodating and just plain lovely to spend time with. Their home is exceptional. Exceptionally beautiful, while also being incredibly comfortable and well-thought out both as homeowners and for guests. We loved our accomodations. The neighborhood is a gem. And although I had lived in Manhattan for many years and been to Brooklyn often, I had never been to this little corner of the world and after walking around the neighborhood on a stunning Spring evening, I wondered how I had not known about it before as I would have moved here years ago! If you're coming to NY and you want a memorable experience ~ stay with Doug and Jessica!

Doug was off on business when we arrived but Jessica and her two loveable dogs welcomed us into "Notorious"  like we were old friends. A tour of the home was the first order of business  followed by an engaging chat about art and design over tea in the bright and airy kitchen.  Every room we saw had little treasures to uncover and corners to explore, it was truly a remarkable experience. If you love art and exploration this is like staying at a gallery but you CAN touch and don't necessarily have to take off your shoes, in other words it's a home first, gallery second. 

It was rainy but Jessica gave us ideas on what to see and do in Brooklyn and because I had forgotten a jacket and Jessica leant me hers! She and Doug were very warm and kind hosts and Jessica's fantastic breakfast managed to satisfy us for most of the day! She promised to send me her granola and muffin recipe which she makes up in her head every day...and I'm holding her to it.

Я провела в доме у Джессики и Дага 10 дней.  Дом имеет богатую историю, очень красивый и большой. Дизайн дома прекрасен,сделан с отменным вкусом! Я жила в двух комнатах ,и в каждой из них был неповторимый интерьер,обе были чудесны! В доме живут две симпатичные и дружелюбные собаки. Это был мой первый приезд в НЙ и я была очень рада ,что выбрала аирбнб,т.к я чувствовала себя , как дома! Джессик и Даг очень милые и заботливые люди. Мы быстро подружились и провели вместе пару вечеров. Они очень много интересного рассказывали мне об истории Бруклина и помогали советами. Добираться в другие районы города на метро было очень удобно-метро рядом! Округа очень красивая и безопасная, очень много ресторанов, кафе и баров на любой вкус.Последние два дня со мной провела моя дочь и она тоже была восхищена домом и хозяевами! Мы чувствовали себя очень комфортно и с  удовольствием вернемся туда снова! Джессика и Даг,спасибо вам за гостеприимство и заботу! Надеемся увидеть вас снова! <3
Great house, room, location, and hosts. Very accommodating and helpful. Breakfast was great. Second stay here and will definitely return.

Jessica and Doug's house is really amazing.  Staying with them is a great experience. The house is a historic property and it is really nicely remodeled. The rooms are some of the largest you will see in NYC.  The bathroom is fully renovated and the room is really comfortable. I hope to stay there again soon. Highly recommendable!

Our stay with Jessica and Doug at The Notorious B.N.B. {William H.} room was a superlative experience, and was undoubtedly one of the best airbnb stays of our lives (comparing with the fourteen other places we have booked with airbnb and similar sites these past three years). However, it would be all too easy to place all our accolades exclusively upon the stunning grandeur of this historical and beautifully renovated brownstone. Yes, the place is gorgeous and all the fine details of how so many individual pieces of the home came together in the renovation (as told to us by Jessica and Doug) were endlessly fascinating to hear about and see up close; the ride up to our bedroom floor in one of the oldest operating Otis elevators in New York, being but one of the many cool highlights of our time spent here. But put all of that aside, and you still should want to book one of the rooms at The Notorious B.N.B if only to experience the hospitality of Jessica and Doug. They are truly hosts who have earned their "Superhost" status by not only offering guests an amazing place to stay, but in topping it all off with fantastic service, wonderful breakfasts, and genuine warmth and hospitality that exceeds any expectations one might hold for even a 5-star hotel. As "Superhosts" ourselves with more than 270+ reviews to our own name, we left here with the convictions that (a) we will most definitely be back for a longer stay in The Notorious as soon as possible and (b) we need to kick it up quite a few more notches in our own hosting duties back home, if we are ever to consider ourselves in the same league as Jessica and Doug. Just book it. You will find no better listing—and certainly no better hosts—anywhere else in the world.

We had a lovely time staying in Jessica and Doug's home. It felt more like we were visiting friends. We enjoyed our conversations in the morning over breakfast. Their home was beautiful, peaceful and comfortable and their 2 dogs were very friendly. It would be a pleasure to stay in their home again when we visit New York.

Jessica and Doug were genuine, open and sincere.  They made my daughter and I feel very welcome and pampered.  They always seemed to go beyond any possible expectation, anticipating what we might need and offering wonderful suggestions.  Their breakfasts were lovely and they had a nice balance of interacting with their guests and leaving room for privacy.  Our room was clean and comfortable and had many little added amenities that were both thoughtful and practical.  The area felt very safe and was walking distance to some lovely shops and cafes.  The subway was right outside their door practically which made navigating the city quite easy.  We appreciated the extra efforts they made to connect with us and let us feel like we belonged and were not intruding.  Their home has an interesting history and is grand without being pretentious!  I liked not having a TV in the room, it helped create time to relish the moments.  The elevator was super cool and the art; avant garde,  The dogs added some character and fun... plus they are getting a girl puppy soon so that will create even more excitement.  I had always dreamed of staying in a Brownstone in Brooklyn while visiting New York City, and quite frankly, this was perfection.... completely dreamy and wonderful.  Doug and Jessica made our first Airbnb experience so good; in fact , when we stayed at the Waldorf Astoria on our last night in Manhattan and it was rather disappointing compared :  )   My two final words:  Gorgeous and Delicious!

Lovely and beautiful house and great hosts!
and the two dogs were super friendly and welcoming as well. The weather was pretty bad so me and my friend mostly stayed in our room, and it was cozy and comfortable. The location is great, metro very close by. Breakfast was nice and having a chat with other guests was fun :)  I would love to stay here again next time I am in Brooklyn.

This was our 1st Airbnb experience and Jessica and Doug left a great first impression.  It'd be easy to get jaded from running a busy, successful b&b with a constant barrage of tourists coming and going, but J&D have mastered the fine art of hospitality, being friendly and helpful without being intrusive.  We came back from a family affair on our second evening to find a small outdoor gathering of J&D's friends and much to our delight, J&D invited us to join them and then proceeded to introduce us to some of their very interesting friends and neighbors....plus they shared dinner, dessert and wine with us.  A few nights later, they invited us to watch the democratic debate on TV with them.    This is very different from the faceless anonymity of most lodging situations and imbued our four night visit to Brooklyn with a sense of temporary, welcoming community. Breakfasts were simple (but  ample and delicious) continental with fresh, warm bread, strawberries, blueberries and homemade muffins and biscuits -- shared with other interesting, international travelers.  We had driven our car to Brooklyn, loaded with two bikes and appreciated that the parking was secure and without added costs.  Over the four days of our visit, we biked every day - Central Park, across the Brooklyn Bridge to Manhattan and the High Line, to Brooklyn Botanical Gardens (free on Tuesday AM) and to the Brooklyn Grange rooftop farm.  Biking is a great way to see NYC!  The area around the Notorious BnB has tons of interesting restaurants that are within easy walking distance.   All in all, this is a great base for touring NYC and is highly recommended.

A fantastic place! We were welcomed to this beautiful brownstone by Jessica and her friendly dogs and swept away by this very unique space. From the art work to the wood work, there is something to admire in every room. The bathrooms, bedrooms and common spaces are all tastefully decorated for the guests' pleasure and Doug and Jessica were welcoming hosts with great tips for how best to get the Brooklyn experience. We were lucky enough to be there for both Halloween and the New York Marathon, reason enough to visit this neighborhood alone! Costumes and Haunted Houses like you wouldn't believe, a Zombie Jazz Band and a Gospel Choir cheering on the runners- all within walking distance of the Notorious B.N.B. The breakfast was set each day with a delicious array of fresh fruit, bread, pastries and cereals. We appreciated the graciousness with which Jessica and Doug welcomed us into their home and would definately recommend this unique Brooklyn Brownstone experience!

The place was awesome and we had a wonderful time. Jessica and Doug both were so friendly and Doug made the best muffins. It is to die for I must say. All in all in the 4 days that we were here we must give these guys a thumbs up !!!!!

I had a wonderful stay at The Notorious B.N.B. Usually I stay in hotels when I visit New York and this was a different experience allowing me to feel more like a resident than a visitor. It was near where my daughter lives so it was easy for me to join her for a walk to the park and experience Brooklyn. I also enjoyed the opportunity to visit with Jessica and Doug, as well as, the other guests.

The accommodations were wonderful, a beautifully restored brownstone with wonderful art. Breakfast was good including the best blueberry muffins I have ever eaten!

Absolutely loved this beautiful place and hope to return again and again. Doug and Jessica are wonderful -- true fixtures in the neighborhood -- and the brownstone is so calm and peaceful, not to mention exquisitely designed and decorated. The tiniest, most beautiful details come to light here -- from the locally made soap and toiletries in the bathroom, on down to the fact that they did my laundry after two weeks away. This just could not be a better oasis tucked away in Brooklyn. Could not recommend more highly, this is a really special place.

This was our first Airbnb experience, and it was fabulous !  We would highly recommend staying with Jessica and Doug. They are incredibly friendly, open, interesting and so comfortable. We got the chance to get to know each other a bit, chatting over breakfast and playing games in the evening. They opened their home to us as if we were friends in from out of town.

We really appreciated all the care and beauty they have put into their home. It is gorgeous and spacious and impeccably designed. In addition, they serve the most amazing breakfast, with delicious homemade breads, muffins and granola. Our son especially enjoyed being greeted by their 2 sweet dogs. Having previously lived in Manhattan and Brooklyn, we found the location to be very convenient. Clinton Hill is a great neighborhood with beautiful architecture and great restaurants. 

Thank you Doug and Jessica for a fantastic experience. We look forward to our return.

Jessica & Doug were the perfect hosts in an exquisite home. They provided top notch hospitality as well as knowledge on the local area and on their historic brownstone home. The accommodations were very clean and breakfast was delicious! We cannot stop telling our friends and family what a wonderful experience we had. Definitely stay here if you are considering, you will not regret it!

The hosts, Jessica, Doug, Knuckie and Klaus(?) were gracious, friendly, informative and totally attentive to our every needs.  The house is historic with hosts that know every aspect of the history of the neighborhood. Doug modified the scrumptious breakfast daily to accommodate our preferences. Their attention to details make the stay memorable and magical.

I booked this listing for my parents to stay during their visit, as I live down the street. My parents have only really spent time in Manhattan, and I wanted to give them the full Brooklyn experience in a classic and breathtaking townhouse. Jessica and Doug were so accommodating and lovely. They communicated very well and even personally called my dad to make sure he was OK with the 60 stair walk up. My parents said they had the most incredible hand-made breakfast and seriously enjoyed their stay. The bed was comfortable and the shower was nice. Jessica decorated the house so beautifully that it made it a unique and magical Brooklyn experience I was hoping for.

Jessica & Doug have done an incredible job restoring this beautiful townhouse and Jessica has a great eye for interiors. Since we stayed I've been recommending it non-stop, even to people who live in NY - it's the perfect place to take a mini-holiday in your own city. I booked this for my parents who were visiting and they loved it but would also love to go back myself for a weekend.

I reserved Jessica and Doug's beautiful airbnb for my parents first visit to Brooklyn. My parents had a great stay and had nothing but positive things to say about Jessica and Doug and their incredible home. The Notorious B.N.B. is truly a one-of-a-kind, and it's a great location to enjoy all that Brooklyn has to offer.  I would highly this airbnb, and would book it again for any visitors to the area.

Gorgeous! One of the most beautiful,  spacious and interesting homes I've even seen with friendly hosts in an ideal, convenient location...especially perfect if you have relatives visiting! Highly recommended!

My fiancé and I stayed with Jessica and Doug at their beautiful house in Clinton Hill. The pictures don't do it justice ! Our bedroom was everything we could want: comfortable, clean & private. 
Doug & Jessica put on a delicious breakfast & were very helpful with local info & good places to see. 
We especially LOVED the dogs :)
The host canceled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated posting.

My experience of our stay at Jessica's place rather neatly sums up why I use AirBnB. I can't recommend this as a stay more. The beautiful, gorgeously renovated, large home was a block and a half from the G line subway which was an easy 3 minute walk. The room we had was large with huge windows overlooking a tree lined street and had its own attached modern en suite bathroom with a bonus treat of art on the walls. There is a lift to help with those heavy cases. The 2 dogs were welcoming and enthusiastic about becoming friends! Jessica made us a lovely breakfast made all the more delicious by her exquisite selection of hand made and designer mugs and napkins etc. We sat and talked over breakfast about New York, about art and music, about the history of this building. I'm rather looking forward to staying here again one day and perhaps organizing a dinner banquet for New York friends on that 26 seater dinning table. The only negative i can think of is that the G subway line crosses Brooklyn and doesn't connect to Manhattan but a switch to the L line is easy at the Metropolitan station. The place cost slightly more than my initial budget but is totally worth it and I'm so glad we just went with it. I'm sorry we didn't get to meet Doug. Thank you Jessica for the perfect stay for us to end our New York trip with. I do hope we meet again someday.

My husband stayed here while on a business trip.  He was within walking distance of all his meetings and two blocks away from our daughter.  Jessica made him welcome even before he arrived.  Their home is beautifully and comfortably appointed, with every detail carefully thought out.  He particularly enjoyed chatting over common interests with a glass of wine in the afternoon.  He doesn't often enthuse over accommodations, but this was an experience of warmth, comfort and ease while being able to take care of business.  Thank you so very much.
loved the neighborhood, great restaurants nearby, friendly neighbors, just perfect

We are so happy to have chosen this gorgeous house this weekend!  The room was spotless, bed was super comfortable, plush towels, awesome neighborhood and the breakfast was amazing.  Not one thing lacking.  Thank you for making our very first Airbnb experience so wonderful!  We'll be back for another visit soon!

Jessica and Doug made our 23rd wedding anniversary feel extra special. Jessica's interior design expertise was evident on every wall and surface in every nook and cranny... Everywhere, inside their home, there was something lovely and interesting to look at. Both Jessica and Doug are art collectors and their home feels like both a well curated gallery and a high end boutique hotel. Breakfast was spectacular- smoked paprika creme fraiche with those potatoes? So yummy. And Jessica not only accommodated my gluten allergy-- she dazzled me with her delicious GF cake. And their recommendations for local activities/restaurants were helpful too- we had a great time at the Brooklyn Botanical Gardens and the Greek restaurant listed in their Airbnb info. Thanks so much, Jessica and Doug!

My girlfriend's parents had never been to Brooklyn before - so when they finally decided to come and visit us for a weekend I wanted to make sure they stayed somewhere that would help impress upon them just how lovely our slice of Brooklyn can be.   Luckily enough for me, the Notorious B&B was exactly what the doctor ordered - and Jessica and Doug went out of their way to make sure my girlfriend's parents had a great stay.  I can't thank them enough!

I have stayed at Notorious B.N.B. before. You can't beat the accommodations or the location. Jessica was wonderful with recommendations, the other guests were really interesting, and all my needs were met. I was on a very demanding business trip this time and there is nothing like coming back each evening and feeling like you are at home. Thank you!
Great welcome and keen interest shown in what attracted us to this part of the world.  Eager to share knowledge and make for what will be a long remembered stay!

The Notorious B.N.B along with the William Henry room was absolutely perfect. If you are looking for a place to feel welcome and appreciate the design and history of brownstones, this is your place. We met Rachelle who showed us around the home when we first arrived and Doug, who was so kind and great to talk with - I think we ended up talking with him for a good hour at breakfast. The point is, these are great people who open up there home and make you feel part of it. It doesn't get much better and we appreciate it. Greatly.

This is a big league Airbnb listing! The house is full of character and charm - in ambience and people. Rachelle was a great house manager and put out a nice spread for breakfast. She also gave fantastic recommendations for food and drinks for our one night stay (Jordan helped). Jessica was warm and inviting and even showed us plans for the new garden - we'll have to come back to see it all finished (it looks worthy of the house). And the house is incredible. It's full of details that would be near impossible to replicate today. It's easy to get to from Penn Station and in an excellent neighborhood.

10/10 would do it again.

I have left a raving review before so I will keep this one short. The place is beautiful and in a great location and the owners are very welcoming and considerate. Another great stay here. I will definitely be back again.

I stayed with my bf 3 nights and we had a memorable stay at the notorious BNB! This house is a dream house. We were amazed by the attention Jessica puts in every details of the fantastic deco of her house but also in the service she provides to her guests: delicious products (some home-made) served for breakfast, very comfy mastress, qualitative bedding, a great list of places to go in the neighborhood... We didn't know Fort Green/ Clinton Hill and we loved it. It's residential but also super lively, we found tones of great places at walking distance, nothing was missing (good coffee, resto, bars...). We really recommend this place and this neighborhood!

This is the second year in a row staying with Jessica and Doug. It was just as we remembered it - the rooms are beautifully decorated, Jessica and Doug are warm and friendly, their dogs are adorable, and breakfast is delicious. The neighborhood is convenient to get into Manhattan, and has great bars and restaurants if you don't want to go into Manhattan. We will definitely be back next year.

Jessica and Doug have an absolutely stunning home. The pictures do not do justice to the interior design; there are no details gone unfinished. The neighborhood is amazing and Doug was able to provide helpful recommendations for bars and restaurants. Breakfast was also delicious. Thanks for the great stay!

Jessica and Doug live in a wonderfull house with an excellent interior. We had a large and very nice room with a pretty bathroom. Jessica made for us every day a delicious breakfast with homemade granola! We had a really great time there. Thank you so much, J+D
5 star across the board
Perfect stay, So comfortable! The house is absolutely stunning. Can't wait to be back this week!
It was a perfect spot for the weekend. Kind, generous hosts and a beautiful home.

I would recommend this BNB and I would stay again myself. Beautiful home. Our room was gorgeous; loved the original cherry wood every where. Bed was comfortable. Jessica was very  friendly and breakfast was fabulous! 5-star rating

We stayed at Jessica's for only a couple of days and by the end we didn't want to leave! We were made to feel right at home in the house - chatting over breakfast (which was delicious) in the mornings and throughout our stay. It was not only amazing to stay in such a beautiful home, but also to get a proper feel for the neighbourhood we were staying in; Jessica had some great tips for the area and seemed right in touch with the local community! We would love to come back.

Wow.  This was a spectacular Airbnb experience.  We've both been to NYC many times and used Airbnb frequently.  Our experiences have been great, but this was the best yet!  Jessica and her two doggies are very warm and inviting yet totally unobtrusive.  The room and entire house are (Website hidden by Airbnb) enormous!  And the included breakfast was topnotch.  The neighborhood is also lovely and quieter than much of the city.  It was pleasant to return there after our very long days in Manhattan.  The only downside for us was that it did feel like we were on the subway a lot, as our travel plans were all over Manhattan...but I think returning to a peaceful, beautiful place was worth it :).  Thank you, Jessica!

The home is very pretty, quiet and inviting.  Jessica was very friendly and communicative.  She was also very accommodating with special requests.  If you are not used to climbing a lot of steps, you will be doing that here.  But, most of NY is like that, so her home is not unusual.  She does bring your bags upstairs on a lift, so that is helpful.  I would definitely stay there again.

We loved every minute of our stay at the brown stone.  It is such a beautiful property.  The house is filled with wonderful artwork. Jessica was a lovely host and we felt extremely welcome in their home.  We also loved the neighborhood.  We walked to restaurants and shopping.  We hope to go back again. Love Brooklyn!

My friend and I were able to stay for one night at The Notorious BnB and our only complaint is that we didn't get to stay longer!  

A stunning and rare mansion in Brooklyn with intelligent and highly tasteful decor that provided a warm and inviting setting.  The shower in our room was awesome!  The beds were super comfortable, even the rollaway.  As cool and amazing as the house was, the best part was Jessica our host.  She was super communicative and helpful from the moment I inquired about booking to even after we left.  She made every effort to let us check in early and prepared a great breakfast for us in the morning.  We shared a nice conversation and she even sent us some cool underground events in the city for us to check out.  It was a very cool and memorable stay for us and we will definitely be back.  

Five stars all the way!

Thank you Jessica!

This is a beautiful and exceptional property, and Jessica has provided so many extra and thoughtful touches. Breakfast included a great range of offerings and many of the dishes were specially prepared that morning. I loved the room with its high windows and light, its gorgeous woodwork, and the comfortable bed with lovely linens. The bath and all its fixtures were new and gracious. Throughout the home is beautiful art. Jessica communicates so well and is supportive. I will be looking for ways to return soon!
This place is amazing if you’re ever in New York and want to experience brownstone class this is great

We spent most of our time in Manhattan during our four day stay. Needless to say we spent some time and money to get through traffic, but Jessica's place is so beautiful and comfortable that it was totally worth it. The whole place is super clean and the amenities were great! We had a lovely time living there~

Jessica's home is so beautifully styled, she is so welcoming and had great tips on where to eat. Jessica also made sure that my stay was comfortable, adjusting the heating and catering great breakfast options. I would definitely recommend staying at Jessica's and exploring Brooklyn.

Loved staying here while in Brooklyn! The pictures don’t do this place justice! Jessica was a great host and had great recommendations in Brooklyn and in the city! Would absolutely stay here again! PS - Jessica makes the best coffee cake I have ever had in the morning!! Don’t miss it!

We really enjoyed staying and Jessica's place, the house looks even more majestic than from the pictures with every detail thought through and in harmony. We also enjoyed the quiet mornings at the breakfast table with delicious food prepared by Jessica herself, Christmas tree in the living room added to the warm festive feeling while we had one of the coldest New Year's Eve's in NYC. Subway is just a few steps from the house and express train takes you almost directly either to Times Square or JFK airport.

IF your looking for an amazing experience in where you stay in NY than this is the place to stay. The details and the beauty of this home will leave such an impression on you. I loved the creativity of the space and every where you turned there was something that triggered a conversation. We loved it! When in BK this is the place to stay!

Jessica is a warm and welcoming host. Her home is beautiful and enormous. The home is so large that if there are other guests you may not even notice anyone is there except perhaps over
Jessica’s very nice continental breakfast.  The rooms are very clean and well appointed.
This was my second stay at Jessica’s and I enjoyed my stay both times.

Unbelievable. This is one if he most unique, beautiful and well kept homes I have ever visited. Jessica was a pleasure to organize a trip with and was prompt to answer any question we had. The rooms were meticulously organized and clean and the beds were comfy. The art in her home is definitely museum quality with a couple massive swoon pieces which blew us away. 

I will be coming back with my fiancé in the near future and will do everything I can to book again. 

Thanks Jessica.

This house is a stunning gem inside. It’s worth staying just to walk around the living room spaces. It was unfortunate that there were plumbing problems in our room and we had to be moved, but each room has its own character and is equally beautiful. This is a great way to experience Brooklyn.

Jessica was an amazing host! The stay and the accommodations were even more lovely than we had imagined. The pictures simply don't do it justice!! We were looking for a space to have a private wedding ceremony, and Jessica welcomed our family with open arms. We felt like royalty! We stayed with her for 4 nights. Each room has it's own unique vibe, and the staff were extremely helpful as we pulled off a beautiful wedding! My husband is vegan, and Jessica even prepared a vegan-friendly breakfast cake for us. We truly could not have found a better place to experience such a special time in our lives.

This was my second time to Jessica’s gorgeous house in Clinton Hill. This time I came for a longer stay and could feel the neighborhood vibe which I loved even more than my first time. The area is growing with a wide range of restaurants and shops, all of them very fancy with great food and music. We got to visit Detroit too in the middle of our stay, Jessica’s hometown, so again as the great hostest she is, she gave us lots of tips to visit and great stories about the city. Jessica is a very professional hostess and handles any situation with great expertise. She's a great woman. Wise and interesting. I really wish she comes and visit us in Spain to show her wonderful places and treausures I'm sure she'll love!

A rare find! Not many people get to experience this type of accommodation in NYC. It was stunning to say the least. Jessica was a fabulous host. She was attentive and helpful, but gave us our complete privacy. Breakfast was delicious. A wonderful experience all round.

I've spent a few more days at Jessica's on my way back from Detroit. I can only say the same as before: wonderful stay, great memories, best neighborhood and a very professional hostess! Definetely a 5 stars experience.

We had a few nights at Jessica's gorgeous brownstone after a few days in Manhattan. What a glorious contrast!

Brooklyn is a wonderful place to spend some time, and Jessica's place is the ideal base to explore it from. 

Besides the beautiful accommodation, which you can tell from the photos, we loved the really comfy bed, great shower, delicious breakfast (unsure if the best bit was the coffee, the cake, or, honestly, the granola(!)), and gracious hosting from Jessica. The internet was great too, I really appreciated that wasn't skimped on.
Key word hospitality

The rich ambiance, iconic sun-filled rooms, massive stained glass windows, an amazing chandelier, the original wood floors in the living room... a perfect blend of historic and modern.  The interior design details in every room really caught my attention.  But nothing beats walking down the stairs for breakfast to find a huge room with a spacious table covered in Jessica's homemade goodies.  I'm a coffee snob, so I greatly appreciated freshly ground beans in the French press to sip with her perfect berry scones and jam.  The conversations with Jessica and my fellow guests really made me feel welcomed.  And Jessica is a fantastic host, made all of her guests feel like we are visiting family.

Beautiful place, much better in real life than what you might expect from the pictures. Loads of art and design everywhere. Loved the shower and bathroom. Plus the beds are super comfortable, as Jessica has specifically chosen everything for comfort down to the mattress pad! And the location is great, near Pratt for context, and within walking distance of some great food.

Living the Brooklyn dream...
If you want to enjoy Brooklyn (and Manhattan, of course) - look no further! Jessicas house is breathtaking - very tastefully and high-end furnished, lots of beautiful art everywhere. Our bedroom on the third floor was huge with a comfortable bed, nice linens and a spacious shower. 
There is breakfast early in the morning (bread, cooked eggs, yoghurt, fresh fruit, granola) where you will sometimes meet other guests, which we enjoyed.  
Communicating with Jessica was easy and quick, we found her very accommodating. 
This is a very special place to spend a few nights and explore the area. 
We´d come back in a heartbeat!

This is the best AirBnB we ever had. The house is more beautiful than the pictures. Convenient location with easy metro access (G train stop is only two blocks away). Nice walk around the neighborhood to enjoy the Brooklyn's townhouse architecture and local restaurants.  Enjoy the delightful breakfast every morning prepared by Jessica! So if you can find the available dates you want,  just go. You will not be disappointed.

5 Stars! Staying at the Notorious BNB was one of the best travel experiences I’ve had. Excellent communication, beautiful apartment, easy check-in and out. Would absolutely recommend and look forward to visiting again. Thanks for a great stay!
We loved our stay with Jessica!  Her home is so unique and interesting. Jessica was extremely accommodating and thoughtful. The coffee cake and homemade granola were awesome! Thank you!
Room was great.
We have stayed at Jessica’s beautiful house multiple times over the last 7 years. She is a gracious hostess and makes sure that her guests are comfortable.

The house is very grand, and the rooms and dramatic and very comfortable. 
Jessica was an amazing host, and very flexible about my arrival time, which was quite late due to a delayed flight.  She provided great customer service, and promptly addressed any questions I had or issues that came up.   I will definitely stay there again!

Philip

Jessica's space is amazing! Truly a unique and special airbnb. The neighbourhood is very safe and there is lots close by while still offering easy access to the city center via subway. Jessica was very accommodating and I'd happily recommend her place to anyone visiting NYC.

This place is a rare gem.  I use Airbnb whenever I travel and I really loved this place.  The photos are of the common areas on the first floor and rooms are up higher.  Each is decorated to the highest style and each is a different.  Jessica is an interior designer and her place reflects her talent.

There's a beautiful table set each morning for a lovely breakfast.  We had homemade coffee cake, crusty bread, fresh fruit, yogurt, granola, coffee.

Jessica, thoroughly enjoyed your warm and welcoming home again. Being my second time staying you made me feel like I’m in the family. You have a natural gift for making people feel welcomed. Life is too short and precious not to stay at a place that feels like home. Thank you for the passion you put into your home. It is truly a special place on the Earth. See you next time.

Staying in Jessica’s home was truly a one-of-a-kind experience. The space is even more beautiful than you could imagine from the photographs. You can tell from the moment you step into the home the level of attention and intention that was put in to restoring this Brownstone, and throughout our stay there we kept finding little things that we loved about the place and how it was designed and decorated. But despite this level of design, it still felt like we could be comfortable and at home there. My friends and I were tempted to even just spend the night in because we loved the comfort of our rooms so much. 

I can’t wait to stay here again. 

P.S. I’d definitely recommend having breakfast there at least once during your stay. It was delicious (I loved the coffee cake!) and Jessica was very gracious in considering everyone’s dietary restrictions. Breakfast there was the perfect way to start our day.

Jessica's house is absolutely amazing. The most beautiful home and the most thoughtful and helpful host. The house is amazing and Jessica's eye for design and hospitality are everywhere. Comfortable, cozy beds, beautiful bathrooms, all the amenities you could wish for and a delicious breakfast served in her dining room. I felt comfortable and at home the entire time. I look forward to returning!

Jessica’s home is stunning and beautifully appointed. It was a treat to stay there for a night. While there are multiple guest rooms, we did not run into other guests during our stay and enjoyed the privacy. Jessica was responsive and made check-in and departure quick and easy. We would definitely stay at her home again!
Wonderful. Thank you!
It was such a joy to connect with Jessica and this space that she has nurtured with care and class.
Fantastic place to stay! Great neighborhood with easy parking and close restaurants near by. House is over the top amazing and def worth the visit.  Highly recommend it! -Angela
My husband and I had a very enjoyable stay. Jessica had lots of helpful tips for our trip and made our stay extra special.

We had never been inside a brownstone, so it was a particular treat to stay in Jessica's home. The photos show a small slice of a beautiful home. The bed was comfortable and all the amenities were seen to. Breakfast was delicious with just the right combination of good foods and company. We hope to stay again when visiting our daughter.
Jessica’s home is incredible.  She’s such a welcoming host and my stay was about as perfect as could be.  This is THE place to stay when in Brooklyn.

Thank you Jessica for offering one do the most extraordinary Airbnb experience and hospitality for my mother and I in New York.  Jesscia’s glorious brownstone in brooklyn is an architectural gem that features meticulously curated interior in a living room with stunning ceiling heights - that exemplifies the grandest of townhouse living and  inspires awe in all its guest. 

What makes the experience most special and memorable is the opportunity to meet guest at the breakfast table from all corners of the world for fascinating conversations over a delicious breakfast prepared by every morning by Jessica herself - from fresh organic yogurt and fruits of local origins to artisanal sourdough bread - it is one of the most fulfilling breakfast that will sure inspire the rest of your day.  

Finally, communication with Jessica is clear, courteous and responsive - she aims to make every guest feel comfortable and at home - and share with guest the best of restaurants and event her neighborhood offers to guest.  

Thank you for offering such an exceptional gift of experience to the Airbnb community - and very much look forward to the opportunity to be back soon!
One-of-a-kind Airbnb in the most beautiful brownstone. Our room was  comfortable and spotlessly clean!  Do not miss the complimentary breakfast- all cooked from scratch, fresh and delicious!
Jessica’s house is beautiful and the location was great! We very much enjoyed our stay! Thank you Jessica!

Hands down the best we’ve stayed in. Not only have they accommodated us with late check out, but the cleanliness and comfortable feel of the house overall. Absolutely recommend and would stay here again without hesitation.

name: Modern, Cozy & Bright Private Room and Bathroom
summary: A modern, cozy and bright 2 bedroom / 2 bathroom. Thats right, as a guest you will have your own private bath ! Everything you will need is provided. Apartment is located in Fort Greene with easy access to the park, great restaurants, coffee shops.
space: Modern, cozy and bright one bedroom and bathroom available in a two bed/two bathroom apartment. The room includes a desk, dresser and closet with hangers for your use. Also, the guest will have their own private bathroom with bathtub and shower. Kitchen has been nicely renovated and can be used by guest.
description: A modern, cozy and bright 2 bedroom / 2 bathroom. Thats right, as a guest you will have your own private bath ! Everything you will need is provided. Apartment is located in Fort Greene with easy access to the park, great restaurants, coffee shops. Modern, cozy and bright one bedroom and bathroom available in a two bed/two bathroom apartment. The room includes a desk, dresser and closet with hangers for your use. Also, the guest will have their own private bathroom with bathtub and shower. Kitchen has been nicely renovated and can be used by guest. Guest will have their own private, full bathroom, and can use the refrigerator, stove, cutlery, dishes, etc. Wifi/Internet is included with the price. I am typically available throughout the stay as I live in the other bedroom. I have my own private bathroom so the other bathroom is for the use of guest. I ask that guest contact me via the app, or text me if they have any issues at all. I want to make sure everyone has an amazing stay. Fort
neighborhood_overview: Fort Greene is a great neighborhood - tons of restaurants, coffee shops and most of all Fort Greene Park. Easy walk to all the other great Brooklyn neighborhoods, or quick bike ride or subway ride to Manhattan. Citibike is on both corners of Carlton so easy access if you want to take a ride.
transit: Citibike is located on both corners. Multiple train lines within 10/15 minute walk.
access: Guest will have their own private, full bathroom, and can use the refrigerator, stove, cutlery, dishes, etc. Wifi/Internet is included with the price.
interaction: I am typically available throughout the stay as I live in the other bedroom. I have my own private bathroom so the other bathroom is for the use of guest. I ask that guest contact me via the app, or text me if they have any issues at all. I want to make sure everyone has an amazing stay.
house_rules: 1. I ask that guest please take shoes off at the entrance. I try to keep the place spotless and zen.  2. I ask that guest wash any dishes right after use. 3.  Please make sure to lock the front door. Finally, if you would like to use the desk please use the one in the guest bedroom.  4. Please do not use, or place items on the wood desk in the common area as it easily stains and marks.  Other than that, make my place your home!

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: Dining out, movies, art, hiking, reading, writing, fitness, museums and traveling .

reviews.comments:
I was your first Airbnb and you were mine, and i can hardly imagine that i will once have a better airbnb experience! 

The room and bed is great, lots of privacy and space, even for all my suitcases!
The own bathroom is also great, everything you will need is there! I told Steve that the showerhead needed a replacement, but my guess i that he did that the same day;)

The location is great for trips to newyork and brooklyn! The walk to the subway is about 8 minutes, but i sincerely recomment to take a city bike, which is located just around the corner. With the bike Steve's house is a great startingpoint for a bike trip across the brooklyn bridge and manhatten! 

If you are as lucky as I was, Steve might even show you his amazing cooking skills and you can enjoy a marvelous dinner with this amazing host!

I can only say, if you see this add... Pack your bags strait away and fly out to meet Steve!

I'll return to New York for sure, and when i do.. I already know where i'm gonna go.

I wish you the best Steve!
Cheers

Had an absolutely wonderful stay with Steve. He is so welcoming, kind, accommodating and generous. Wifi great, bed and bedding very comfortable, location is a block from a fabulous area and there are fantastic transport options. He is so helpful with giving advice and directions, would highly recommend!
Steve is a great host - very responsive and thoughtful! He left us tons of information and greeted us when we arrived. The room is just as pictured , very bright, cosy and comfortable!

We enjoyed staying at Steve's apartment.
Pros
The apartment is about 10 min from the subway station, it takes approximately another 20 min to get to the Central Park.
We had our own bathroom.
The apartment was quite clean, we had really nice bedsheets and towels.
Steve is a very nice host, he answered all our questions really quickly, he helped us with our luggage and we had 2 fresh cinnamon rolls waiting for us on our first day. 
It was a great value deal.

Cons
The area where the building is situated is a bit industrial, but it takes just a few minutes to get to a nice neighborhood.
We had no cold water in the sink, but Steve was going to get it fixed. It wasn't crucial for us, but if it is for you check this with Steve.

We enjoyed staying at the apartment and would definitely recommend it as a great value deal.

Steve has been a great host: welcoming and helpful.
The room is bright, clean and quiet.
It definitely would recommend it to anyone coming to NY.

Restaurant close to Steve's place: Thaiolic

Steve was a great host: welcoming and helpful and responsive. 
The room is just as on pictures,  bright, clean and comfortable!
Apartment is not far away from downtown Brooklyn where you could find all sorts of connections to the rest of the city.

I just spent two amazing weeks at Steve's apartment. Steve is a great person, very kind, helpful and laid back. He gave me a lot of privacy and made me feel like at home. His apartment is very cozy, the room was great, large, very bright with comfortable bed and air condition. A big advantage was a private bathroom. The location is great, very close to Manhattan and there are a lot of bars and restaurants in walking distance. I highly recommend this place and want to thank Steve for everything, I had a great time! :-)
Steve is a warm and welcoming host. The room he provided was very clean and bright. He gave us some tips about the neighborhood and was extremely helpful.
Steve was a wonderful host, the space is super clean and comfortable. Definitely would recommend and stay again!

Steve was so welcoming and helpful. For anyone travelling to New York for the first time, I highly recommend staying with Steve. He made us feel very at home. He even left some delicious chocolate croissants for us! Thanks for a great stay Steve!!!

My boyfriend and I spent one night at Steve's place. He was a great host from the get-go - very responsive to questions and messages. Upon arrival, the room was immaculate and as pictured. We also had a private bathroom and our own AC window box. Steve was so welcoming and made us feel at home! The area is up and coming, but entirely safe. We had no issues walking around, even during the wee hours of the morning. While we did not spend a lot of time in Brooklyn, what we did experience was great. Some of the best restaurants and shops are within walking distance from Steve's. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it to anyone looking for an affordable stay in NYC!!!

Steve's apartment was really lovely, exactly as the listing showed - clean, bright and comfortable. Steve was a brilliant host, giving us lots of information about the local area and things to do. Fort Greene is a great area to be staying in, with lots of bars, restaurants and cafes to hang out in as well as in close proximity to Prospect Park, Atlantic Avenue Mall and with easy access to Williamsburg and Manhattan. Would love to stay here again!

The room was exactly as advertised and Steve turned out to be a great host. We had really good conversations and quite a lot of laughs. There's nothing bad I could say about the apartment or the neighbourhood. Public transportation and a great variety of good places to eat and drink out are just a short walk away. It's really easy to go to Manhattan in just a couple of Minutes, too.
The room and the bathroom were very clean and Steve provided me with towels, internet access, subway map, restaurant and bar locations and even a welcome doughnut!

Our stay at Steve's place was great! He was very friendly and welcoming, and gave us lots of great info about the city. The accommodations were exactly as described, and we usually had the place to ourselves when we were there. The location was great- on the edge of a nice area of Brooklyn and easy access by subway or bus into Manhattan.
Wonderful place to stay at New York. Steve is a nice guy he put a lot of thoughts in this (Website hidden by Airbnb) to all of you.

Steve is a very gentle and helpful host, he accommodated all our requests and provided us valuable advices and hints to enjoy the experience. the apartment itself could use some update, but overall it was decent size, clean and having a private bathroom is a luxury in NYC.
The location is good, but the apartment is located a little bit (like 100m) outside the best neighborhood, but we never felt unsafe or anything, and metro, bars and restaurants were all walking distance.
Overall we were very satisfied.

Steve was a great host. Super nice. He gave us a map and a list of recommendations for bars/restaurants in the neighborhood, which was very handy. He thought about everything, and even gave us a european power plug adapter!

The room was exactly like in the picture, nice and clean. There was also AC. The bed was very comfy.

The only negative thing I can say is about the location: the street is very industrial and dirty, and can feel a bit uncomfortable. That being said it's a 5 minute walk to a very nice neighborhood, a 15 minute walk to the subway station, and the restaurants on deKalb avenue are great.

Me and my wife spent 4 days in this apt. 
It was clean and 100% as in pictures.
Steve has been a great host!
Steve was a realy helpful, nice and welcoming host. The Apartment was exactly as shown in the pictures!

We stayed at Steve's apartment for one week. He is a nice guy and provides a lot of helpful information about the neighborhood. We did not see Steve a lot but when we met him, we always had a nice conversation and he gave us some advice for interesting things to do.

From the apartment you can reach the subway in a short 15 minute walk to go to Manhattan or other parts of Brooklyn. Nice coffeeshops (Bittersweet on Dekalb Ave has great coffee and doughnuts to start your day), restaurants and stores are just a couple of blocks away.

The room as well as the rest of the apartment were very clean. The room also has an own air condition. The close-by highway is a little bit noisy.
Great neighbourhood only a short walk away - great value for the price!

Das Zimmer sieht genauso aus wie hier beschrieben. Das Zimmer ist gepflegt und sehr sauber. Ein Bad kann man als Gast allein benutzen. Steve ist ein sehr freundlicher und großartiger Gastgeber. Die Ankunft und die Abreise war problemlos. Wegen des starken Regens zu dieser Zeit half er mit einem großen Regenschirm aus. Ein Geheimtip, wenn man in sehr angenehmer Weise in Brooklyn übernachten möchte.
Steve was a great host. Gave great info about the area. Very nice room in a great location in walking distance to downtown Brooklyn.  Would definitely stay there again.

Steve was a great host! He was very nice, gave us a lot of information about the area, restaurants, bars, etc. He even drew us a map. The room was clean and as shown in the photos. There was also AC, which was nice. There were a lot of restaurants and cafes a 5 minute walking distance from the apartment. All in all, a great experience.

Steve was a great host and full of awesome ideas for restaurants and cafes. He also was more than willing to help us find local shops like random stationary places. And if he didn't readily know the answer he would search for it and text you later with a response. Upon arrival he also helped orient us to the neighbourhood and the nearby subway (15 minute walk). Overall a good experience.

Steve was very nice and helpful, and communication went smoothly throughout the visit. The room is really cozy and pleasant, clean, and as pictured, and it's really nice to have your own bathroom. The street is a bit gritty but the neighborhood is nice - there are many good coffee shops, restaurants etc., within walking distance. The only challenge for me was that the metro was a bit far away (for me it ended up being ca. 20 mins walking distance) which can be a bit difficult if it's cold, or late, or you are carrying something. But other than that, great stay.
Steve was very friendly and greeted me when I arrived. The room was quiet, clean and a nice place to crash while working in the neighborhood.
What a wonderful space!  Steve was amazingly flexible and kind, and the apt is so stylish, comfortable and clean! Really has to be the best value in all of New York City. Highly, highly recommended!
Steve was a great host! I was only there for a night and arrived very late. He left detailed instructions into the apartment. Had private bathroom and bedroom which was very comfortable.

My time at Steve's place was awesome. He is very flexible, helpful, communicative and super friendly. The apartment is very clean and well maintained. The room is great, lots of light, space and very comfy. Having an own bathroom is a luxury in New York, 6 stars for that! There are 2 citibike stations next to the apartment, so getting to the subway is quick and fun. I can highly recommend staying at Steves place and would be happy to stay there another time myself. 

Thanks again for everything!

Great host and great room - exactly as photographed
Very welcoming, very easy and made the stay hassle free.

Muy buen anfitrión... Ayudó en todo lo que le solicité.
El departamento es tal cual se describe.
Prácticamente era un departamento para mi solo... Pues tenía mi propio baño! Todo para cocinar! Y mucha tranquilidad...
Súper recomendable.

Steve was a great host - very relaxed and accommodating. He stayed up late to greet me when I arrived and was happy to offer tips for getting around the neighbourhood/city. The apartment was clean and appeared as described. Thanks Steve!

Steve was a really nice host. He explained everything and gave us some nice tips. The place is like described and showed in the pictures. The neighborhood was safe. We did not have any problem to find restaurants and metro stations around there.
Steve is a cool guy. The bedroom is clean and bathroom is clean too. Bath towels are provided and all shampoos too. However it feels cold in the room during the night. Overall it is good.
I had to switch one of the nights and Steve showed flexibility. Other than that, he was very nice and hospitable.

My friend and I love this apartment! Steve is really nice. The furnishing is modern. We get our own bathroom with towels provided which is awesome! Room can get kinda chilly but as we turn the heater on problem is solved. The apartment is within walking distance to the metro so it's convenient to get around. In all, I would definitely recommend this place!

Passage sympa chez Steve. A environ  15 mn à pieds de plusieurs lignes de métro. A 15 mn à pied de Williamsburg. Compter une petite heure pour aller au MET. 
N'étant pas beaucoup resté dans le quartier, je ne peux pas trop en parler. Mais c'est un quartier assez vivant, où je me suis senti en sécurité. L'immeuble est un peu isolé et cela peut 
surprendre au début, l'appart est assez rustique mais agréable avec une 
salle d'eau indépendante. 
Pour quelques jours c'était très bien et Steve fut accueillant et accommodant pour mon départ. Merci à lui.

I had such a nice stay at Steve's apartment. The room was beautiful and peaceful, and I had a great time exploring the neighborhood. It's a bit of a walk from the subway, but I felt pretty safe walking back alone at night. I only got to meet Steve briefly, but he was very friendly and welcoming, and gave me detailed instructions for getting into the apartment. It was a lovely place to come back to after exploring the city all day!

The description was accurate and Steve was very knowledgable of the area and happy to give advice of places to eat and drink. I had a great time staying at Steves place, the room was clean and the light was beautiful.

I cannot recommend this place enough - the room is absolutely gorgeous with stunning interior design, and the apartment is so well located for exploring Brooklyn.

Steve was so welcoming and gave me great tips for exploring the neighborhood!

Steve is a nice guy and was very accommodating / understanding around my arrival.  Overall though we did not have a great experience as there are some issues with the apartment - including a kitchen sink that doesn't really work and a shower that is a bit tricky to use. Additionally the internet went out when my girlfriend was trying to work. On top of this, the building itself was a bit uncomfortable. At one point we called the police about what seemed like a domestic dispute and there overall seemed to be some strange people floating around. The location is also not particularly inviting as it sits nearly below the BQE.

Again, Steve seems like a good guy and yes, the place is all in all on the inexpensive end of for central Brooklyn, but I would suggest that he put some time into making sure some basic things are fixed in the place.

We were initially hesitant to book the place because it was a 15-20 min walk from the metro but there's actually two bus stops a block away near the Unit that connects you to the metro that made it very convenient. Steve's a great host, very friendly and ready to give advice on food and stuff. Having your own bathroom is indeed a steal in New York.

What a lovely apartment and a cozy room in Brooklyn. It is well located close to several facilities (bars, restaurants, street market, subway...) and close to the Brooklyn bridge. 
Moreover Steve is a really helpful host always willing to give very useful tips. I have really appreciated my stay there.
Steve was very accomodating and friendly.

Steve is a friendly host and is aware of your well being. I had a nice and bright room at Steve's and a good bed. I did not use the facilities much because NYC and the area near by was amazing to discover. As i arrived the area looked a bit rough and industrial. That is a part of the charm and only a fem blocks away there are lots of restaurants, deli's, parks. I would not hesitate to go back... If Steve will have me :)

Steve was amazing! He received us perfect, He gave us subway maps, restaurants, etc. We did not have any expectations and was truly amazing, super friendly and helpful and made our stay a real place to vacation and want to stay forever
The department was and is beautiful, exactly as in the photo, the fact of having private bathroom is a luxury and a priceless comfort, the neighborhood super safe and quiet, go to the subway is a short 10 minute walk across the street from Fort Greene is beautiful (also has buses at the corner but do not take it because we did not know how to move in that means of transport), it is close to many supermarkets and places to eat.

100% recommended in conclusion, we were very happy with our stay :)

Steve was a nice host, he waited for me till late to check in and patiently show me the place, like how to lock and unlock the door. The apartment is located in a convenient place in Brooklyn. It's clean cozy. But there's only one thing I'd like to point out, it's the noise out of the window at night. Because of the AC installment, the noise is not well blocked. If you're a light sleeper like me, that's the thing you need to take into consideration before booking this room. And hopefully the host can solve the problem in the future. Overall, the experience was good.

Had a great trip to NYC! Steve's place was comfortable and convenient, perfectly located for the purpose of my trip, and exactly as described. 
Thank you, Steve.
Steve was accommodating and friendly.  Listing is accurate and the room is fairly priced.  About a 10 minute walk to the closest subway but most of it is a nice walk through some good neighborhoods.

Steve's apartment was as advertised/pictured. Very clean and comfortable, and well located to Ft. Greene, DUMBO, and downtown Brooklyn areas. Steve was out and about most of the weekend, but was friendly and helpful when he was around. I'd just recommend confirming your planned arrival time in advance; there's no key box, and since Steve isn't always around the apartment you'll need to work out a time when he's available to check you in.

Steve was nice, accommodating, and a great host. Steve was also informative about the neighborhoods and local happenings.

The apartment is near many cool places and parks close by.

Steve is a super nice host and very welcoming.  His place is very clean.  The room is nice and bright.  The AC worked great.  It's a bit of a walk to the train but is a nice walk. There is a bus stop right around the corner.
Steve was very helpful upon our arrival. He explained everything in detail and even had a folder with restaurants and transportation info attached. Room and washroom were clean.

My sister and I visited NYC for our journey to Afro Punk's two day festival.  The location of Steve's apartment was within walking distance to the event! The room appears as it does on the photo and the AC was greatly appreciated after hanging out in the NYC Humidity and sun all day. Only suggestion is more dusting and setting up arrival times prior (possibly a week or two out). Aside from that Steve was prepared with a nice folder and map with dining options and recommendations, local areas, and routes to the nearest train station and popular areas. 

Thank you Steve for opening your home up and hospitality!

Steve was very friendly and helpful in providing us info on what to check out in the city. He had a little folder in the room that included a map on how to get around the city (felt like a hotel room). The location is about 20 mins walking from the metro, so I recommend getting a CitiBike pass. Overall, our stay in the room was very comfortable! We had a great time.

Steve fue encantador y siempre atento. 
Tuvimos algún problema con el agua en la cocina pero Steve lo solucionó en un par de días. También algunos vecinos ruidosos que nos despertaron de madrugada gritando. A pesar de eso, el barrio es seguro. 100% neoyorkino. Ni un solo turista por allí. 
El apartamento está genial pero muy lejos de Manhattan y del metro. Al menos 25 minutos andando para coger el metro lo que hace que necesites casi una hora para Manhattan. No está cerca del metro. Y solo hay una línea de bus que pasa.
Cozy and welcoming spacious room!

Steve was a great host. He texted me the day I was traveling to New York to make sure he would be home to check me in. He helped me with my bags and explained everything about the place when I arrived. The room was nice and everything he described here was correct. I felt comfortable during my stay. Did not see Steve much but he texted me during my stay to make sure everything was okay. I did not have any problems during my 10 days stay. Thank you Steve.

I had a wonderful one night stay at Steve's place. He was very communicative with me before my arrival about check in and he was home to show me around when I arrived. I stayed in the entire night and found the apartment to be clean and comfortable. Steve was an amazing host and I would definitely stay again!

Great place to stay, small and comfortable, all we needed for a weekend in NY. Great to stay in Brooklyn & the trips to the subway stations gave time to take in our surroundings. Loads of great restaurants and shops close by.
A really nice place to stay. Very clean and with a lot of light coming in. Also Steve is a great host!
Steve is a great guy – very helpful and accommodating. The place is clean, compact, and as described. Just note that it's quite far from the subway and on a gritty street next to the BQE.
This is a great place in a good neighborhood! There's lots of things near by and the subway is only about a ten minute walk. Very easy to get to Manhattan from here - I even biked the bridge!
The host canceled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Die Unterkunft bei Steve liegt zentral gelegen in Brooklyn. Das Zimmer ist ausreichend groß für zwei Gäste. Manhattan erreicht man innerhalb weniger Fahrminuten. 
Gute Unterkunft - viele Essensmöglichkeiten in der Nähe. Brooklyn Bridge sogar fußläufig erreichbar.

Steve is an outstanding host, and extremely good at communicating regarding any questions that you may have about the apartment, or just recommendations for places to visit, eat, drink or commutes. Furthermore, Steve always makes you feel welcomed. The apartment is very homely and clean. You have your own bedroom (double sized bed), and your own private bathroom. The location is perfect to explore, both, Manhattan and Brooklyn. Brooklyn Bridge is only approx 15 mins walk from the apartment, which is a must. There are a number of Subway stations (York St/Jay St/DeKalb/Lafayette Ave) in close proximity (appox 10-15mins walk), which take you directly into Lower Manhattan and are only a few stops away. If you have any further questions, then do hesitate to message Steve and he'll be more than happy to assist.
Great, friendly and good communicating host, small but cosy and clean room and in a very nice brooklyn area... Would love to return some day
nice and cozy! quiet neighborhood.
Amazing host and beautiful house. Very well located in the heart of Brooklyn!

Check in was smooth. We arrived at around 12pm and Steve let us in. The room is as described very bright with a full size bed, a small closet, a drawer, a table. We had own bathroom and privacy in Steve's apartment. We were free to use everything.
Centrally located in Brooklyn a bit far from train stations. In aprox. 15-20 minutes walk from nearby train stations and Brooklyn Bridge. we were told about it before booking the room.  Bike rentals are at both corners, but it is additional cost to your pocket. A lot of convinient stores and food around. 
First days were a bit cold and we had to use a heater. Last two days were very hot and there was no AC in the room, only fan, but it did not help a lot. 
Checked out at 11 am. 
Overall, our stay was good. Thank you.

Steve's place is great! It's about a 15 minute walk to the subway and easy to get to. The room was very clean and a very comfortable bed. Check-in was a breeze. We were able to meet Steve on our last day, he is outgoing and very communicative, I highly recommend staying here!
I stayed in his place for 6 days. Love it!
房东人很好,热情,善良!但是位置并不算出色,周边缺少公共交通,整条大街空荡荡只有两栋住宅,其余都是荒地,片区卫生状况不好,治安令人堪忧｡不建议女生入住｡

Steve's place is clean, comfortable and in walking distance (about one minute) to a bus station that will bring you to the nearest metro. If you prefer to walk, you will reach a different metro station in about ten minutes. Steve is a very nice host who is more than happy to help you with anything concerning your stay. Would definitely come back :)

This place was a steal! I'm from Philly so I dig the "hood" if it were. That means bodegas opened late and a lot more people watching...which I love. I stayed for the AP musical fest so it being within walking distance of the park which was a major perk. The neighbors were hella friendly, and I was pleasantly surprised at how chill the area was with parking and the noise being basically nil. The photos are true to the apt and it's a good size for two people for sure. The only other thing I would suggest is getting a mini tv for the living area but with fast wifi and my own personal tablet I was able to watch my weekend shows undisturbed. I would definitely stay here again.
Nice place to stay overall despite the 20 mn walk to reach the nearest metro station. The host should also check that all the equipement provided in the flat are usable

The room is very clean and looks as the photo shows. Steve is a great host who emphasizes good and efficient communication. One thing I wish I had known was the neighborhood and walk from the closest train to the home. It is a 0.8-1 mile walk!

I really enjoyed staying at Steve's apartment. He is a very accommodating and helpful host! We barely saw each other during my stay but communication was outstanding and he always made sure I had a good experience. 

The room was light and clean.  The neighborhood is safe and very close to the bus stops that will take you to the nearest subway stations and Downtown Brooklyn.

Steve is a great host. Gave me a lot of recommendations while I was in town and made my stay very enjoyable. Fort Greene is a very cool neighborhood with some great restaurants and cafes and east access to the subway. Was able to head into midtown and LES with no problems. Thanks!

The room at Steve’s is bright and nicely furnished. You also have your own little bathroom there, which is really convenient. Kitchen (coffee maker, fridge,...)  can also be used. If you’re okay with walking a few minutes to the next subway station (which I perfectly was), then the location of the appartement is really okay. If not: There’s also a citibike station and I think also a bus-station nearby. I think for New York City this neighbourhood is rather quiet (traffic and neighbours). Although Steve and I only met briefly in person, contact via airbnb-Chat was helpful and pleasing. So: I really an recommend this cozy room in Fort Greene/Brooklyn/NYC. Thanks for having me at you place, Steve.

Steve was super communicative over the Airbnb app and had very clear instructions on checking in. The space was nice, and it was great having our own bathroom as well. The walk to the nearest station is a little long if you’re looking to get into the city on a daily basis, but it’s a pretty walk. We didn’t get to see him very much since he was working and we were out exploring a lot, but the moments we got to talk with him, he was super nice, funny and easy to talk to!

The pictures are very accurate and the place is kind of located near a lot of stores. The G train wasn’t working when I visited then at night the A and C also stopped so it is a bit of a nightmare if you main purpose is to be in manhattan. Otherwise it’s a beautiful place.
Well placed location to see Brooklyn
Nice cute place, seperate bath a huge bonus, clean
Steve is awesome. I recommend him for everyone who's looking to stay in Brooklyn.

Steve was super friendly and quick to respond to any messages. His quaint home was a great place to lay our head after such long days exploring the city. Bus, subway stations, and citibike locations were very walkable from his home. Just a few blocks up we’re plenty of restaurants and cafes. Good place and great price

Steve's place is small but exactly as advertised. The room itself was a good size and very clean, as was the bathroom. The bed is very comfortable and the neighborhood/street pretty quiet. Steve himself is a nice person - friendly yet not too intrusive. I felt very comfortable being in his home after meeting him. The location was pretty good too (considering the price of the stay). It took me about 10 minutes to walk to amazing restaurants on DeKalb, 20 minutes to walk to the Brooklyn Academy of Music and 25 minutes to walk to DUMBO. I felt safe walking to all these neighborhoods during the day and early evening. (I took cabs late at night).
We spend a wonderful week in Steves guest room. Check in and Check out worked great and i would happily come back anytime.

Steve was very easy to communicate with and the apartment was just lovely! Came to town for a wedding in Dumbo and this apartment became a perfect little place to get ready, relax, and feel comfortable. The bedroom also gets amazing light.

Steve’s place was ideal. Close to so many subway stops. Safe neighborhood with lots of local groceries and restaurants. Easy access with a welcoming atmosphere. Bedroom was comfortable and gave me a space of sanctuary. 100% recommend!

Steve's place is really great! He provided many information about where to go in the neighborhood. Unfortunately, I only stayed for a night and didn't have a chance to visit. Hopefully, I'll get a longer stay next time.

Steve was very kind and had great communication with me before and during my stay. His place was just as it was in pictures, very nice and clean. The located for me was great because my friend's wedding venue was close by, and the neighborhood he is in is close to so much great stuff. It's a nice easy walk to different metro stations, but if you are in a rush it's very easy to lyft or uber anywhere quickly. I would recommend this place to anyone looking to stay in NYC!
Steve is a great host and his place a good choice if you're looking for a comfy and clean spot in Brooklyn.

It was a good location.
Steve was very nice and helpful

Steve was a great host! The house was cozy and comfortable. This place has a great location! I would recommend staying here if you are in the area. He made my cousin feel welcome and comfortable in his flat.
We had a great stay at Steve's spot.  It was a good jumping off point to see the city.  Comfortable and clean and good communication.  Thanks again Steve.

Steve was a wonderful host. He is very hospitable. I requested an extra blanket and he got me one next day! I was very cozy. 

I travel to NYC for work weekly and always look for simple, clean, thoughtfully decorated rooms and this one was exactly as described and perfect for my work week. The private bath is a plus.

For my commute I decided it was more fun to take the 57 or 59 bus on Flushing to the F train so I could grab a coffee at Brooklyn roasters on my way, than to take Q or B. The commute to midtown was easy.
Great stay! Thanks!

Steve was great, he was ready and well prepared for our arrival. He provided simple and straightforward instructions on how to get to his place. He provided a safe and friendly environment for us! It felt like home away from home. Over all our experiences was great!

Great location in Brooklyn with nearby shops and restaurants, and also a quick 15 min train ride into downtown Manhattan as well! Steve's place was just perfect for a couple. Quiet, clean, cozy. We cooked a lot of simple food to save money on our trip, and the kitchen was well equipped. Steve was a friendly host, interesting to talk with and had great tips of things to do and see. Highly recommended!

Steve's place was located easy walk to the Subway, with plenty of restaurants and coffee spots along the way. There are Citi Bikes available at both ends of the block which made commuting around very easy. Steve's street is relatively quiet, and we felt pretty safe in the neighbourhood. We unfortunately didn't meet Steve until our last nights stay, but he was very easy to communicate with throughout the entire stay.
Die Wohnung ist sehr schick und modern. Steve war ein ausgezeichneter Gastgeber - ich kann nichts negatives beklagen...
Great place to stay. Steve was really friendly and communication worked well.
Steve is a great host, he goes above and beyond to accommodate your needs. He’s awesome and his place is nice!

Op wandelafstand (ca. 4km) van Lower Manhattan. Het dichtstbijzijnde metrostation ligt op ca. 1.6km. Netjes, airco aanwezig in de kamer (maakt wel wat lawaai 's nachts). Je kan de keuken gebruiken, Steve is altijd bereikbaar, en antwoordt snel. Waar voor zijn geld, zeker in New York!

El departamento es super lindo, Steve tiene todo muy bien decorado y es una persona amable y tranquila. La ubicación es un poco alejada del subte pero esta cerca de Manhattan y de zonas muy libdas de Brooklin.
it was such an nice apartment, we will be there again!

It was absolutely amazing! The room is really clean and big enough for two persons with a lot of luggage. We enjoyed our stay and loved to be in such a safe and nice neighbourhood. Steve is really caring about his guests and always offers a helping hand. I definitely recommend this accomodation without any doubt! 
Subway, brooklyn bridge and a lot of restaurants are in walking distance.
Steve is a very nice host.  I really felt that I was at my home.  I Strongly recomend!
멺칠읆 무거됴 쑤건을 핢낢바께 안줆어서 찗찗했얾욤.. 그래서 쑤건을 손빪램해서 맒렸늚뎀 거기에서 엄청 큰 똔뿰레 투마리가 나와써 깜놀했네욞! 집쩐체에서 씬뽤을 모씬께 했는뎀 빠딱이 넒무넒무 the love었어욤. 가까이 버스 정류장이 많아서 위치는 좋았네요.
Nice place and Steve was very helpful with all questions!
Overall really great stay. The only thing is that the station is quite far away but its nothing a quick uber or bus would not solve.

Steve was extremely nice & more than accommodating during my stay! He gave my friend & me a super warm welcome and ensured that we had a smooth and easy check-in/check-out.  The room was clean and exactly as pictured and the bed was beyond comfortable, not to mention the amazingly soft and warm comforter.  Steve even offered to allow us to overstay our check-out time.  His response time to my messages was very quick & communicating with him was stress-free & simple.  Overall, I would definitely book with Steve again & I would suggest to anyone looking to book a place in Brooklyn to go with him as well.

Steve was a great host, we appreciated all the helpful tips for things to see and do in NYC. Friendly and great communication. We had a bit trouble finding his apartment at first but he was quick to respond and check-in process was so easy. Overall his apartment was kept clean and we felt safe there as well.

Steve's place was ace.  I checked in very late at night, and Steve had left really thorough and easy to understand instructions of how to access the apartment (he was working late that night).
