As I'd been in Brooklyn for work, my trip was really hectic and super tiring, and so Steve allowed me to have a lie in and check out at a convenient time on my final day.

The place was really clean, quiet and very homely.  The bed is so comfortable - slept like a log every night.

Would totally recommend this place and if I need to go back, this will be my first choice.  Thank you Steve!
We had a great stay! Steve's place is well located, we rented citibikes just at the corner and were able to move easily and quickly in Brooklyn.
Steve is a great host and very helpful. The room is clean, spacious and located 10min walk from the subway. The private bathroom is a plus. Good value for your money.
Steve’s place is clean and in great location. Communication is very clear. We had a great time for 3 nights.

We spent a great week at the lovely apartment of Steve. It’s beautiful decorated and the room is bright and just like on the pictures. We felt immediately comfy and safe. Brooklyn is gorgeous if you need a short break from the loud and crowded Manhattan visits and want to eat a lot of really good food in a nice area. We’re truly thankful to have decided to spend our time at Steve’s place. He is such a nice, super interesting and intelligent guy who gave us great tips and let us let our luggage at the room on our last days until our flight home in the evening.
Steve is a warm and hospitable person. We enjoyed our stay.
Bright spacious room, very clean bathroom. Actual apartment is very small. Very easy Check in. Location is 20 min walk to the nearest subway or to downtown Brooklyn.

Thank you Steve for your hospitality 

I really felt like home in NYC

Steve's apartment located in Brooklyn it's a good option when visiting NY it's located in a cute neighborhood with restaurants, bars and a cool park a little far from the metro station but it doesn't matter, hope you get to meet Steve he's a cool dude!

Steve was an excellent host.  
Very nice guy, great host.
His place was clean and comfortable.  
He responded very quickly as it was an unexpected need for me to find a place to stay in Brooklyn.
His place has all the comforts of home and he can provide for great conversation when he is available.
Would definitely stay here again and would recommend it for anyone needing a place to stay.
It is also very close to the Brooklyn Navy Yard, 1 minute walk.
Laundromat  and many restaurants within 5 minute walk.
Brooklyn Coffee shop is 1 minute walk.
Citibike is across the street.
Enjoyed my stay at Steve’s. The room was nice and clean. Check in/out was easy. Steve is a great host.

Steve's apartment is the perfect "home base" for a quick trip to NYC. Advance communication was clear, and checking in and out was streamlined to perfection. The space was clean and although relatively compact, there was more than enough room, both communal and private. I've previously lived in the neighborhood and enjoy the convenient access to multiple subway stops and bus lines. Steve is a generous and friendly host and is very easy to get along with. Thanks for a great stay Steve!
Steve and his place are great. Easy communication, central location, Citi Bike  station just down the street! 14 min by bike to Brooklyn Bridge! Coffee shop in walking distance.
Steve’s place is very private and comfortable. Check in was super easy, subway is about a 15min walk. Would definitely stay again!
Our stay at Steves was enjoyable. He was great to chat with and was more than happy to answer all of our questions. The apartment was clean and had everything we needed and at a great price!

Awesome centralized location with easy commute into the city. Ended up spending most of my time over at UrbanGlass which was a nice 15 minute walk through Fort Green Park. Never felt unsafe walking home late at night. Steve’s place was a nice comfortable space to come back to and decompress after a long day/night. The room was larger than I expected, great natural lighting, thoughtful touches throughout, fantastic host with some great stories. Thank you Steve, hope to be back soon. Happy Holidays!

Steve was a great host, his place is well located near a number of subway stops for Manhattan and the airport.  He provided towels and offered us his coffee and offered useful tips for getting round. Would stay with Steve again

Steve’s place was great! It was in a perfect location for my stay, with easy walking to Dekalb Market and the nearby park. Steve responded quickly and answered all my questions. I will book with him again whenever I come back to Brooklyn!

Steve’s accommodation is a great spot to spend the nights while exploring NYC. But beware that the room is extremely cold during the winter since there is no installed heater. So we would recommend it only in the summer. 

Steve is a great host. He is mostly gone but always answers texts within minutes. 

The neighborhood is ok, but we (2 Girls) felt a little unsafe sometimes, just because there is a liquor store right around the corner and there are always some people sitting there, trying to talk to you. 

Beware that you will have to walk around 15 minutes to get to the closest Metro Station. Same is with supermarkets. But the walk is not too bad in the mornings, but once you get home at night after a long day it can be annoying. 

The bed is quit small for two friends but comfy. 

Over all we can recommend Steve’s accommodation but only if you are aware of the facts above so that you know what you are getting.

name: nice interior room at artistic place
summary: Pequeña y acogedora habitación interior en antigua vivienda a pie de calle, buena situación y bien comunicado donde vivo. Nice interior room in a share apartment. It is an old and antique apartment on the ground floor(street level) with high ceilings.
space: Pequeña y acogedora habitación interior en amplia y antigua  vivienda a pie de calle tranquilo, buena situación y bien comunicado. La habitación no dispone de llave privada. Si tengo tiempo, me gusta compartir con los huéspedes, indicarles los sitios turísticos y los medios de trasporte. Nice interior room in a share apartment. It is an old and antique apartment on the ground floor(street level) with high ceilings. The room does not have key. If I have time, I like to help guests in everything they need, show the turistic places, the transport facilities...

It is an old and antique apartment on the ground floor(street level) with high ceilings. neighborhood_overview: Es un barrio tranquilo cerca de todo: la montaña(Montjuic), mar(Maremagnum) y casco antiguo. Tiene supermercados(Dia, Condis, Jespac, Bon Area...), cafeterías y bares alrededor. It is a quiet area close to the mountain (Montjuic), the sea(Maremagnum) and old city (Las Ramblas, Liceo...) (20 minutes walking) There are supermarkets (Dia, Condis, Jespac, Bon Area...) cafes and pubs around
transit: Muy bien comunicada. Parada de metro: Poble sec, L3 Parada de autobuses cercana: D20  A quince minutos andando Plaza de España donde están los autobuses para el aeropuerto: 46, A1, A2 Well comunicated. Nearest subway stop: Poble sec, L3 (Parlament exit) (3 minutes walking) Nearest bus stop: D20 15 minutes walking to Espanya square where buses to the airport are: 46, A1, A2
access: Zonas comunes para usar: sala de estar, patio interior y entrada. You can use the sitting room, terraze and the hall in the entrance. Two days a week (Mondays and Wednesday I do pilates for 1 hour in the entrance with some friends). It is not allowed to use the kitchen and the washing machine but you can use microwave, some dishes, glasses...and leave something in the fridge.
interaction: Si tengo tiempo, me gusta compartir con los huéspedes, indicarles los sitios turísticos y los medios de trasporte. If I have time, I like to help guests in everything they need, show the turistic places, the transport facilities...
house_rules: - Se puede fumar sólo en el patio.  - La cocina no está incluida pero se puede usar el microondas, el hervidor, dejar algo en la nevera, usar cubiertos, vasos o platos. - No se pueden traer invitados durante la estancia.  - personas sociables y tranquilas. -Silencio a partir de las 23:00

reviews.comments:
Je remercie Inma pour son accueil et son hospitalité. Elle n'a pas hésité à m'apporter aide et explication. J'ai apprécie son art à la peinture. L'appartement est au calme. Idéal pour se reposer. A ma prochaine visite, j'y retournerais. Je le recommande bien.
Merci Inma.
Great place to stay. Clean, comfortable and well comunicated. Most of BCN's sights and landmarks in BCN are in walking distance. Inma is a nice and attentive host. Thanks, Inma!
Very joyful experience. Inma is a very kind and considering host. The room is as lovely as shown. Perfect location!

My 3-day stay at Inma's place was just perfect for my needs! Inma is a kind person (and apparently, a talented artist - shame that it was a busy trip for me and I did not have much time to discover this more) and a reliable host. Her place (street level) is located in a neighbourhood I like very much (Poble Sec), close by a subway station. The room was very much like the description provided on the listing. Everything was clean and tidy. The room fits one person and has plenty of storage. It does not have any window and is located in between the kitchen and another bedroom: it is therefore extremely quite, which I really appreciated given my sleeping pattern during this short trip (6am-12pm). I was unfortunate enough to fall in her shower and break the plastic frame, also getting mildly injured in the process. Inma was considerate in helping me clean the injury and we settled the damage by splitting repair fees. Will come back if I have a chance!

I spent only one night in Inma's appartment. Everything went smoothly, Inma waited for my arrival and was very helpful. The appartment is very well located and I went for a really nice walk to the park Montjuïc which is really closeby.

I spent three days at Inma's aparment. The place is in the city centre and Inma was very helpful. She helped me with all my problems and was kind enough to see me off at 4 a.m in the morning. When I visit Barcelona again, this place will be the first apartment I will stay. Thanks, Inma!
I had very nice time in Barcelona at your house. The room was great and you were so kind. Thank you for very much!

The room is quite cosy. Comfortable, and silent. It is located about ten minutes away by foot from the port, and les ramblas. There are a couple of good, and not too expensive, cafes close by.

Inma was very kind, and was very helpful during my stay.

Will definitely recommend this accommodation.

Inma was very welcoming and nice host. I love her place so much, everything is clean and perfect. But, when I was there it was pretty hot. There was no fan inside the room, so no air circulation in the room, no window. Overall, the place is very close to everything! 2 mins from metro. There are a lot of rest around and market. 
Thank you for letting me stay!
Very nice lady!

I spent two nights at Inmas. She was such a great host! Everything was tidy and clean, Inma was very nice and even showed me a bit of the area when I arrived. The neighborhood is friendly and safe. Thanks Inma for making my Barca trip an unforgettable one :)

Inma was the perfect host. Was only there for 2 nights and she was very helpful with directions, speaks very good English and showed me around town at night with her friends. Extremely good value for money and right in center of city. Would definitely go back to stay there.

It was quite nice to have imna as a host. She was very helpful and we even went out one night to go to an argentinian bar. The room is quite small but totally sufficient if u are only staying for a few days. The ventilator in the room helped with the heat although it is still warmer in the room than in the rest of the house. Anyway i can totally recommend inmas place.

Inma was the coolest host -- She knew where all the best places were, whether you wanted to go to a bar, club, a place to go dancing, or a good seafood place. Her and her friends were super nice and showed me around the coast the first night I was there, which was really nice of them. The room is as described, relatively small, but was fine for me as a single person for a week. Since I came during the summer, it got pretty hot in the room, even with the fan, so keep the door open at night and the fan running and you should be fine.  The kitchen is also off limits, but you can use the fridge and sink and the plates and silverware.  Overall, the place is really clean and in a good location in Barcelona, right next to the Poble Sec metro stop and many of the other parts of Barcelona that you may want to visit anyway.
Inma was a lovely host - helpful and friendly. The room was great and I had the best sleep.
Staying with Inma turned out to be a great idea. She's very friendly and organized. The spare room is very nice. Inma was also gracious in showing me a lot of the city near her home.

Inma was the perfect host. She was so kind and welcoming and made me feel so comfortable in her home. The room was perfect! Exactly as pictured and by far the cleanest I've stayed in! Neater than a hotel! The location is also fantastic. 3 minutes from Plaça d'espanya (where you can catch the aerobus to and from the airport). I absolutely loved my stay with Inma and wish I could've been there longer!

Communication was easy and Inma was very flexible in scheduling when to meet and leave. The flat itself is interesting because it contains a combined work space, and has an industrial feel that is being redone very well. I really like it, and you have your own room as well. I talked to both Inma and her flat mate and they were both very friendly. You also have a fan in your room for the summer months, and even though it's the ground floor, it's interior so there's no noise. Very much recommend!

I had a lovely stay at Inma's appartment. Inma had to work during my stay, so she arranged for her mother to be at the appartment upon arrival. Maria (mother) doesn't speak english, but that was not a problem at all. She was very outgoing and did her very best to show me around in the appartment. The room was small but enough. I see some people complained that there was no aircondition in the room. They have bought a fan, problem solved. Fresh towels and clean sheets.

The appartment lies in the center of Poble Sec, with easy access to the metro (3 min walk). I spent my days exploring the area, and its in walking distance to the beach, as well as Castelle Montjuic.

I'm recommending this appartment to anyone who is travelling by themself.

Thank u very much Maria, Osman and Inma.

Inma was a very helpful and friendly host. She was quick to respond to my questions about the place and how to get to her place. Her description of the place was accurate. It was located on a quiet street, off the main street, with easy access to the centre of Barcelona. I was arriving at Barcelona late and was not sure how to get to her place (due to darkness), she came out to the Metro station (5 minutes walk) to get me. I would definitely recommend this place for someone travelling alone and looking for a modest, clean, and quiet place to stay.

Staying with Inma was a great choice. Her place is well located just of a major road and a few minute walk to the metro. If you're traveling alone and just looking for a place to lay your head at night then I definitely recommend stay with Inma.

the stay at Inma's was terrific!the room is not big, but enough for a traveller. it's located very close to the placa espana, so it is very convenient to get there from the airport. and there's much to do in the neighbor. but the most important thing is that Inma is great!she made my stay in barcelona really comfortable, we chatted a lot and became friends. she even gave a pin designed by their artistic group as souvenir. in short, i highly recommend Inma's apartment!
Everything was exactly as described, central place, nice and clean with all the utilities that one would need. Inma was friendly and helpful and I totally recommend her!

Inma is a really kind woman, I arrived quite early (half past 9am) but  she let me to move in right away. I got a key to the flat. Although I haven't seen her much later on (I was in the city) she often inquired if I am okay. If you like pilates, do not hesitate to reserve the room and you can freely join to the occasional classes. :)
It was a great experience and she was very helpful with getting around the city. The room was very clean and perfect for a traveler.
Inma is great. She sent me all the info I needed a week in advance. My flight got in really late in the night but she waited up for me. She was awesome. Loved the room and the neighborhood!

Inma es muy amable y cuando está en casa tiene una muy buena disposición para ayudar. La pieza es pequeña y no tiene ventana pero suficiente para llegar a dormir, es tal cual se ve en la fotografía. El piso es algo oscuro, sin embargo mi estadía ahí ha sido buena.
Inma es muy amable y te hace agradable la estancia. La habitación y la casa están limpias, es como se muestra en las fotos. La casa esta bien situada y con el metro muy cerca.

Inmas place was great.  It was a nice central location near the metro had lots of good restaurants nearby and the laundromat across the street. She was very friendly and accommodating and I would definitely stay there again.
La chambre était géniale et Inma est une hôte très respectueuse et aidante. Elle m'a fourni une carte et des conseils sur la ville.

I had a good time at Inma's house. The room was as described. Very clean and perfect for one person. The locality was central and worked well for me since I had to catch an early morning bus to the airport. Inma was very kind and helpful. Thanks.

Inma is genuinely kind and welcoming. She is also an artist. So, you can enjoy some of her paintings. 
Her place is near the metro station not far from some of tourist spots such as Plaça d'Espanya, only one metro stop away. The room itself is small yet very neat and tidy. It's good enough for a solo traveller. Recommended!
Inma was very nice and welcoming. The apartment is simple and comfortable. Thanks Inma!

This apartment's location is great if you want to experience local Barcelona while having easy and quick access to the center (2 minutes walk to the metro). Inma is an amazing host, great hospitality, she helped me get around in the area. I was there in November, so the apartment was a little cold for me, although Inma did offer me a heater. Nonetheless, it's a great place to stay. Thank you again, Inma!

Inma was a lovely host! She was very friendly and fast at replying to messages. After a long day's travelling she kindly met me at the metro station. The room is warm and cosy, and everything was very clean. I would recommend!
Inma is a perfect host, we had a great time together. Thank you Inma :)
Good location, easy to reach from airport and close to metro. Ideal for individual travelers
Excellent location. Nice and quiet. I loved it!
Kind girl!

Inma’s apartment is lovely and clean and the room is perfect for a solo traveller. The metro is only a couple of minutes walk away but the apartment is also within walking distance of many beautiful Barcelona locations such as el Raval and Montjuïc. Would recommend to anyone!

Inma and Nord were very nice and helpful in every way even though I haven't seen them much as i was busy. The apartment itself is also nice and has interesting design, the area is good as well, there's a whole tapas street in 5 min walking distance, shops and all the infrastructure you might need. The only shortcoming for me was the lack of fresh air during the night when i closed the door as there's no window. But overall  i enjoyed my stay and would recommend it to other solo travelers on budget.
Just right for my short stay in Barcelona. Convenient to Public Transport and walking around Barcelona. The room was clean and tidy and just right for a short stay. Thank you Inma.
Great location and quiet comfortable space to stay. Inma is a gracious host. I hope I can stay longer next time!
I had a really nice stay at this place. The host is very kind and helpful!

I strongly recommend her place !! 
The room is clean, near to Placa Espagna and Las Ramblas, Inma is vey professional, accurate, excellent communicative, quick response. 
I would like to THANK Inma for her hospitality and professionalism.

Tutto perfetto! L'alloggio è molto pulito. La camera è più grande di quello che sembra, molto accogliente, c'è un armadio enorme e un tavolino. C'è molta privacy perchè la camera si trova nella prima parte dell'appartamento, quindi non si è mai obbligati a passare dal salotto per arrivare in camera.
La posizione è perfetta! A un minuto dalla metro che porta in stazione e alle Ramblas (linea 3). Si può arrivare tranquillamente anche a piedi in tutta la zona centrale. Zona a buon mercato, con molti bar nella via a fianco.
Inma è molto simpatica e accogliente, mi ha fatto sentire subito a mio agio. Tutto era ben organizzato, comunicazione prima dell'arrivo eccellente. Se dovessi tornare a Barcellona tornerei qui. Consiglio assolutamente! :)
Great place and host is lovely and thoughtful.

Inma was a wonderful host. Her apartment is in a prime location-- perfect for tourists, but not overly busy or noisy. She was incredibly responsive, and her apartment is as pictured and described. I would highly recommend her place for solo tourists.
Quirky little place in a great location for what I was after. Clean, tidy and quiet so you get a good nights sleep. Inma is a really welcoming host and will help you with anything during your trip.
とてもおすすめです!Inmaは素晴らしいﾎｽﾄです｡親しみやすく､ｺﾐｭﾆｹｰｼｮﾝが取りやすかったです｡部屋は写真よりも広く感じました｡wifiもはやく快適でした｡家全体も清潔で過ごしやすかったです｡そしてなにより､最寄駅のﾒﾄﾛに近く､市内中心部へのｱｸｾｽが良かったです｡
This place is perfect for tourists cosy, clean, nice location and Inma is so lovely host thanks

This was a really relaxing stay, i had wonderful time of sleep, room was very clean, toilet as well, Inma is very kind and her response is very quick and always try to help and go the extra mile to make me feel comfortable, until we meet again, thanks alot.

Inma is a great host. The small room is really confortable, the bathroom is always clean. The location is great. A bit hot during summer nights but the ventilator helps a lot. I recommend this for your stay!

Great location and price! Inma and company were very friendly and helpful. Perfect host who cares about her guests. The place is super artsy and inspires creativity in all senses including the bathroom. Definitely recommend

convenient location. close to the metro. there is a nearby cafeteria which offers nice breakfast. 
the room is good for a solo traveller. kindly take note also that the room does not have windows. 
i had a smooth stay. Inma and her boyfriend are hospitable :)
Wonderful hospitality, friendly, good location away from tourists but convenient for everything, good local tips.

name: You are welcome at my home
summary: I have cosy and cute apartment at Mecidiyeköy where is the origin of Istanbul. And my house is near all transpotations for everywhere.  I have two rooms, One of them which you will use has twin bed and I believe it is comfortable.
description: I have cosy and cute apartment at Mecidiyeköy where is the origin of Istanbul. And my house is near all transpotations for everywhere.  I have two rooms, One of them which you will use has twin bed and I believe it is comfortable.

name: Living Aloha~Half a Block to Waikiki Beach + WiFi
summary: This small but quaint studio is half a block from the best part of Waikiki beach across from Honolulu Zoo! Don’t be fooled by those who say they are “near” Waikiki, especially when toting your beach supplies, it’s a big city.  This unit has the beach right outside the door!  It boasts granite in the bathroom and has a fully stocked kitchenette. The building has a rooftop observation deck with amazing views, a pool, bar, restaurants, sundries, and even a Starbucks within steps of the front door!!
space: Location, Location, Location.  Everything is located just steps from our studio.  Waikiki has beautiful stretches of beach.  This unit is situated along the best part where the the sand is super fine.   Anything you desire is within walking distance - Restaurants, nightlife, hiking, running, bicycling, swimming, surfing, snorkeling, SUP, relaxing...  the list goes on and on!   The studio is small but has everything you need for a great vacation.  It has a lanai (patio) if you enjoy a cup of coffee outdoors in the morning or a beautiful observation deck on the roof to watch amazing sunrises over Diamondhead and sunsets into the pacific.  I enjoy having the kitchen to make breakfast or a snack instead of paying the high meal prices in town for every meal. The building has Teddy's Burgers on the first level and Tucker and Bevy is just down the block for fresh squeezed juice on a hot day.  The ABC store downstairs has everything from sunscreen to light groceries if you need something quick
description: This small but quaint studio is half a block from the best part of Waikiki beach across from Honolulu Zoo! Don’t be fooled by those who say they are “near” Waikiki, especially when toting your beach supplies, it’s a big city.  This unit has the beach right outside the door!  It boasts granite in the bathroom and has a fully stocked kitchenette. The building has a rooftop observation deck with amazing views, a pool, bar, restaurants, sundries, and even a Starbucks within steps of the front door!! Location, Location, Location.  Everything is located just steps from our studio.  Waikiki has beautiful stretches of beach.  This unit is situated along the best part where the the sand is super fine.   Anything you desire is within walking distance - Restaurants, nightlife, hiking, running, bicycling, swimming, surfing, snorkeling, SUP, relaxing...  the list goes on and on!   The studio is small but has everything you need for a great vacation.  It has a lanai (patio) if you enjoy a cup of cof
neighborhood_overview: Waikiki is a special place and has everything every big city has.  It has breathtaking views and the island feeling, perfect place to relax!  Our unit is literally a 1/2 block to the beach and has everything you need to enjoy the beauty that lies within steps of the front door!
notes: Waikiki is a busy city hosting thousands of people so there's no way to block all noise but our unit is located on the back side of the building which helps reduce the noise levels.  The building is also dated and Hawaii has a moderate to hot tropical climate making roaches and other bugs unavoidable.  I have the inside of our unit professionally sprayed for roaches/bugs quarterly and we keep no food in the unit to try to avoid attracting them.  This building was built in the 1960's, and has some electrical issues. We have recently discovered our electrical system in the kitchen and bathroom are on the same circuit breaker. IF A TENANT IS USING APPLIANCES IN THE KITCHEN AND A BLOW DRYER IS TURNED ON IN THE BATHROOM OR MULTIPLE APPLIANCES, IT WILL TRIP THE CIRCUIT BREAKER.  If this happens call the front desk for 24 HOUR assistance. TO AVOID THIS HAPPENING WE RECOMMEND that you NOT use the stove, coffee pot, or microwave if you are going to use a blow dryer in the bathroom or run multip
transit: "The Bus" is the local bus line that is located very close to the unit, download the app to make the route navigation super easy! There's also moped and bike rental on the side street to the hotel and plenty of taxi and rental car establishments. The best and least expensive way to go to the hotel and return to the airport is via shuttle service which can be prearranged.  We also recommend using Biki Bikes, UBER or LYFT for getting around in town.
access: The studio is located in the Waikiki Grand Hotel and guests have access to all of the amenities the building has to offer from the pool to the observation deck!  The building is referred to as a condo-tel because it has a mixture of owner occupied units, vacation rental units, and hotel rooms.  You will be able to make yourself at home with everything at your fingertips! The building has a pool, rooftop observation deck, laundry room with ice and vending machines, Hulu's open air bar, and Teddy's Burgers.  Parking: Parking can be reserved on a first come/first serve basis by calling the Waikiki Grand Hotel front desk at ((PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN), their rate is $17/dy.  There is limited street parking.  Hourly parking is also located across the street at the zoo, their rate is $1/hr.
interaction: We live in town and get great joy out of helping people enjoy the beauty that is Hawaii.  I try to give my guests their space but I'm only a phone call or text away when needed!  My dad, Danny, and his lovely wife Sandy help manage the property so any one of us may respond to inquiries. Our unit has cipher lock entry so you will be able to enter the unit at agreed upon check-in (3:00 pm) and check out times (12:00 pm) without the hassle of linking up with the owner.  We will send the entry code and welcome letter after booking is confirmed.  Mahalo!
house_rules: 1) Please be respectful of our property as this is our vacation home that we rent out and not a hotel per se.  Please treat it like your home as well. 2) We ask that you respect the neighbors and keep the noise level reasonable, especially after 10 PM.   3) The Wi-Fi and cable are not owned or operated by us, they are services provided by the Waikiki Grand hotel.  We will not provide refunds because of Wi-Fi or cable connectivity but will immediately work to resolve any connectivity issues if they arise. 4) Please wash used dishes, a drying rack is located under the sink. 5) A trash shoot and recycle bin are located at the other end of the fifth floor, if excessive amounts of garbage are collected, please discard as necessary.  6) Please make a pile with the soiled linen/towels before checkout. Also, please do not smoke, do drugs, or allow pets inside the unit.  If smoking on the lanai please ensure the AC is turned off as the smoke will vent into the room otherwise.   Mahalo!

host.host_about:
I love the peace and tranquility of living here in the islands...  Hawaii has been my home for 6 yrs and I'd love to help you explore this amazing island! 

I love meeting new people and Air BnB has allowed me the opportunity to meet so many amazing people from around the world all trying to come to the islands for what is destined to be an amazing vacation! 

Please feel free to write me about the unit, I would love to have you as my guest in paradise!  

This unit is also managed as a family.  You may be communicating with myself, my father (Danny), or his wife (Sandy).

reviews.comments: Judith was a fabulous host. She was SO fast to respond to our inquiry which was great considering this was a last minute trip to Oahu for us. She was excellent at communicating and very accommodating in assisting us regarding questions on parking. The location of this unit cannot be beat! It's away from all the hustle and bustle of DT Waikiki, but literally you can walk down the strip in a matter of seconds, not to mention, you can walk to the beach within minutes! The interior of the unit is so tastefully decorated and homey feeling, it was perfect for my husband and I. The galley kitchen is so ideal, as you'll be able to pick up some groceries rather than having to eat out all the time. Kitchen items fully stocked. Excellent organization for a "city" size unit. My husband and I travel to Oahu for business quite frequently and most definitely would stay here again!
Great space in Waikiki! Judith has lots of amenities like dishes and a keurig that made the stay a bit nicer! I'd definitely stay here again!

So I am sitting in this wonderful restuarant overlooking the ocean and I strike up a conversation with a guy who is a Financial Planner for deca-millionaires and is on the verge of retirement.  It is obvious from the conversation that he has done well for himself financially even though he does not flaunt it at all. The conversation goes in several different ways all surrounding finance; politics and fiscal policy, trust funds, college education costs, insurance captives etc etc.  I love it!  I am in Hawaii from the Midwest and the weather is perfect and I am overlooking the ocean! I find out he travels to Hawaii regularly since his Daughter moved to the island.  His best advice for visiting Hawaii (Oahu)?? Stay at the hotel right down there and walk to everything since it is in the perfect location.  Well what do you know?  He was talking about staying in Judith's building!!  I proudly stuck my chest out and remarked "That's where we are staying!" 

The moral of that story?  This unit is in the perfect location!! 

This was my first time on AirBnB and my first time in Hawaii so it was a real risk to stay here.  But the Lord lead me correctly. We were 1/2 block from the beach and the busiest street in Oahu. 

The room was cozy and clean and Judith was more helpful than a Hotel concierge.  She emailed us in advance about some of the best places to eat and go and we took her suggestions on many of them and were not disappointed. The room was also stocked with extra stuff like a mat for the beach which we used when we went to the North Shore. We ate breakfast in the room daily and then we hit the road.

If you are looking to lounge poolside or sit in your bed the entire trip and gaze out of the window then this is not the place for you since the view is not great and the pool has no real view. 

If you are like us and want to actually SEE Hawaii then save money on accommodations and actually go DO stuff!!  We went Para-sailing, on a Helicopter flight around the island, Stand Up Paddle Boarding, to a Luau, on a Catamaran Trip, a 2 hour hike up some mountain (Kuholuo Trail?), rode in a regular paddle boat, attended the swap meet and Aloha Stadium for great cheap gifts had dinner at sunset at a revolving restaurant and saw the Sunset dip into the ocean on the North Shore plus other stuff.

Judith and this place were awesome.  I have got to return soon!!!

We loved this unit. May be small for some but for us it was ok. Clean, comfortable and very well equipped. Location is unbeatable, just a few steps from shops, malls, restaurants and bars. Despite the location this apt is quiet. Parking lot is available for US$15 a day, cheaper than hotels. View from the top of the building is awsome, really nice. We had chance to meet Judith, and she is great! Definitely she is a great host . We highly recommend this unit!!!

Thank you for allowing me to stay in your beautiful home.  Your attention to the little details made my stay perfect.  I highly recommend to any person staying in Waikiki to stay at Judie's condo.  Location was so great.

Judie was a great host, communicated really well and was really concerned with our comfort. We didn't have any problems while staying at Judie's apartment, but she was always available if anything came up. The apartment was very cute and a perfect size and had everything that we needed. It was in a great location, easily walk-able to all of Waikiki, grocery store and basically right on the beach. Check-in and check-out were super easy, too! I would definitely stay here again.

What a great place and location! Could not have asked for better. Judy was very personable and helpful, she kept great communication leading up to the stay and during. I hope we can come back one day!

The place was absolutely amazing especially for the price. It was also in the perfect location right across from the Honolulu Zoo and Waikiki Beach. However, there is limited (basically none) Wi-Fi in the room/hotel. Couldn't have asked for a better stay though!

Judith was great host, and  I could not be more happy with the unit or my experience.  She contacted prior to my arrival to give some details and the door code I stayed by myself, but the unit would also be great for 2. The unit was clean modern looking and for the most part had all of the accessories for a rental to eat, clean, ect. 

Judith would check up on me via text through out my stay to ask if there was anything I needed. 

I went to Costco near my home put the food plastic bags, checked it with my luggage and  loaded the fridge. This was a great option for me because of the convenience and it  both saved money on eating out.

The  Beach a stones throw away from the building.

There was also bar on the second floor of the building, where I met some really nice people from all over the world.  I met a local girl at the bar  who  invited and took me  to a local bbq a few days later, where I also met some great people. One day the bar also had this singer  who could of been a professional. 

I met some Aussie girls at the bus stop near bye, who invited me to a local bar with them  and even took me out to dinner a couple days later for my birthday.

I will definitely come back one day and I will hopefully be able to get the same unit again.  I went to Hawaii without a plan and not knowing anyone and made some great friends and memories.  I do not think half of the random fun experiences I had would of happened if I had not stayed there. Fun Times

Judith was a phenomenal host! I told her we were traveling with a baby and she borrowed a pack n play for us. She also checked in with us before and during our trip to see if we needed anything. 

Her place was perfect for my husband and 7 month old. We were able to prep baby food and make breakfast at the kitchenette. It was walking distance to the beach, zoo, parks, shopping and restaurants. She also had exactly what we needed for the beach; chairs, umbrella, beach bag, towels and even snorkeling stuff. The keurig and Bluetooth speaker were perfect bonuses. You should definitely stay here! 

Thanks again Judith!

This studio was absolutely perfect! It was fully equipped with everything we needed such as shampoo/conditioner, face wash, towels, umbrellas, beach chairs, a DVD player, and much much more. The kitchenette was perfect to cook some meals on and the bed was very comfortable. I had no problem sleeping on it. Judith was an amazing host! She replied to all of our questions as soon as we asked them and she made sure we found the place without any problems. Also, the studio is just steps from the beach and many shops. I would definitely recommend this studio to anyone looking to stay close to Waikiki beach!

I did not meet Judie, but communication by email was a breeze. She was able to accommodate an early check-in, which I very much appreciated. I really enjoyed my stay in the room. It is small, but packs a big punch: large comfortable bed, plenty of wardrobe/drawer space, nice kitchenette, and a rather private balcony. The location was also great - only a block away from the beach and close to the bus lines. Recommended!

Judie was very responsive and accommodating. The location of this place is ideal, literally one minute walk from the beautiful end of Waikiki. We enjoyed breakfasts at Lulu's around the corner with great views and good food. The only downside is that the place is very small, such that there is no place to put open suitcases anywhere. Other than that, great spot!

Judie's place was in the most ideal location, right across from Waikiki beach where it wasn't too crowded. The studio is exactly what u see in the pictures, very clean and cosy. The bed was super comfortable. Judie was lovely with her communication and made things very easy. The only downside is the wifi connection, u pretty much won't get any unless ur in the lobby, other then that our stay was fantastic and we will hope to stay here again

Thanks

the place was great! exactly as advertised. location is perfect- a 2 min walk to queens beach, nightlife, food, etc. judith was super quick to respond and was more than accommodating. sweet amenities. very comfortable spot. definitely an awesome choice in waikiki.
This place was so dope! Comfortable, safe, accomadating, clean & quiet. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.  Thanks Judith.

Great location! Very convenient for all things Waikiki. Parking availability was also a plus and convenient! The place is perfect for two. Cozy with all the amenities. Didn't have a chance to use the 2 burner stove but if we were staying longer we would have used it.
We had a nice stay in Waikiki. Studio was small but cozy - had everything we needed (incl. beach towels). Very well located, just a 100m from the beach. Judie was very nice and quick to respond!

Judith's rental was so, so great. We usually stay on the North Shore but as this was a last minute trip ended up finding Judith's place in Waikiki. A few things for others staying to know:
This rental has a lot of extras which weren't listed: a beach umbrella, beach mats, a cooler, 2 beach chairs, Keurig one cup machine. There was also aloe gel, etc left from previous renters which were nice little bonuses. Parking is now $17 dollars, not $15.  The ac and fan worked really well, we have stayed in Hawaii before with no ac and won't do that again. The unit was super clean and honestly seemed bigger than the photos. Judith was a class act when there was a scheduling snafu and still managed to make our stay seamless. Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Judith's Studio in Honolulu was perfect! From the modern decor and art to the cleanliness of the room to the location at the Waikiki Grand Hotel, the experience was great! A cosy and fully stocked Studio with literally everything (though I did not use it there was even beach chairs  and a small cooler hidden away).  Highly recommended and a great price!  Judith was also extremely accomodating with my check-in and times as well (coming from Los Angeles on a red eye).  Thanks Judith for making my stay excellent!

The location of #505 was great.  We had easy access to both trolley bus and general bus routes. Waikiki was of course right on the doorstep.. Lulu,s Bar &Grill steps away was great for an evening drink by the beach and we heard some great acoustic music in Hula's which of course is downstairs from the apartment. 
Everything in the apartment was as shown on the listing and fine.  Judith organised an early checkin for us after a long flight and responded quickly to a couple of messages we sent. 
There is however one significant negative; the hotel's air conditioning plant is directly below #505's small balcony and the noise meant we never spent more than a minute or two on the balcony.  Even with the balcony door closed the roar from the A/c below was quite intrusive.   Of course this is obviously beyond Judith's control.

Everything we needed or could have needed was provided in our room! It was a quiet room in the back of the hotel which I appreciated. The room was clean very tastefully decorated. Can't wait to recommend this place to family and friends.

The location of the hotel was great. Very close to the beach and right across the street from the Zoo. Many restaurants, bars, and stores were within walking distance. Check in was easy. Just needed to tell them our name and what unit we were in. No other process was needed since it was a private unit and we already had the code.
Walking into the unit it smelled nice, a/c was already on and the room was already cooled. The lanai/balcony doesn't have much of a view but the roof top deck makes up for that. The bed was comfy and clean. The full sized fridge was great to have as well as the stove, sink and other kitchen appliances. 
But overall, we really liked this unit. The bed was comfy the shower was really nice especially with the oversized shower head. Very well kept and very clean (minus the bugs on 1 towel.) The employees working in the hotel were very kind and helpful.

The BEST LOCATION! Thank you Judith for providing the perfect spot to have easy access to everything. I always look for a place that's clean and this condo was. Judith had beach chairs, a mat to lay on , and an umbrella for the beach. Also, a mini cooler, we used all of it everyday. Tucker and Bevy has the best salads and we packed up the cooler with their food every beach trip. We ate breakfast up on the rooftop and enjoyed the beautiful views of the ocean and Diamond Head. Judith checked on me just to make sure I was fine and if I needed anything. She was always prompt with any communication and I would definitely stay again! Thank you so much, Judith!

Judith's listing was just as described and when it said fully stocked she meant it. Shampoo, cream rinse, body wash, shaving cream, sun screen, beach towels and there were two beach chairs we used to sit on the beach to watch the sun set. There is not a table and chairs in the unit but there are two chairs and a small table on the lanai that we used to sit and eat our breakfast. When I booked this unit I asked Judith if there was a blender in the room, she said there wasn't but she would make sure to put one in there before we got there, and she did!
We did not get to meet Judith because her Mother was visiting from the main land but she emailed me several times during our stay to make sure everything was good and asked if we needed anything.
When we left and almost to the airport I realized I had left my bag of make-up in one of the drawers, I sent her a message telling her, she asked for my address and mailed it back to me. If we get a chance to return I would absolutely want to stay here again.

We stayed here for 3 nights. The studio was exactly how it was described, nice, clean and very tidy. It was in an excellent location close to everything. Nice and quite as well. Our host was very responsive and organized an early check in. We would stay there again while visiting Hawaii! The host has items for you to use, such as beach bag, beach towels, and snorkeling gear. The bed was very comfy as well. 
Thank you for letting us stay in your beautiful  apartment and experience Hawaii . 
Brett and Erin

This studio was perfect for all of my needs! It is a great place filled with everything you might require for a beach vacation (beach chairs, mats, towels, snorkels, toiletries, etc.)  and nice sized kitchenette! The bed is very comfortable and all of the closet space were huge bonuses. My absolute favorite touch are the two dvds in the room, they always remind me of Hawaii :)  The location is amazing, everything was walk-able (in regards to the Waikiki area). We had rented a car and only used it three times.

Judie was an exceptional host, she is excellent at communicating, very friendly and went out of her way to ensure our visit was perfect. I would not hesitate to book here again for the next trip! Mahalo Judie!!

Our Honolulu stay was absolutely lovely! Judith is very responsible and reachable, her place is amazing, 2 mins away from the beach, zoo, and shopping district! And it's clean! It has everything u need! The front desk of the building was also very helpful! Stay with Judith, it will be a plus for ur trip!
Great location, great communication, great hospitality, great value, great place,... -  I would definitely return - Thank you
Very nice studio apartment! Perfect for solo or couple travellers! If I ever go to Hawaii will definitely stay here again! Great location, loved staying here.

Absolutely wonderful place to stay. Everything we needed was available. Beaches, the park, shopping, great eats, it was all so close by, or a short bus ride away. Anything needed for a comfortable stay was already provided in the unit. Walking into the a/c cooled unit upon arrival was very much appreciated.

Full disclosure, this is my first Airbnb experience and I would definitely use this service again. When my girlfriend first arrived at the studio, we thought it looked exactly like the pictures. Very clean, very neat and very comfortable. The description of how far the beach is was very accurate and everything we needed was within a short walk. We felt welcome and enjoyed that Judith checked in with us via email midway through our trip. We found the beach gear available to guest VERY helpful. We hoped to add to their collection with a circle floaty for future guests to use. Overall, our stay here in this studio was very enjoyable and would definitely book with Judith again if we were ever in the Waikiki area.
Excellent location very close to beach. Unit exactly as described: Very nice, clean, new unit in an older hotel. Hotel soundproofing very good. Hotel staff very helpful.
Judith was great and very helpful with us getting settled in. The place was amazing! It was close to the beach and I would highly recommend to anyone!
Great Apartment in perfect location. Thanks again Judith!
Great little apartment, extremely close to everything you need in Waikiki!

Judith has been very accommodating and helpful. Our 8-night stay at her place has been nothing but perfect. The fully-furnished apartment plus beach stuff (mats, cooler, inflatables, etc) made our first time in Hawaii stress-free and nothing but memorable. Waikiki Grand Hotel is just a few steps away from the bus stop, ABC convenience stores, restaurants and most especially, the beach. I will definitely recommend it to my friends and will not think twice about renting the place again next time we come back to Oahu. 

Thanks Judith for being an excellent host!

The condo was exactly as pictured.  It was clean and Judith even provided little things you might have forgotten like razors or sunblock.  The condo is in a great location.  It's only a short block from Waikiki, near bus stops, the Honolulu Zoo and not far from Diamon Head.  Judith was a great host.  She was easy to communicate with and very responsive to any questions before and during my trip.

We had a great stay at Judith's place! The unit was exactly as pictured, and though it was a little small, it had everything that we needed. We especially appreciated the full sized shampoos, conditioners, sunscreens, etc as well as all the beach gear. The location was perfect, very close to the beach as well as to convenience stores and restaurants. Judith was extremely accommodating (allowed us to check out late as we had an evening flight) and responded quickly to messages. We would definitely stay here again!
We loved your location, right across the street from the zoo.  And right across the other street to the beach.

Lead-up and entry to the apartment was flawless. Room was exactly as described - very nice.

Situated very close to the beach in Waikiki - close to good food and shops. 

A great experience. Would stay again.

Judith's apartment was compactly & perfectly equipped and modernly fitted out. It was definitely living Aloha as it was so close to the beach which made swimming everyday our piece of heaven...we love the clear blue salty refreshing water of Waikiki,such a great place to recharge and relax...after  a swim we strolled along the beach to watch local turtles frolicking in their habitat or enjoyed a morning coffee and other days we cooked breakfast at the apartment and sat on the lanai We really liked being so close to transport too and found our way easily to explore outside of Waikiki too.

Had  a great time staying here in Judith's apartment, met her on the first day and she was very helpful.
The location of the apartment was perfect and the room compact, however, clean and tidy and everything was provided for including beach gear.
The location is a short walk to convenience stores, restaurants, bus stops and the beach.
Would recommend a stay here.
Judith was a great host! She was welcoming and provided all the necessary information to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable. It was easy to communicate with her.

We stayed in this place for 11 days! Here is our full review:

Let me start by saying that we are the kind of vacationers that just needs a decent place to shower and sleep in at night. We spend 90% of our day outside of the room.

Host: We never met Judith, but she was very responsive and nice. We forgot our Hawaiian chocolate presents in the freezer, and she shipped it to us to Washington DC! THANK YOU SO MUCH.

Pros: 
- Location, Location, Location! It is right in front of the zoo at the end of the Waikiki area/beach, which means less tourists and traffic. It takes about 10-15mins walking to be in the center of Waikiki beach, and 2mins driving to get on the highway. In my opinion, this was the perfect spot to be in if you are planning on seeing the entire island. Easy to jump locations and still be in heart of the city.
- Parking in the hotel was easy and not that expensive. Highly recommend getting parking in the building garage. It will save you lots of time.
- You get lots of towels, fast free wifi (check the back of the router for info to connect), AC, and electronic door lock (no need to carry room keys around).
- The bed and pillows were comfortable.

Cons: 
- Can't turn on the electric stove and AC or Fan at the same time. You will lose electricity right away, then you need to contact the front desk, so they can contact the building engineer. Depending on the engineer's schedule/location, you could sit in the dark for more than 30mins.
- The building is old + wood kitchen cabinets + beach area = few cockroaches! Highly recommend washing everything you use in the kitchen.
- Room size. The room looked a little bigger in the picture. There is about a foot between the kitchen area/wall and bed. Hardly any space to open your luggage, the fridge, or hang your clothes.

Overall, we had a great stay for the price and the host was very nice. I would not recommend this for family stay, honeymooners or groups more than 2 people. It's just too small. I recommend it for people who will hardly be in the room all day in a great location to be in.

Cute place which was perfect for our stay.  Loved that we had beach chairs, a cooler and towels to use on the beach.  We decided to rent a car and was able to park at the hotel for $17/day, which is affordable given most places are upwards of $25.   Great location a block away from the beach and close to many shops and restaurants.  Judith - thanks for a great stay!

Judie was a wonderful hostess. She was very good to communicate with us about everything and her responses were always quick and complete-very thorough.
The apartment was beautifully decorated and included a lot of extras such as chairs, pads, etc that we could use at the beach. 

The apartment is very close to the beach and is an excellent location. We enjoyed our stay here.
Our stay was fantastic! Thank you Judie

Perfect location! I loved morning walking along the beach . I had a problem with the Wifi and TV,and Judie helped me out quickly. The hotel is old, the cooker and microwave cannot be used at the same time. There would be power cut. Everything else was fine

We really enjoyed the location of Judith's place, right on Waikiki Beach (Zoo end) and everything was within walking distance, bus stop is literally less than a minutes walk if you want to check out the other sites away from the beach. The sundeck is great for sunrises and sunsets, the views are to die for. The room was good for us as we were out most of the time and we did utilise the kitchen for breakfasts. If you are looking for space, then you may need to look elsewhere. In relation to the air con noise, it wasn't bad as some reviewers have mentioned. All in all a great little place in a wonderful location. Thanks for a great stay, mahalo!

The room was accurately reflected in the photos, and had everything we needed for our longer stay in Waikiki. It was a smaller room, but a good size for just two people and the room is strategically arranged to work for the furniture provided. The location is excellent and easy to access the beach. We really appreciated having the beach towels, cooler and chairs provided from the room. There were no noise problems, and we used the stove most days and it worked well.
We had a wonderful stay at Judies comfy and ultra clean apartment.  All the features on hand for a great beachside vacation with location being 5 star.

Pros-
-Excellent location. So close to the beach, restaurants, bars, and a central location for driving all over the island. Starbucks and the ABC store are right outside the hotel which was great. 
-Parking- $17 a day was a deal for right on Waikiki and we used our car every day. 
-Clean, well decorated 
-Provided beach towels and boogie boards 
-10th floor deck had beautiful views of Waikiki and diamond head. Better in the morning because sunset is not really visible from the deck but it's easy to walk down to the beach for sunset. There is a patio but the view is of the AC Unit so we ended up on the deck every day. 
-Wifi and cable worked well. 
-Nice to have the kitchenette although we didn't really end up using it. 

Cons-
-Mattress was pretty terrible. There were large dips on each side of the mattress and hard to get a good nights sleep. Also seemed like the mattress was slanted and felt like I was falling off every morning. If it wasn't for this the stay would have been great. 
-There is a pool at the hotel, but it was pretty green and not too tempting to take a dip in.  But the beach is right across the street and that's really what you are there for. 
-I think the neighbors have pet birds. We heard A LOT of bird noises. 
-Although snorkeling gear was provided, most of it was broken.

Despite a wee hiccup on the first night which was beyond Judith's control and to which she responded / remedied very quickly the following morning, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the condo.  It was perfect for me as a solo traveller and I felt totally at home there.  The location is stunning and the views from the terrace towards Diamond Head, the zoo and Queens Beach unbeatable.  Considering how busy the place is there isn't really too much noise and there is just a great atmosphere all round.  Plenty of places to eat / drink within 5-10 mins, excellent buses to get you most if not all places, and oh yes the infamous ABC stores!! Fun, fun, fun.  Would definitely recommend. Thanks Jusith for the use of your place.

My husband and I had the most beautiful stay in Judith's apartment. Whilst small, it is very comfortable and it is in an absolutely fantastic location, literally across the road from the beautiful Waikiki beach as well as parkland including the zoo. There are many fantastic eateries close by as well. The apartment had everything we needed for a very comfortable stay, and the views from the top floor sun deck (of the building) over diamond head were magical. Judith was a very receptive host, and we found her really easy to contact and incredibly helpful. We wish we could go back every year!

Would highly recommand to stay in this apartment. It is close to everything important and this in walking distance. The apartment is small, cosy and very clean. The bed was very comfy and it also was never too hot bc of the fan and A/C. Judith was also concerned to offer her help if something was wrong, which we never needed bc everything was fine.

A great Aire BnB experience. This is a excellent location, and a property with everything you could possibly need, and yet more.  The room is not big, but the two of us coped really well with the space. It was extremely clean and we would recommend this to anyone.

Great location! Literally half a block to the beach (we liked the non walled side). The condo had beach chairs and a cooler which was great. The space is definitely small but by the end we were enjoying reaching a beer in the fridge from bed. Not a lot of space for suitcases or unpacking but if you're staying 5 days or less it's fine. Pre paid for parking but we arrived after 10pm and no hotel staff were present so we had to park at the zoo since we didn't know which parking spot was ours, the next morning I told the lady at reception and she refunded one day no problem! Highly recommend the 10th floor rooftop patio for breakfast!
Judith was an excellent host, everything went smoothly and was very professional and friendly. The location was AMAZING and the room and amenities were SUPERB. Would highly recommend

The place was great and as described for our Hawaiian getaway! The space is right on Waikiki beach and the tenth floor has a great view of Diamond Head and the beach. Thank you Judie for providing such a wonderful Airbnb!

Great place, awesome location! My favorite part was that the location was right around the corner from the beach. The place was also cozy and perfect for me and my girlfriend. It can be a bit cramped but for the price I don't think you can do much better. Definitely recommend!

The experience was great!  Love the proximity to the beach and Judith made sure we were well taken care of before we arrived.  In addition, I absolutely LOVE clean sheets and you can smell that everything was freshly laundered.

Do NOT stay here if you like electricity!  We had several electrical outages during our stay.  After attempting to reach Judith via two emails, text, and also voicemail, she finally got back to me after several hours in which she replied, "It was out of her control," and to try using less power.  She admitted that it had previously been a problem with other guests and must be because of the renovations they were doing in the building. That is something I feel should have been disclosed in the listing because knowing that the electricity could go out would have affected my decision to stay there.  

Throughout our stay, the electricity shut off repeatedly whenever we used the blow dryer, microwave, etc. and because the electrical circuits were connected to others in the building the electricity could go out when others used too much power so it was completely out of our control.  We were scared to watch TV, use the microwave, or anything of the sort because we were afraid the power would cut out.

There was a ton of noise in the building and we were awoken many nights by people yelling in the halls, fire alarms going off in the wee hours of the morning (happened twice).  Also, the ceiling light would mysteriously turn on several times during the night so we would get woken up by a bright light shining right in our faces.

Honestly, it was one of the worst places we've ever stayed and certainly the worst Airbnb place we've stayed at.  I feel like she was dishonest in not telling people upfront about the electrical problems that she was aware of and that other guests had experienced these issues.

Wir waren rundum zufrieden. Das Apartment war sauber und man hatte alles, was man brauchte.
Die Lage ist auch super.
We had a wonderful time at Judith's place.  The location is very close to the beach with some great places to eat in the immediate area.  the experience exceeded our expectations.

This place was AWESOME.

Pros: 
- clean 
- affordable
- across from Waikiki Beach 
- good location 
- Judith provided a lot of things you might need on a trip

Cons: 
- Really loud AC unit (but we are heavy sleepers so it wasn't a problem)
- firm mattress (this is a personal preference so it is a con for us but may be a pro for anyone else)
- Water heater was not consistent (sometimes the showers were just barely warm)
- Fairly small (wasn't a problem for us, but may be for others)

Our trip to Hawaii was completely out of the blue. My friends and I booked our trip when we found out BIGBANG would be performing a fanmeet/concert in Honolulu. With that being said, we spent almost all our money on the resale concert tickets and had very little left over for a room. 

Judith's place was the solution to all of our problems. Not only was it super affordable, it was clean and comfortable. Although the room is in an older building, everything else about it is very new and clean (which is the number 1 thing I'm looking for when I'm booking a room). I loved that Judith made sure to get us the code to get into the room early (before we even arrived in Hawaii). We didn't even need to ask/remind her that we'd be there soon. She made it so there was ZERO stress getting into the room after a long flight to get some rest. She also checked in on us halfway through our visit to make sure everything was going well, which we also really appreciated/weren't expecting. Judith provided some shampoos, lotions, etc, which was super nice of her because we had nothing when we got to the room but were too tired to go shopping right away. 

The room also had a little kitchenette, which we thought we would use but actually didn't touch at all. The food in Hawaii was so awesome that we ate out at least three meals a day. However, Judith supplies everything you would need in case you do want to cook. She also provided an umbrella and rain ponchos, which we didn't even think about before we got to Hawaii, but we were super appreciative of after we got there. We also ended up using her beach towels in addition to our own, alternating. 

Otherwise, we barely spent any time in the hotel room. We were only there for sleeping. We paid for parking through the hotel (which was $17/day). In hindsight, we shouldn't have done that because we were so rarely at the hotel. Our car was only parked for the 7-8 hours that we were sleeping, so we would have saved money if we parked across the street at the zoo ($1/hour). With that being said, it was sort of nice to have the car just downstairs so we could get going as soon as possible.
Through emails
Good location, clean, queit area, close to the beach!
Everything with our stay was great! The description was spot on and we loved the area. It was the perfect place for our short stay!

Judith's place is located right in the heart of Waikiki! We loved that we were steps from the beach and restaurants. The place was clean and the staff was very friendly. The place is small, but it has everything you could need for beach front living. Would highly recommend!

Had a wonderful stay in Waikiki. Place is small but very clean, well equipped and bathroom is really nice. The building is ideally located right by the beach, coffee shops, starbucks, a block from the water. Very pleased to see I couldn't hear any noise at night.
Check in was super easy. I recommend it!

This place is awesome.
You can't beat the location.
The unit was clean. The keypad entry code made it easy to come and go. 
Will definitely book again.
Great place in great spot!
Wonderful place if you're here for the beach. Super close and great access to shops

We stayed for three nights and it worked perfectly for us. The location was great. We were easily able to catch the bus to go downtown to visit the Capitol building, very convenient to the beach, easy walk down to Duke's for dinner and to pick up a rental car at the Hyatt Regency for a drive around the island. Very friendly and helpful people at the front desk.

This apartment is located in a great location, literally on the doorstep of Waikiki beach. The apartment has everything you need - free wifi, a kitchen, A/C, etc. We found the room very comfortable and it fitted our needs perfectly! Would  highly recommend to anyone who needs somewhere as base during their stay in the area.
loved our stay in this cute little condo close to the beach and everything Waikiki has to offer..
We had a wonderfull stay in Judith`s super comfy, cute litle aparment. Perfekt location and a great view from the 10th floor. Must stay!!! There are everything you need to have a great stay! THANKS!

Judith's room is a great little retreat from the busy streets of Waikiki. It's in a fantastic location - close to a bunch of nice restaurants and shops. There's also a bus stop just out the front, and a Waikiki Trolley stop around the corner. The room is clean and nicely decorated, and there's a whole bunch of beach gear on the lanai for guests to use. We loved our stay in Waikiki and look forward to returning again. Thanks guys!
Great location for Honolulu downtown!! Very close to Diamond head! Max of two people stay.
Judith's place was great and in a great location!

Das Apartment hat eine sehr gute Lage um Waikiki zu entdecken. Alles war sehr sauber, sodass man sich wohlfühlen konnte. Im Apartment gibt es alles was man braucht. Es hat wirklich an nichts gefehlt. Es gab Strandhandtücher Putz- und Kochzeug. Ich würde diese Unterkunft wieder buchen.

Judith's place in the Waikiki Grand was perfect for anyone looking to explore Waikiki for a reasonable price.  The place was very clean and perfectly set up.  It wasn't big but the space was utilized perfectly.  Judith seems to have thought of everything you'd need.  Overall I would highly recommend Judith's place and could even see us going back for round two.
Best value and awesome location!
Location location location

Great place to stay. Small but efficient studio. Clean and organize. Easy access to Wakiki Beach and restaurants. 
Lovely people. Wonderful weather. Host was more than helpful with any questions and requests. Thank you.
Perfect description. Excellent location. Beach supplies provided (chairs, tube, towels, cooler, etc.). It was great.

This place was perfect for our stay in Hawaii. Excellent location right next to shopping, food, and the beach. View from room wasn't anything to brag about, but that was okay because the view of Diamond Head and the beach from the 10th floor public balcony was amazing! The good part of room being on back side of building was it was very quiet. Room was small but had everything we needed and was very clean.

My husband and I stayed at Judith's place for our one year wedding anniversary and we loved it!! The place itself is a little small, but comfortable for two people if you do not plan to be in the room long. They have everything you need there for you though including a cooler, beach towels, boogie boards, beach bags, etc. They thought of everything!  The location itself if incredible!!!! Very close to Waikiki, just a few seconds of a walk, with a ton of restaurants and shops in walking distance. The view from the 10th floor balcony is absolutely incredible, the pictures in the listing do not even do it justice!  We communicated through Judith's dad, Danny, and he was very easily accessible and available with any questions. We LOVED our stay and cannot wait to stay here again! Mahalo!
Had an amazing time, location was perfect!  Its definitely a perfect place for two people, clean near everything and had everything we needed.
We stayed here in April of 2017. The apartment was located one block away from Waikiki beach and had beautiful views from the 10th floor! Would definitely stay here again on my next visit to Hawaii!

Choice spot just a block from south end of waikiki beach! 
Small studio for a single or couple but well-appointed with all you need to lay by the beach or to enjoy the nightlife nearby.  Would stay there again in a heartbeat!

No bugs.  Very clean.  Excellent location.  Building staff very friendly and helpful.  Enjoyed the beach and the lively neighborhood.  Not fancy, very pleasant.  Separately arranged parking with building management was very convenient.  If all guests will be especially careful to avoid tracking in sand and make sure that no food crumbs hit the floor, then this will remain a very nice place to stay for one person or a couple.

Very cute and cozy space.  The building is older but very clean and charming.  We really enjoyed the location and the ability to get to numerous nearby restaurants and attractions.  Rooftop view was awesome, great place to enjoy a bottle of wine and take in the view!  Host was very responsive and informative.
A great place close to all facilities. Beach equipment even included.  Bus stop was within 50m from the door and beach and restaurants within 100m.  Main pick up for tours one street behind.

This was my first airbnb stay and it completely exceeded my expectations.  It was a perfect place to stay.  We couldn't be happier with the location and view from the 10th floor sun deck.  I would definitely recommend this place to others.

Judith's place was as described, half a block from Waikiki and within walking distance to virtually everything you'd want to see in Waikiki. One advice I can give is if you do rent a car and park at the Grand Waikiki, ideally rent a compact car. As Judith mentions in her description (clearly I did not read it fully) the garage is tight and you go down/come up a fairly steep slope. We rented a mustang and it was tight. Great experience for the start of our honeymoon, we would definitely stay there again!

We took the "Speedy" shuttle from the airport $15/person.  As the shuttle pulled up, I could see the beach/ocean and I knew it was going to be the perfect place for us!  

The unit is very well put together and it's perfect for 2 (Website hidden by Airbnb) is on the small side but, again, it was perfect for my husband and I. 

 The owners  thought of everything:  2 nice sand chairs that recline, boogie boards, a real cooler (not a styrofoam one), really nice beach towels and really nice bath towels/washcloths! 

This listing was just as the owners have it listed and all the great reviews state. We loved that is was only one block to the beach!  It was a great unit in Honolulu -especially for the price!
Great place to stay! The location was awesome super close to the beach and the view from the 10th floor is amazing!
Clean and the location is fantastic.

Great location at the end of Waikiki beach.  Don't miss the aquarium and do make the hike to Diamond head.  It's worth it!  The place is small, but efficient with plenty of amenities you can borrow, though there seems to be some issues with power outages.  Running too many appliances can flip a breaker.  Not a big deal, the front desk just flips it back on if it happens.

Great place. Close to everything - the beach, shopping, restaurants. Set-up is fantastic with everything you need for a beach vacation. And Judith and Danny were very responsive to a maintenance issue that popped up during my stay!

The apartment was everything we expected and more, It was close to the beach, shops and public transport. It was tucked away in a quiet spot yet when you walked outside you were close to shops, bars and resturants. The airconditioning unit was great for keeping the room cool, beach chairs, blow up toys, boggie boards, towels and beach bags were a lovely touch. The room was spacious and clean, we were happy to be tucked away from the hustle and bussle when we returned back to our room after long days out exploring. We throughly enjoyed our stay and would have no hesitation in rebookig for our next stay.
Great location for the price.

My husband and I stayed at this accommodation for 2 weeks. We were so excited to get to Hawaii, we had always wanted to go and it finally happened. After arriving to the hotel with our rental car we had to pay for parking under the hotel. The parking garage was VERY tiny, if you are not good with parking or backing in, this is not the parking place for you. Parking was super expensive there. We later found out that people parked across the street at the Zoo because they didn't charge to park. I really wish we would have known that and saved ourselves $250.00 (YIKES). Anyhow, the lady at the front desk was super nice and helpful. We got to our room and put our code in to get inside, after opening the door I knew I was going to feel claustrophobic and overwhelmed the whole time. We had to big bags which fit underneath the hanging entertainment center, however it just made it seem even smaller. There was just enough room between the desk and bed to walk, between the entertainment center and bed, and then just enough space to open the fridge. We knew it would be small but I guess I didn't realize it from the photos. Of course, the size of the room is not a bad things, however if you are someone that doesn't like tight spaces and get overwhelmed it may be to small. Anyhow, after getting in the room I noticed the floor had sand and what not all over it. The cleaning lady came by and there was some confusion with her. I called the host who talked with me about the issue and said they would come by and check it out, which they did. After that I just cleaned it up. We had to end up cleaning the air conditioner filter out because our allergies were going crazy after a few days there. I had to clean out the fridge and freezer because there was food left in there. The host did provide several toiletries which was super helpful if someone forgets things. The description for this room explains the electrical issue with the microwave, stove top, and hairdryer. However, on 2 separate occasions, I used the microwave and the stove top at the same time and immediately it trip the breaker. Once that happened, we had to walk down stairs and ask them to turn it back on. The hotel does have a trash chute but it is only open 8am to 9pm which I thought was very weird. Anyhow, the hotel was located right across the street from the beach, right next to a Starbucks and had 2 restaurants inside of it. Along the beach there was numerous restaurants and shops so we just walked to them. Driving in that area is a pain and on several occasions we almost got hit by a tour bus. Our personal opinion of Waikiki was that is was...

Perfect location, quiet, yet just at the edge of the main drag. Literally across the street from the beach. Exactly as described. Super clean, excellent bed, no trouble with wifi or power cuts. Pool not really worth it,  but the beach is why you’re there! Probably a bit small for two people, but perfect for one. Check in was a bit unclear but the hotel staff were very helpful. Highly recommended and Id absolutely book again here.
This apartment is in a lovely location. Super easy access to everything and steps from the beach. Efficiently laid out space, well appointed, and clean. Would definitely stay here again.

Judith’s place was perfect! My friend and I came down a week of hiking and beaching and for what we used it for it was perfect. Many reviews say it’s small, which is accurate, but it’s quaint enough and you can still make your meals in the little kitchenette. It was truly great. The public balcony is fabulous for sunrise and sunset and everyone we met within the hotel was awesome. Definitely would stay here again 2 minute walk to the beach and the strip of Waikiki!!

Great location and a comfortable, clean and modern place to stay.  The room is tastefully decorated and pleasant to stay in. It smells nice each time you walk in the door and the host has supplied extras that make your stay helpful, like a cooler, beach bag, extra towels, beach chairs, coffee machine etc. The bed is super comfortable and the hotel/reception staff downstairs are friendly and helpful. Talk to the lobby concierge about tours.  Don't miss the views from the 10th floor observation deck.  The only draw-back to the room is that the balcony faces buildings and exposes you to the noise of the air-conditioning turbines of the lower floors.  However, you miss the noises from the second- floor bar and live music - which would have been worse.  Thanks Judith and Danny for a terrific stay.

Judith's place is awesome. No, really; it's awesome. For people who are in Hawaii to get out and see and do things, or just chillax and maybe go for a dip in the water at the beach; this place is great.  It is definitely smaller than a hotel room, but we didn't need space.
