neighborhood_overview: There is little reason to leave a 10-mile radius but Hilo is only 24 miles away, Volcanoes National Park 40 miles and the Mauna Kea Observatory, where you can view through telescopes, is 50 miles. Kona is 100 miles over the new saddle road making the connection to the other side in about 2 hours.  Puna Rainforest Retreat is special because you can stay in a private place in a natural setting away from the busy neighborhoods and resorts but are still close enough to enjoy the attractions.
notes: The 20 acre retreat is within the Puna Forest Reserve and our grounds are surrounded by rainforest that is part of the retreat.  Hawaiian Natives own  the non-private property within the reserve to protect the Native Ohia forest that is sacred to them.  The reserve was acquired by the Trust for Public Lands and transferred to the Office of Hawaiian Affairs.  The reserve is endangered species habitat for the Endangered Hawaiian Owl, Hawk, and Bat.  While these species are otherwise very rare they are often seen at the retreat. Researchers continue to identify new species and there is ongoing collaboration to control invasives.   The Ohia Forest has giant ferns, diverse species of orchids, epiphytic plants,  strawberry guava, passion fruit, geckos, praying mantis and songbirds.  The rainforest is very dense and so we ask guests to remain on the grounds for their safety unless we discuss the specific hazards.  The retreat property surrounding the grounds feature many skylights into lava t
transit: The retreat is centrally located with many attractions within a short distance.   It is quiet and has no light pollution for unbelievable night skies. Neighboring properties include La’akea Permaculture Farm and rainforest. Opihakao Road, only 1 mile away, is a world-class skateboarding hill and one of the best downhills and climbs for road bikes on the island.  Cycling is ideal here because of the short distances between attractions.  Natural steam vents are close by and funky Pahoa is 4 miles away offering fantastic organic food and supplies leaving little reason to leave Puna.  Pohiki Bay is 8 miles away and offer paddleboarding, surfing, body boarding, swimming and hot springs.  Kalapana and the new Kaimu Black Sand Beach are about 7 miles away near Uncle Robert’s kava bar and Sunday farmers market.  A recent addition to Kalapana is the UFO landing pad and star visitor sanctuary created by the Reinstated Kingdom of Hawaii.
access: There is a gate to access our property and you will receive the gate code when you make your reservation.  We value your privacy and don’t require interaction for check in or checkout unless you want to say hello or have questions.  Caretakers live next door and we are available if needed.  The property is very private and quiet. The only other folks you'll see are guests. Guests can use the BBQ and 1.2 mile rainforest trail around the 20 acre property.  Guests are also invited to eat fruit from the orchard including lemon, lime, orange, grapefruit, banana, soursop, guava and avocado.
interaction: We value your privacy and don’t require interaction for check in or checkout unless you want to say hello or have questions.  Caretakers live next door and we are available if you have any questions.  The property is very private and quiet. The only other folks you'll see are guests.
house_rules: Maximum occupancy is 4 people.  Smoking is okay outside.  Please turn off outside lights when you go to sleep.  Keep kitchen clean to deter bugs.

host.host_about:
Elijah and I raised our daughters in both Alaska and Hawaii.  Our company, Chilkat Environmental is hired by AK Tribes to clean up contamination on their lands. In 2015, we became the grateful owners of Puna Rainforest Retreat.  We work hard everyday  in efforts to make this place awesome.  We love Hawaii and even though we were only a couple miles from the 2018 eruption we wouldn't trade this place for anywhere. 

Elijah is a mt. biker, engineer, and fixer of all the things that break around here.  I am a dancer, gardener and cleaner of all the dirty stuff.  We are so thankful for our neighbors, Patrick and Beverly who take care of this place when we are away.  

Mostly, we are delighted to share this magical place with all the guests who are drawn here to experience the peaceful beauty and soothing sounds of nature.

reviews.comments: The stay was great. Directions to the property were very good, which is important as most flights from the Mainland arrive at night. The cabin was very clean and had everything we needed. The bed was very comfortable. They have done great job landscaping the grounds, which a very well maintained.

This lovely little cottage is in an amazing private setting just a few minutes from the town of Pahoa and the Puna coastline.  This was just one of several colorful cottages on the property.  We had everything we needed from comfy king and twin beds to beautiful views to coffee in the morning and night hours filled with the sounds of the jungle.  A great find!

Jacklynn is the best organized & kind host ever. I haven't met her up or heard her voice(we just text msged) but im sure that she is very considerate. Her cottages are very new and the land is beautiful. You will have absolutely everything you'll need in the cottage. I really loved the kitty Oscar tooo i miss her already. She showed up everytime i call her name. Puna-Pahoa area's beach roads are also awesome. There's no reason not to choose Jacklynn's place again.

We really loved staying in the Lavender Orchid cottage. Jacklynn is truly a superhost, remotely running the picturesque property with multiple cottages. All her instructions were perfect, and her text responses were immediate whenever we had questions. This area of the big island is excellent for nature lovers, and it will wow you with sights and sounds of a tropical paradise. Jacklynn's cottages are near all the hot spots...including historical lava flows, black sand beaches, and beautiful ocean vistas. Our cottage was lovely...with a cute kitchen, super clean bathroom, great sitting area, and a super awesome king-sized bed. It was also well stocked with whatever you need...toiletries, kitchen utensils, etc. Our favorite part of the stay was listening to the frogs at night as we went to sleep. It really is the perfect place to relax after a full day exploring the island. Thanks Jacklynn!

Jacklynn was welcoming from the start with quick replies to all of our inquiries. Once we arrived, the Lavender Orchid little cottage was delightful with ample sized rooms, well furnished and nicely stocked for bathroom supplied, utensils and appliances in the kitchen and even biscotti waiting for us on the dining room table. This is a great place to get away about 10 miles from the nearest town, Pahoa, but still accessible to many things. The night sky is amazing with so little light pollution and the frogs singing at night is wonderful to fall asleep to.

This is a good place to go off-grid and enjoy the beauty of smells, sounds and sights of the tropical forest. The place is comfortable, best to book for a week stay to truly sink into the rythm. The bed was super comfortable, I slept like a baby. The property is guarded by a lovely cat that guides you through the sights :) Also, clean, quiet and good for couples to get away.

We had a wonderful time in the Rainforest Lavender Orchid!
The cottage was very clean and exactly as expected. This spot is very quiet, with beautiful sound of nature and just perfect for relaxing. We would definitely come back.
Sincerely, Dominic & Sandra
Nice cottage!

Located within the Puna Rainforest, the 'Rainforest Lavender Orchid' cottage was a real gem! Just outside the nearest town of Pāhoe, the cottage feels secluded and private. The stars at night are amazing!!! Everything you need for a comfortable stay, the bed is huge and super cosy! Great location for exploringVolcano NP/Mauna Kea/tide pools/ Hilo/Akaka and Rainbow Falls.

This is the second time we'd stayed on this property and again we'd felt very at home. It rained during our stay fortunately, the strong WIFI connection at the lavender cottage allowed us to enjoy some Netflix. Thank you Jacklynn for hosting us.
We loved it and couldn't recommend it more highly!
Very nice clean cottage. Easy to relax in. Nice amenities comfortable bed
We had a great stay at the Rainforest Lavender Orchid Cottage! The cottage was very clean and the whole place was quiet and calming. It's a perfect stay to relax. We already miss Oscar :)

Our rental at this rainforest retreat exceeded our expectations. The cottage was lovely  and the land was so beautiful. Jacklynn and Elijah are two very special people. They both took the time to make sure we were taken care of. We got a chance to share some story with them and they were kind to share what they knew about the island. We will soon be building our own little place here but this will be our new little home away from home.. see you soon! Much love from Joel and Vanessa!

We couldn't have picked a better place for a weekend getaway. The house was clean and had everything we needed. The bed was so comfortable and the hot shower at the end of the day was amazing. We loved that there was a small kitchen because I wanted to cook breakfast and dinner during our stay and it was perfect. We will be coming back for sure! Thank you so much!

If you're in the Pahoa area and want to stay in the rainforest I'd recommend this any day! Clean and spacious, loved listening to the frogs at night and a wonderful location if you wanna be close to the beautiful hawaii nature. We actually liked this place so much that we extended our stay with one more night! Recommend!

Oh Jacklynn!!!We so enjoyed our stay at the Rainforest Lavender Orchid! We were there for a week and it was just perfect! Your were so welcoming and made us felt at home right away.  The sunrising from the bedroom is going to stay one of my good memories.  I hope we could see each other someday in Alaska! Congratulations for this beautiful project!

Puna Rainforest Retreat and our cottage, Lavender Orchid, was beautiful. The cottage was clean when we arrived, with everything we needed for our stay. The king bed was very comfortable. Bathroom was great. Nature sounds are quite loud at night, which was a nice change from bustling city noises. There are a couple of small fans in the cottage, but enough breeze comes through the windows that they are hardly needed.

The grounds were beautiful and everything was well maintained. It's a short drive to Pahoa town, where there are a few restaurants and other shops. There is a great little guide for ideas of things to do in the area, with directions to some great black sand beaches and tide pools. 

We had a great stay in this gorgeous retreat.

Staying at the Rainforest Retreat was a great experience. The cottage was very comfortable and had all the amenities we needed. We cooked most of our meals in the cottage. We also enjoyed meeting the visitors staying in their other Rainforest Cottages. Jacklynn and Elijah were friendly and helpful and gave us some good tips for sights to see and places to cycle. We also enjoyed the use of their swimming pool. Thank you Jacklynn and Elijah.

Effective communication. Extremely considerate host. The soaps and suds were high quality and Jacklynn left us freshly-picked fruit at the doorstep. Falling asleep with the song of rainforest birds was pleasant. Definitely recommended.

Had a great time at the Rainforest Lavender Orchid. It was cozy and had all the comforts that our family needed. The location was wonderful, in the middle of the rainforest  and so remote and tranquil.

This is a beautiful spot, loved sleeping to the sounds of the rainforest. 
The owners were fabulous and super helpful and approachable.

It's a wonderful experience of staying in this place. Very clean and quite. No light pollution. Jacklynn was very considerate by putting a baby crib in the room even we didn't request. Will definitely recommend to everyone who is looking for a place to stay in puna area.

There were 4 adult family members in our party and we found the "studio" cottage to be quite comfortable. From there we explored as far south as Ka Ale South Point and as far north as Waipi'o  Valley. Sitting on the deck watching the sun come up every morning was a great way to start each day.  We highly recommend Mighty Sushi in Pahoa! It is the best sushi any of us ever had and is a small family owned business.

Rainforest Bliss

If you're looking for tranquillity on the Big Island then this is the place to stay.
We spent 5 nights in the Lavender Orchid cottage, which along with the grounds are beautifully maintained. 
The retreat is about 3 miles from the small but decidedly interesting town of Pahoa which has a fantastic whole food shop with a large range of food, fruits, veg and drink. 
The Volcano National Park is around 40 miles away and definitely worth visiting.
The large area around the cottages contains two nature trails which are home to many rainforest flowers and creatures.
At night (especially after a rain shower) you are seranaded by tree frogs. 
If you are venturing outside during the dark hours the view of the night sky is awesome.
All in all this is an amazing place to stay!!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in the Rainforest Lavender Orchid! Jacklynn and her husband greeted us when we arrived and were lovely and very helpful. Their awesome cat (Oscar?) welcomed us as well whenever we pulled in and walked us to our door. The grounds of the retreat are well taken care of and the cottages are adorable, bright and extremely comfy (loved the king sized bed!) Pahoa is a artsy little town with little shops and great restaurants but far from touristy. Also, it's in a great location for smaller beaches, warm pools, Uncle Robert's Awa Bar and the Volcano National Park. I would definitely recommend a stay here!

Jacklynn's husband was out weed eating when we arrived. He was kind, welcoming, and has a great sense of humor. We felt welcome and at ease immediately. The cottage was beautifully done with high quality beds and a nice economy kitchen with everything we needed, including a nice little gas range, blender, etc. The bathroom is beautiful with a nice tub and shower and an on demand water heater provided lots of hot water.

I had a very relaxing week enjoying Pahoa and the scenic red road. The hosts were very friendly and very accommodating. I found my room to be well equipped and cozy. I had no problem cooking most of my meals here. I would stay here again.

A very quiet "neighborhood" because our only neighbors were the sounds of nature and occasional greetings when we encountered guests from the other three cabins.  The grounds have a distant view of the ocean. The cabin complex is down a long curved private driveway through the jungle,  so it can't be seen from the road.  I forgot that there is a coded gate, so I had to hop the fence and walk down to find Jacklynn's husband to get the code.   

I'm a building contractor, so I was looking over the construction thoroughly, just out of curiosity.  The cabins are in tip-top shape, with amenities we hadn't counted on, like a DVD player.   We didn't use it, but it could have been handy on a rainy day.  There were also some local guidebooks.  We accidentally took a large Hawaii guidebook from our cabin, but we'll return it, probably today. 

It's a great base to explore this part of the island, but use your GPS to find the turn-off for Ala-ili Road if you come when it's dark.  I missed the turn off when returning the first night after we had already checked in.

I'm sorry we didn't stay longer so that I could have had an opportunity to meet both our hosts and learn about how their water and power systems work, as well as the local culture.

This was an amazing find.... We wouldn't stay any where else on the island. We cooked everyday....we bought a small rice cooker but other than that it was fully functional kitchen.  The bathroom is great & there is lots of sun in the cottage. The king size bed is like sleeping on a cloud. The rainforest sounds at night are relaxing.  The property is well kept. The hosts let you do your own thing. You don't have to do anything but drop your stuff off & go adventure.  There is really no check out or check in which is great.  It felt like our own little home away from home. Eco-friendly amazingness!

What a beautiful place to stay! It was very well maintained and clean! The property is gorgeous and even has it's own little hiking trail. Easy to find and even though it is about 30 miles south of Hilo-it is very easy drive to just about any place on the Island. There are several cottages, but still felt like we had plenty of privacy. I would highly recommend this vacation rental-the price, condition, location and hosts are amazing!!! I did a lot of research before renting it and now, more than ever, feel this is the best deal on the Island!
Very nice and private cottage. We enjoyed our stay even though it's a bit far from our activities. The only complaint is the bedding. It smelled like it was not washed from previous hosts.

We LOVED this cottage! Our favourite accommodation out of the 5 places we stayed while in Hawaii.

So cute, comfortable, well appointed, and the bed: like sleeping on clouds! I wanted to smuggle it home with me. 

We cooked a lot of meals and found the kitchen well appointed - it's small but had everything we needed. The bathroom and kitchen share a sink which we didn't have a problem with. Smart use of space.

It was cool and rained a lot in this area, which was actually nice and relaxing after long hot days hiking or sightseeing. We loved the coqui frogs at night!

We hardly saw our hosts or other guests (when we did they were very friendly), but did make friends with the adorable cat. Even though I am allergic I could not resist patting it and then rushing to wash my hands!

Thanks for having us in your slice of paradise :)

Stay here. It was an amazing experience. The cottage was tranquil and airy. The beds were super comfortable. It was a great mix between a home and a hotel because there was a kitchenette and a few DVDs but everything was immaculately clean. Even though it is in the middle of the forest, it is still a quick drive to Hilo and the volcanoes. Absolutely perfect!!

Wow, Wow, WOOOW!!! Jacklynn's property is seriously a gorgeous Rainforest retreat, exploring the surrounding towns & nature hikes was a very cool way to escape the touristy madness. Me and my family stayed in the Lavender cabin, it was comfortable, super clean with modern amenities and so cozy. We really enjoyed our stay on the Big Island, what an unforgettable experience!

Die Unterkunft war genau wie beschrieben. Ein schönes Haus in einer wunderschönen Umgebung. Jacklynn ist eine liebe und lustige Frau und ich glaube sie liebt Ihr Rainforest. Das sied man an vielen kleinen Dingen die liebevoll zusammen gestellt sind.

cottage is perfect!  Cozy, comfortable, very airy. Smart use of space. We loved the coqui frogs, even if we were scared that is going to be a problem to sleep with those "songs" 
We hardly saw our hosts or other guests, very private place. Even If I'm not big fan of cats, "Edward the Cat" as we named him, stole my heart.
The most beautiful night sky I've ever seen!

The cottage was perfect, it had everything we needed and more. It is well kept, and the grounds are beautiful. Great location to explore Puna. Uncle Robert's is a must do and easy to get to from the cottage. Would return next time we visit the Big Island.

This place is an absolute gem!  They harvest the nightly rain water and filter it to be used in the cottage and my skin has never felt better.  The cat (Oscar) was so friendly and really made the experience so comfortable.  The interior of the cottage felt very luxurious with a super comfy bed.  Will definitely be coming back.
The Purple Cottage was a quiet, peaceful and relaxing comfort to all my senses.   The grounds are immaculate and the pool is refreshing after a long day in the salt pond.

Beautiful house excellent place. 
Very relaxing sounds at night are amazing everything its close to it 
Thanks

The cottage is next to a beautiful reserve, a real cosy place to stay. I would definitely stay again! Loved Big Island, even a week was not enough time. We were out every day all day.
Communication before & during stay was great.

The Lavender Orchid cottage was the perfect little isolated piece of heaven to get away from the hot Kona sun. Cutest yet of my Airbnb experience! The host included many books for a nice afternoon tea time reading while listening to the soothing rain drops. The place is clean and comfy. Don't forget to bring a pair of cozy socks or fuzzy pants as the night gets a bit chilly! Convenient way to check in/out. Great for people who prefers efficiency. I've already told my friends and they wish they've found this place first

Das Airbnb ist ziemlich im Jungel. Für 1-2 Nächte ein Erlebniss. Für länger empfele  ich etwas im Süden auch vom Wetter her. Jacklynn, haben wir nicht gsehen. War aber per Airbnb Mail sehr hilfsbereit.

The unit itself was terrific.  Felt like being at home, not at all like a hotel, and it's great to have an individual cottage!  Everything was clean and well kept.  Jaclynn was very responsive to questions.  The location is remote, but if that's what you're looking for, this is a great option!

Also got a tour of the large 4 bedroom house.  It's stunning.

The cottages on this estate is fantastic. Situated in the rainforest but not too far from shopping etc. Everything was good, cottages were clean and cozy, and Jacklynn responded within an hour on all of our questions. Highly recommended.

Great location--close to beaches, nature, and all the necessities! The friendly cat that loves greeting people is a bonus:) Although we weren't able to meet Jaclynn in person as she's traveling, everything was arranged ahead for us and we felt very at home during our stay. Also enjoyed some delicious biscottis that the host left for us in the cottage. Would definitely recommend!

The cottage is in a secluded location around 7 miles away from the nearest town, Pahoa. My cousins and I had a great time here, soaking in the environment. It was a nice change of pace compared to Waikiki

The area was very quite and peaceful along with Oscar the cat who we enjoyed during our stay. We would return on another visit to the island.

Thanks-
Everything was as it appeared it be in the photos, in fact better! Our cottage was just right for our needs, very quiet and comfortable!

We absolutely enjoyed our three nights in the Puna rainforest. The cottage was very cozy and had everything we needed. 
It is located in a very quiet and peaceful area. If you want to see the lava and visit the volcano the location is perfect. It is also a nice location to just have a break and relax. 
There isn't an A/C but if you leave the windows open the breeze is more than enough. You'll even need the cozy, comfortable blanket on the bed to not get cold ;) Just don't forget your earplugs for all the frogs at night.
inspite of some miscommunications initially, Jac and Rebecca were very helpful. The property is very quiet and restful. definitely recommend the blue cottage!

We stayed in the Lavender cottage .   The property is about 30 minutes from Hilo. We were able to travel to the Lava flow and geothermal pools during our stay. The cottage was cosy:  a master bedroom , a second bedroom, a bathroom and a small kitchen. The bed in the master bedroom was big and very comfortable. The kitchen has a stove, and a small fridge, but no microwave. The only sink for the cottage is in the bathroom. We were provided with plenty of towels, shampoo and cleaning supplies. The environment at night is like being in the midst of a jungle:  tree frogs croaking and starry skies (when clear)   There were many different trees that were in the property:  avocado, banana and citrus. Our host was awesome- making sure that we were comfortable   Our "Butler", Oscar, made sure we were welcomed when we came late at night. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

As a first time Air BnB user, we were very skeptical of what we would find; however, we were delightfully surprised.  The cottage was clean and exactly as represented in the photos, aside from the lines, which they obviously need to change after each guest. There were four in our party, 2 adults, 2 children (15 & 10) and we fit comfortably in the cottage.  My husband and I had our own space, and was able to relax and enjoy peaceful moments on the lanai, while our kids hung out in the living/dining area. 

It was great to be able to cook breakfast and dinner in the cottage.  Hawaii can get expensive.  There were more than enough kitchen supplies to make cooking easy. Make sure you check the cabinets for seasonings, oil, etc. before you hit the grocery store.  There may already be some essential items there.  

We communicated with Jacklynn via e-mail.  There was really no reason to meet with her.  All of our needs were met and we had all the necessities we needed.  When ever I did email her to ask questions, she was quick on replies. 

The location was perfect for us.  Our goal was to explore the eastern side of the big island and the Pahoa area turned out to be a perfect home base.  We were a hour from the volcano and Waimea.  We found it hard to adjust to the speed limit in Hawaii.  You definitely have to have an island life mindset.  No speeding, no tailgating... etc. :)

I want to thank Jacklynn for sharing her incredible property with us. We had a wonderful, memorable time at the cottage.  My kids loved Oscar the cat (now they insist we get a cat).  It's an experience I recommend for everyone .. listen to the sounds of nature, appreciate the moment, and just relish in the peacefulness of the retreat. Because during the day, you will be wearing yourself out hiking, snorkeling, zip-lining, etc.. The cottage was our calming sanctuary.  We will definitely return when we get a chance.
Très belle place isolée pour avoir de la tranquillité mais relativement près des grandes attractions si vous avez une voiture.

Jacklynn's Lavender cottage is perfect! 
The property looked just as described. We were very pleased with how close it was to everything we needed for our trip. About 15 mins to Kalapana to see the lava and 10 minutes to Pahoa village to get something to eat. She communicated with me very easily too. I would definitely recommend this place, especially if you're going to the Big Island to view the lava. We got amazing video! 
Thanks again Jacklynn!
We had a nice and relaxing stay in the lavender cottage. Jacklynn is very responsive, and instructions are easy to follow. Being 'greeted' by the cat was a sweet touch. Thank you!

Great location, beautiful grounds, well-equipped, spacious and clean cottage. We'd love to come back some day. The cat (Oscar) was so sweet! Thanks to Jacklynn and her husband for taking care of this amazing place and putting so much effort in for her guests. We really enjoyed our stay!
Beautiful and relaxing place to discover the Big Island. Thank you Jacklyn for your hospitality and advices

This was my second stay at Jacklynn and Elijah's cottages, and it was just as enjoyable as the first.  The location is private and quiet, while still being close enough to Pahoa for easy access to groceries and restaurants.  We had a wonderful, relaxing time, and look forward to returning again soon.

My boyfriend and I had no problem finding the property out of Pahoa for the Hilo airport. The cottage is on a huge property out in the rain forest. We had a wonderful stay in the lavender cottage. 

Pros: Staying here will make you feel really feel like you living with the locals for your stay. There are also beautiful landscapes and views for sunrises and sunsets. The cottage is fully equipped with shampoo, soaps, towels, and other house hold items. Also, it's pretty close to Volcanoes National Park. 

Cons: because it is a bit secluded from town, it can be a bit daunting to go out for dinner because it 30 min from Hilo. And there aren't that many places to choose to eat from. Also, you will have neighbors. If you want to be completely alone, this isn't the place for you. Also there is no air conditioning, but that is the majority of places on the island. But we had wet clothes to dry that never dried. 

Overall, I did enjoy my stay here and I would stay a here again.

We loved our stay here! The lavender cottage was clean & comfortable & very peaceful. The king bed was very comfy & so was the slide out in the living room. The little kitchenette & mini fridge were adequate for our 2 night stay ( we had a cooler for beverages) & prepared 2 breakfasts & a supper, and took advantage of the cooking on the nice grill outside. The grounds are beautiful & the nature trail is a bonus! The location is convenient for exploring the Puna area. A big mahalo for creating such a lovely environment! We hope to return someday!

Very nice and quiet cottage. There are a few other cottages on the same property right by each other, all look very cute. The place is very secluded and pitch dark at night without lights. We slept very well. The wifi connection was slow but it wasn't unexpected at a tucked away location.

Jacklynn has been an amazing host! Great communicant, Jacklynn has been answering all of our questions prior to arrival and offered to place a crib for our little girl even before we asked for it! We were greeted on site by a warm welcome. The House is super clean, looks brand new, right in the heart of a tropical forest! You will hear at night the tropical birds singing as if you were all alone in the forest, no exaggeration and truly amazing. The property offers an unbelievable private hike over 1 mile long in the tropical forest, the lava flow trail is a few minutes down the road where you can rent a bike and sea the lava going wildly into the ocean, and Volcano National Park is about 40 minute drive from the House. There is a grocery shop 10 minutes from the House where you will find everything you need. We truly had a great experience being Jacklynn’s Guests and highly recommend this place to stay.
Everything was perfect. It was very clean, also contact to the host was very nice.
The place was peaceful and clean. Nice location! Really close to kalapana and lava viewing which was awesome.
Wonderfully relaxing! Easy to find. Such a cool place.

We stayed in the blue cottage for the majority of our trip and then the lavender cottage for two nights. We loved both. Clean, comfortable, and adorable. We appreciated that each cottage had a selection of DVDs, too. Lovely property. We also, of course, loved Oscar, the cat.

It s a really nice and cozy cottage. The main bed is really big and comfortable. Really nice environment if u want a peaceful place to stay.  Birds sing all the time. I used (Hidden by Airbnb) map to locate the cottage, it was easy to find. It s really close to the volcano viewing, also not far from volcano national park and Mauna Kea.  Enjoyed this place very much !

This was an absolutely beautiful and spacious cottage in a beautiful area. The instructions and communication were professional and easy. We had no problems during our stay. Although this was somewhat off the beaten path, it was a central location to explore all of the island, we just chose a different direction each day! Loved being in the rainforest, and loved the flexibility of the cottage for a couple or for a family. Very clean, and the bed was oh so comfortable! Friendly and courteous guests in the other cottages as well!
It is very nice place,you can enjoy forest,fresh air,bird sing.It is lovely place to stay.Very clean and comfortable.

this is a quiet cottage, have a very beautiful view when you arrive , you can have a whole house for your vocation  except no washing machine, I and my wife have a wonderful vacation here, if you want to see volcano national park or want to hike to lave flow to sea, this is a very good place for you and your family

My son made all the reservations for our trip to the Big Island and I knew he would find us a nice place, but further than that I had no expectations.  When we came to the end of the small road leading to the cabins I thought we had arrived in an enchanted village!  There before us was a rainbow collection of beautiful little cottages – yellow, blue, green, lavender and even a bright red utility cottage.  They are spaced generously apart so as to provide privacy, on a huge grassy lawn, each differing a bit in size and floor plan.  The lush tropical landscaping, much of it just the jungle fighting to take over was lovely and relaxing. The interior of our cabin was overwhelmingly spacious and gracious and immaculate.  The bedrooms were so comfortable and offered such magnificent views that I didn’t mind at all when my energetic  son occasionally took off for a tour, leaving me to lounge in luxury. Every detail was just what we needed – the small but efficient kitchen provided everything we needed. To top it off, the place had an irresistible resident cat, Oscar.  My only disappointment in our entire stay was that Oscar politely declined the chicken I offered him.  I guess Puna Rainforest Retreat provides him everything he needs, just as it did for us.

My only reservation in writing this is that I fear it will encourage the rest of the world to swarm to this idyllic place, making our inevitable return difficult.
Wonderful, calm remote location. Perfect accommodations. Exactly what we needed!
Mellow place, located next to a sweet town

We stayed 8 nights at the Lavender Orchid Cottage and truly did not want our stay to end.  The entire property is a well cared for Oasis from the world and if you are looking for a private and quite retreat from the hustle and bustle then this is the place for you.  The cottages are nicely spaced and you won't hear your neighbors.  You should probably plan on arriving before the sun goes down as the road may be hard to see, but once you get to the gate, the access is easy and the parking is color coded for each cottage. There is a lovely trail around the property that we enjoyed hiking.  We didn't use the pool, but it looked nice and we did see others enjoying it.  The Lavender Cottage was better than pictured and contained everything that we needed.  The kitchen is small, but has a stove, pots & pans for cooking and a small fridge/freezer that fit our stay perfectly.  There is only one sink, in the bathroom, but it didn't cause a problem as it had been designed very nicely.  The bed is as everyone else before use described, very soft and comfortable - with the night breezes we slept the entire trip.  The frogs are loud so either turn on the fans or bring ear plugs.  The cottage is in a great location - there is Malama Market (grocery store) down the street (and drug store) that has everything we needed, or Hilo is just a short drive if you want Safeway, Target, etc.  We ate dinner one night at Kaelo's Bar & Grill in Pahoa - it has great food and drinks (you may want to make a reservation because it's always pretty busy).   If you get a chance visit the Hawaii Tropical Botanical Garden ($15 to get in but well worth it).  Afterwards you are just a short drive to Whats Shakin' a fabulous place to get real fresh frozen fruit drinks and lunch.  These are both on Old Mamalahoa Highway in Pepeekeo just outside of Hilo off Highway 19 (4 mile scenic route).

I would recommend staying in this place! It is peaceful, comfortable, clean. Check-in and check-out were easy. The immediate area is beautiful-- sunrises over the ocean every day! And you are so close to lava flows, beaches and good food in this part of the island.

My husband and I stayed for 10 days to celebrate our honeymoon.  The amenities were perfect and so comfortable. The stargazing was amazing, and the location was great, close to Hilo and Volcano, but Pahoa is a fun town to explore too. I would recommend this place to anyone that wants a beautiful place to call home while on the island. It was absolutely perfect!

This place was a great, secluded, private getaway for our family. All four of us enjoyed staying here. It is cozy and fit our needs for our stay. It makes for a great home will visiting the Puna district and was relatively close to everything on that side of the island. We can't wait to plan our next trip.

I love the quietness and lack of light pollution at this cottage. At night, you can sit on the patio and see the whole Milky Way! Wifi was spotty when we were there, but it can be a good reason to unplug and unwind.

Jacklynn's place is an incredible, secluded getaway.  Take some time to soak in the beauty of their Pahoa forest retreat.  There is a nice trail around the property and star gazing from the lanai is not to be missed.

The cottage was comfortable, well kept, and well stocked.  Kudos to Jacklynn's decorative taste--the cottage was notably adorable (including the landscaping).  The cottage retreat was an unforgettable one for us and we can't wait to make it back!

If AirBnB would offer a 6th star, this place would get it from us. We stayed a week with Jacklynn in the Lavender Cottage, and enjoyed the place very much. It's quiet and beautiful, neat and practical, with a groomed garden surrounded by a wild forest of many species of flowering trees and plants, with birds to sing to us all day, and coqui frogs to lull us to sleep at night. It was so easy to relax ourselves. The only regret: We should have stayed even longer! Centrally located near Pahoa, tide pools, and of course the Hawaii Volcanoes National Park (which alone is worth visiting for several days), we can only recommend to all Big Island travellers to choose one of Jacklynn's cottages as basecamp for excursions.

The cottage is really lovely. It's a little remote but therefore very quiet. There is also a patio with sun in the morning. We had everything we needed while we stayed there. Communication with the host was very easy and friendly. We would definitely stay there again.
Such a beautiful location and the home was perfect for our stay.

What an amazing retreat after long days exploring Hilo. This cottage and surrounding property is everything I have not experienced before but am so glad we were LUCKY enough to stay here at the Lavender cottage. Looking for a quiet, clean and refreshing place to unwind, this is it. Don't just take my word on it, go ahead and read all the other 100 plus reviews I read through before I decided to book too. Only regret, we only got to spend 2 nights. Mahalo Jacklynn!

Gute Unterkunft
Nette Katze, einzig das WLAN funktionierte nicht.
Ansonsten einwandfrei.
Nice place. Jacklynn sent me detail instruction right after the reservation is confirmed.
Absolutely amazing stay. Would recommend to all! Thijs

Unique place and much different than your typical Hawaii rental. Very secluded out in the rainforest. Was a perfect way to slow down after an action packed trip. Wifi was in and out but that helped us unplug. Lots of stuff to see in a 10mi radius. Bring your snorkel gear for the tide pools.

What a fantastic, gorgeous slice of the rainforest this is! The Lavender cottage has just the right amount of what you need to be comfortable in an area that is a bit remote. Do be prepared to venture out for sightseeing/activity spots, as the Big Island certainly lives up to its name! Jacklynn was great to communicate with and the on-site/nearby support team were happy to assist with any additional needs. If you're looking for a lovely getaway to be surrounded by chirping frogs and insects and the neverending stars at night, this is the spot for you!
Excellent cottages in a beautiful area.  Recommend
Oscar is great, the location is beautiful, if youre looking for seclusion and relaxation this is the place for you! Would def book this location again!

Beautiful cottage, quiet, clean. Check in is pretty smooth, communication is effective. The full kitchen is wonderful. What need to mention are there is no microwave in the cottage and wifi is backhauled by satellite, which is not stable. However, these are not problems for us, we enjoyed the stay really much. Absolutely will stay here next time.

The cottage has a unique location in the middle of the jungle. You also positively get in touch with the nature. The rooms are efficiently protected via insects and functionally equipped. The internet is very unstable which can be annoying if you need WiFi for your trip (e.g. booking trips, searching for restaurants). Breakdowns for hours are not unusual. The overall cleanness of our room was good but partly improvable (e.g. bedsheets and silverware). We do not expect the latter to be a comprehensive problem and would recommend the accommodation.

Perfect hideaway. Breeze was delightful. Simple extras like shampoo, pool towels and tea bags and paper towels were generous and helpful. 

Would love to return and stay longer.

Nous avons passé un très agréable séjour dans cette belle villa. Le lit double est fantastiquement confortable ! L'ensemble est très propre et douillet. Internet y fonctionne très bien. Attention, impossible d'y venir sans voiture car cet ensemble de 4 villas avec piscine se trouve au milieu de nul part. Mais c'est ce qui en fait son charme avec les cris des grenouilles et oiseaux. Notre seul regret : ne pas y être restés plus longtemps que 3 jours !
As described and pictured. No sink in kitchen and only in adjacent bathroom.  Great value for price.  Trail on property nice touch. Easy and helpful communication with host.
Very lovely cottage located in picturesque Pahoa forest. Close to Pahoa and lots of great beaches and hiking spots. Comfortable and efficient cottage with beautiful grounds to explore.

The space was beautiful and well kept. Jacklynn has an amazing property and it was exceptionally clean. The stargazing from the porch was amazing at night. Jenny is an absolute doll. The one drawback is the internet connection is unreliable and often does not work. Otherwise this is a perfect place to stay!

Jacklynn's set of cabins is beautiful and serene. We stayed in the Lavender Cottage and it had everything we needed. It is in a very secluded area which meant it took an hour to drive to Volcanoes National Park which was longer than we planned but that was our fault, not hers. We also failed to plan for our breakfast, but luckily we went to Pele's Kitchen in nearby Pahoa which was awesome!! I would recommend staying more than one night if you can!

Super nice and beautiful place in the middle of the rainforest, with singing frogs in the night a lots of stars. 
The cabin is clean and cosy and has all you need for living. 
Don't forget to visit Uncle's Awa place in Kalapena near by for good food  and live music.

溶岩などを見たい人にはとても良い場所です｡車で10分走れば溶岩見学の入り口に到着します｡
そこからﾚﾝﾀﾙ自転車(訳20ﾄﾞﾙ~30ﾄﾞﾙ)で砂利道を45分走ると海に溶岩が流れるところを見れます｡
結構な距離があって熱を感じるなどはできないのですが､その場所から山のほうに小一時間歩くとあちこちに赤い溶岩が流れており､運が良ければ触れるうような距離まで近づけます｡
部屋は快適です｡意外と涼しくてｸｰﾗｰがないのですが問題ありません｡
冷凍庫で氷をうまくつくれませんでした｡
一番困ったのはｲﾝﾀｰﾈｯﾄです｡
日本からWifiﾙｰﾀｰを借りたり､AT&TのSIMを持って行ったりしていたのですがこのｴﾘｱ~溶岩ｴﾘｱではほとんど使えません｡
仲間を含めてPahoaｴﾘｱで3件の宿にｽﾃｲしましたがどこも同じ感じです｡
JacklynのところはFree Wifiがあったので条件は良かったのですが､たびたび接続が悪くなってしまい､屋外にﾘｾｯﾄの作業に行かなければなりませんでした｡
とても静かでよいところですが､夜に到着するとだいぶ場所がわかりにくいので注意ください｡

The small cottages are in the middle of the rainforest which is absolutely quiet and beautiful. Your hear nature and the rain at night and the terrace and the view is so romantic. Jacklynn was very helpful and provided all the details we needed to check in the middle of the night. The cottage is really nice and well equipped and super clean. The only visitors were the cute cat and some geckos. We were only two persons but I think it fits four people easily as well. Also the kitchen had everything we needed to prepare breakfast (even a blender, perfect!). We even extended our stay and would love to come back soon!!

This is really an absolutely perfect location for traveling around the south side of Hawaii Island, within a short drive of Volcano NP, and tide pools, beaches and all of the unique flora of the Pahoa area; plus Pahoa town is a short 5 minute drive where there's food and drink and plenty of shopping opportunities. The cabins are clean, new, well equipped and provide a restful and quiet location for sleeping "under the stars".
The orchid cottage was adorable! Comfortable beds and clean rooms! The wifi and power were both spotty, but the loving kitty on the property almost made up for it.
Such a stunning, healing and peaceful location.  Loved every second. Highly recommended.

Rainforest Lavender Orchid Cottage was lovely! There are nice view, quiet and comfortable place. Kitchen was easy to use, so I enjoyed cooking.
I would like to stay again!
Sweet nice, in the middle of the nature, accommodation.  Nice private hiking path. Worth to stay!

Nice and cute tiny house far away from roads, traffic and noise. Easy check-in and good communication. The living room has two extra beds. Be aware that the ones staying in the master bedroom always need to go through the living room if they want to go to the bathroom or to the kitchen. So it is a nice place but I recommend this place for 2 people or a small family only.

강추. 매우 깨끗하고 조용하고 충분히 넓고 안락함. 
Lava viewing point 가거나 화산국립공원 갈 분들 강추.
아보카도와 라임 등 직접 농장?에서 수확한 과일도 있어서 고마왔음.
단 하나, 인터넷통신이 잘 안 잡혀서 처음 찾아갈 때 당황함. 좁은 산길(Ala'Ili road)로 우회전 했는데 길 중간에서 목적지라고 구글맵이 완료됨. 당황하지 말고 좀더 직진하면 왼쪽에 우편함에 주소(13-3773) 있는 붉은 돌 깔린 진입로 있음^^
하와이 3번째 였지만 이 집이 가장 좋았고, 기억에 남음.

The cottage was lovely and the location was perfect for visiting the tidepools and lava flow. Sketchy WiFi and minimal kitchen (no sink), but if you don’t need WiFi and you’re not planning on doing a lot of cooking, you will probably love it. Quiet, secluded, and very natural setting. Friendly and accommodating host.

Go to this excellent area:::go to the end of Route 130 and take a bike rental late afternoon/evening to see the lava, walk the Kealani Iki rim trail and lava tube trail in Volcano National Park, eat amazing fish taco/burrito from the fish restaurant in Pahoa corner strip mall and enjoy Hilo.
This was an excellent and spacious stay, secluded and peaceful. It perfectly fulfilled my expectations in every way and my only regret is not being able to stay longer.

This is a little treasure away from everything, with the most amazing night sky with millions of stars. The house is beautiful and well equiped. A hip little town is nearby and all things volcano within easy reach. Can only recommend this place!

A nice private space with fruit trees and beautiful space. Highly recommend that you take a walk and pick the ripe fruits - they are delicious. The shower is great and the bed is really very very comfortable. You wake up to the sun peeking through your bedroom, and you can do star gazing at night. Lava viewing is only about 15 drive away, and hippy Pahoa is only less than 10 min drive away where you can get your supplies, have coffee and food. 
Tips - If you need your wifi to stream movies and be connected all the time, this is probably not the place for you. The wifi is spotty and limited (was disconnected even though had rebooted the device a few times). The shared sink for the kitchen and toilet is interesting and needs some getting used to, do read the listing description as it has given great details. We knew about the set up and thought it was no big deal, but still felt kinda of inconvenienced and bothered about food and human waste sharing the same space. That could be just us.
pretty cottage. nice design. But it is very wet in this area and even the quilts Are wet and cold. Landlord is very nice and helpful.  You can see a lot of stars and milky way in the Giant garden.

Jacklynn's place is a great place to escape and experience nature. This house is a retreat cabin style unit next to a few others just like it and they make up a rainbow color. You can see a beautiful sunrise- when we went in December, I think the fruits are not ripe yet but the landscape around the house is like you are walking through a well groomed forest. There is a small kitchen and fridge but no microwave and the internet and cell service is not super reliable which could be a pro/ con depending on what you want. In our case, we needed directions to go to volcano national park so we just drive out of her property toward Pahoa until we found service again to get the directions. I think it rains here very often but fortunately during our stay we didn't get rained on!

What a delightful place to stay. Perfect location if you are doing the hike to the surface lava flows (which we did and highly recommend). Also read the tips for local places of interest; we went to the tidepools and the snorkeling was amazing!
Thank you for opening up your delightful space for guests.

Good place to stay!
What you see is what you get!!
非常棒的地方!推荐!

Jacklynn’s place is simply beautiful. It is located on well maintained property surrounded by nature. One of the advantage is its proximity to Kalapana from where you can go hiking to see lava flow. We would recommend this accommodation to everyone seeking nice quite place.
What a wonderful off the grid cottage and experience.  Can’t wait till next year.  One night was not enough!
nice cottages in really nice farm. highly recommended

Jacklyn's place was secluded and quiet. Very peaceful, my husband said it was almost a religious experience. No tv, time to read and spend time with my love on our 35th anniversary. 
Mahola Jacklyn

This is literally close as you can stay to the currently active fissure (fissure 8). If you want to experience the beating heart of the Lower Puna eruption, this is *the* place to stay. At the time of this writing, there is no legal area from which to view the lava directly, but there may be one soon. 

Despite its proximity to the active fissure, it's totally safe. We came with our baby daughter. Air quality was good thanks to the trade winds, and most of the truly noxious stuff gets generated at the ocean entry point (and then blown off to the west along the coast). Furthermore, Jacklynn has a sulfur dioxide detector, which has shown safe levels the entire time, but the cottage also has an air purifier if you’re still worried.

Even if you can’t see the lava directly, being less than 3 miles from the fissure is incredible. The volcano is continuously generating its own clouds which reflect the bright light of the lava back down to the ground, causing a wide swath of the sky to be filled with an eerie red glow. After baby bedtime, my wife and I sat out on the patio and just stared at the shifting crimson clouds for almost an hour. The coqui frogs make it pretty hard to hear the eruption itself, though occasionally we caught little sounds that may have been lava sloshing in the distance.

On the retreat property, there are also (as of this writing) a number of steam vents where hot steam is constantly billowing out of cracks in the ground. These are all downwind of the cottages, so their slightly sulfurous odor won’t affect you unless you go exploring.

Another cool thing: At least when we were there, the entire area from Pahoa down to the retreat had a unique smell that is hard to describe. It’s more sweet than sulfurous, and I miss it now that we’ve left.

An alternate place to stay would be somewhere in Nanawele estates. You’ll probably get a broader swath of red sky from Nanawele. However, I still think Jacklynn’s place is better: the view from the cottage balcony is amazing, and Jacklynn is a great resource for tips on exploring the area if she’s around.
ﾊﾜｲ島の自然に囲まれた､静かなｺﾃｰｼﾞです｡日中は幻想的なｽﾁｰﾑﾍﾞﾝﾄの風景､夜はｺｷｶﾞｴﾙの合唱との満天の星空を楽しめます｡湿度はかなり高めですが､他では体験できないような生活を楽しむことができますよ｡
Cute place.  Close to the charming town of Pahoa
100% would recommend and will return with time!
Jacklynn’s place was so cute and had a great atmosphere! It was slightly difficult to find at night, but the host gave great directions!

We had  a good trip on Puna Rainforest Retreat.
We love Location and home  everything ^ ^

We rented out the entire estate for the week and all our families/friends dispersed among the cabins/main house. My husband & I rented out the Lavender cabin for his family and we stayed in the green one. This property is breathtaking and such a special place to stay and visit. The rainforest surrounds you and it feels like you are far away from all worries, there is so much natural beauty to experience here.
One of my many favorite perks was the outdoor tub full of rainwater that is heated by the volcanic steam vents, it's like a nature jacuzzi. The private walking trail is a must, we even walked it at nighttime with a big group of us. There are wild pigs that occasionally pop up, butterflies, moths, and the coqui frogs are always singing at night. The stars sparkle and shine so bright here and they blanket the night sky for miles. I did not want to leave and all of the guests in our group felt the same way. Jacklynn and her family were so accommodating as well, a huge thanks to them for allowing people to use this beautiful space.

Directions given were precise. Set GPS early. The cottage was as per the pictures. Beds were super comfortable. The kitchenette was well equipped. During my stay, it was cooling and aircon was not needed at all. Jacklynn shared her fruits gathered from the Orchard with us which was a lovely thought that put a beaming smile in my mum’s face. Will recommend my friends to stay here!

This place is gorgeous. Catching the sunrise on the first morning was amazing and the hike around the property was lovely. We loved the privacy, even with the surrounding cabins. It’s a close drive to a lot of what we wanted to see. It is immaculately clean. We will be back again next year!

Jacklynn's place is very peaceful. It is off the beaten path, and surrounded by nature. It is close enough to Pahoa, so you can grab groceries, etc. FYI, the birds are fairly loud so if that bothers you, bring ear plugs. There is not A/C, but it cools down at night and so this wasn't an issue. Also, there is only a stove and no microwave, although once again, this wasn't an issue for us. Would definitely recommend.
good experience
a lovely quiet Oasis in the midst of fissure 8!
Lovely, cozy, quite place !!

It is simply magical to be absorbed into nature. Jacklynn's place is about a 30 min drive from Hilo and VERY private and serene. Absolutely, walk the trail around the property and take a dip in the hot tubs heated by Volcanic steam!  My husband and I hope to return someday soon!  ~ Mahalo

Her place is amazing , we really enjoyed staying ,cooking, watching stars,yoga in garden.
Surely recommend!!!

Truly beautiful setting to witness power of Goddess Pele, and extraordinary to see how these caretakers of the land are honoring and developing the land to be a sacred setting for guests to enjoy. Very relaxing and special experience.
A peaceful and beautiful setting with such a charming cottage. Friendly and ressponsive hosts.

Jacklynn was an amazing host!! She is super kind, our little cottage was perfect and cozy for us! We enjoyed the volcanic rock hot tub and picking some fruit! I would definitely suggest staying here if you want to get away from the city and relax!!!

Jacklynn’s place was everything we wanted for our stay. The cottage was quite, clean, homey and it’s easy to find. self checking was very convenient. At night, you can stargazing and it is amazing. Jacklynn’s family is very welcoming and nice people. I would highly recommend this place to others.

Jacklynn and Elijah were amazing hosts! My partner and I decided to drop our car keys in the ocean (losing them) and we wouldn't of made it throughout that ordeal without them! We loved staying on their property and felt so close to Pele there! We hope to come back with a group one day and rent the whole property because we loved the vibe and the people so much!

This was a magical place to stay. It provided the full feel of being on a Volcano with the steam vents within view of my patio. The cottage was clean and comfortable with a cute aesthetic and everything I needed. Jacklynn was very helpful and accommodated me even when I had travel problems and had to adjust my stay last minute. I will definitely be back, and bringing friends, and maybe even hosting a yoga retreat here!!! 

If you want to connect to nature, this is a great central location to many of the natural wonders on the Big Island, and really easy to get to! Cell reception is limited, and I had a bit of trouble with the wifi, but this is a space to unplug, and I was grateful for every moment from the rain and frog sounds to the beautiful and magical volcano energy that is saturated in this wonderful space.
Such a wonderful place! Definitely one of the best Airbnb places I've yet visited. Tranquil, quiet and well appointed. Such great energy! We hope to return!

This was a magical place to stay. It provided the full feel of being on a Volcano with the steam vents within view of my patio. The cottage was clean and comfortable with a cute aesthetic and everything I needed. Jacklynn was very helpful and accommodated me even when I had travel problems and had to adjust my stay last minute. I will definitely be back, and bringing friends, and maybe even hosting a yoga retreat here!!! 

If you want to connect to nature, this is a great central location to many of the natural wonders on the Big Island, and really easy to get to! Cell reception is limited, and I had a bit of trouble with the wifi, but this is a space to unplug, and I was grateful for every moment from the rain and frog sounds to the beautiful and magical volcano energy that is saturated in this wonderful space.

What a unique experience! Cottages were quaint, well taken care of, and had everything we needed. The property offers a once in a lifetime experience, with the vents from the volcano and the hot tub and bath that were heated naturally. Elijah was a wealth of information, but only if desired, and Jacqueline was so welcoming! We would not hesitate to stay here again.

What an amazing haven of peace! Beautifully decorated. Jacklynn and Elijah  are amazing, lovely, profound and open-minded guests. Perfect location. You wake in the morning with an amazing ocean view. You fall asleep lovely sound of the rainforest. The property offers lots of surprises such as a very well maintained trail in the forest and hot tubs. Simply the best place to rest and restore your energy! We hope to come back again soon!

name: Studio for 2 downtown Mtl
summary: Nice studio located on the 6th floor. Quiet,warm and cosy. Leather sofa, paintings on the wall, glass table and  washer and dryer in the unit. Ideal place to cocoon in downtown Montreal or to use as a central launching station for all your activities
description: Nice studio located on the 6th floor. Quiet,warm and cosy. Leather sofa, paintings on the wall, glass table and  washer and dryer in the unit. Ideal place to cocoon in downtown Montreal or to use as a central launching station for all your activities I usually meet the guests myself and show them around the building.i'm available from 8am to 10pm if you have any questions
interaction: I usually meet the guests myself and show them around the building.i'm available from 8am to 10pm if you have any questions
house_rules: No smoking in the appartment No pets Please do not make noise in the corridors or on the terrace

host.host_about:
Airbnb host, businessman and motorcycle journalist. I travel often for short stays.

I am fun, simple and love meeting new people.

reviews.comments:
Eric made check-in easy! Overall this is a great property. Highlights:
- nice bed / folds up into wall for extra space
- quiet building
- internet is fast when I tested (10 mbps up and down). Wireless and wired internet available.
- interesting view overlooking Place des Festivals
- TV and cable were convenient for watching hockey. TV accepts HDMI input.
- dishwasher!
- Braun coffee maker
- only two flights of stairs to great rooftop patio
- the unit receives a lot of AM sun which is nice, but bring a sleeping mask if you sleep late.
- the building's ground level retail includes a useful convenience store
- great location!
It was one of the best places I've stayed through AirB&B and Eric gave me plenty of good city advice.
Séjour au cœur du festival de jazz! Appartement propre, moderne et bien équipé. Très bon accueil d'Eric.

Nous avons d'abord communiqué avec Eric par mail et nous avons tout de suite senti que nous avions affaire à quelqu'un de sérieux et de très gentil. Tous nos mails ont eu des réponses rapides. 
Il a fait en sorte que notre arrivée se déroule parfaitement et c'e fut le cas ! :D
Eric est venu nous faire une petite visite après quelque semaines pour savoir si tout se passait bien. Nous avons eu l'impression qu'un ami nous rendait visite.
L'appartement lui même était tout à fait conforme à la description et à nos attentes. Tous les équipements que l'on pourrait souhaiter sont disponibles et flambant neufs.
Très bien situé et au coeur du quartier des spectacles, nous avons tout fait à pied (tout près des commerces rue Sainte Catherine, 20 minutes du mont royal, 25 du quartier du Plateau...) et le métro est au pied de l'appartement.
Le seul "bémol" serait que les nuits étaient parfois perturbées par les activités bruyantes du quartier. Mais ç'a n'a en rien gâché notre séjour.

Amazing view of Place des Arts. 

This appartment was perfect for us. Not just a great location (just in front of Place des Arts Subway station, a block away of a grocery store) but it has a great view of Place des Arts. I really enjoyed the look at the Festival Mode & Design, from the appartment's window.

Very good Equiped: dishwasher, hairdryer, plenty of tableware, you can easily cook anything you want. It has Air conditioner, which was perfect for those hot summer days. Washer and Dryer inside the appartment.

It was a very clean appartment. You feel like in a hotel room, plenty sets of  white sheets and many clean towels, if you want to change it.

 I had to check in earlier, so I had the chance to meet the cleaning Lady, who was really attentive. 

If I am back to Montreal I would rent it again, no doubt.

This is hands down the best Airbnb I've ever stayed in! Eric was the perfect host, communication was excellent! The apartment was amazing, spotless, fast wifi and the perfect location in Montreal. 

We were a 10 minute walk away from old town and right on the main shopping street! There's so many places nearby ie grocery store & coffee shops and also right next to a tube station if required. 

Absolutely no negatives!

Bon séjour dans le studio d'Eric. Il a été très disponible pour répondre à mes questions et faciliter mon arrivée et mon départ.
Le studio est bien, très bien équipé. Il correspond bien à la description et aux photos.

We never actually met Eric as he was working abroad, we did however speak on the phone, he was very pleasant and helpful. Eric's brotherinlaw dealt with our entry into the apartment and everything went smoothly. 
The accommodation was exactly as described and could not have been better, it was perfect for transport, both buses and metro, also easy to walk to most tourist areas. I would certainly recommend Eric as a host to anyone visiting Montreal, I know he has more than 1 apartment and I would imagine they are all of the same high standard.
Bonjour je suis resté 1 semaine à Montréal dans l appartement de Éric qui est très fonctionnel et très bien situé dans le quartier des spectacles je le recommande vivement

Eric was in touch with us before arrival and he met us upon arrival.  We arrived early in the day, dropped our bags at the apartment, and began exploring Montreal. The location is perfect for public transportation and exploring on foot.  We stayed for a week, enjoyed the "backstage pass" from the roof-top terrace, and slept well. Eric recommended a great sushi place just a few doors down! The hot water, ac, and washer dryer were all welcome.
The location made it easy to tour, shop, eat, return for a rest, and begin again.
Would stay here again and recommend it highly.

Eric was great.  He was always in contact with us and made sure that we arrived safely.  As soon as we arrived, we spoke with him by phone and he gave us some information about the apartment.  We asked him about restaurants and grocery stores in the area and he was a great help.  Very nice host.

Eric was a great host!  He was very helpful when we asked him about the city and the space.  He always responded to any questions we had promptly, and he was so kind, going out of his way to make sure we had a great time in Montreal and at his apartment.  As for the space, it was perfect!  It is located across the street from the metro, walking distance from St. Catherine st, and there is also a grocery store, a top rated cafe, and a top rated creperie on the street within 1-2 blocks of the apartment.  The space was clean and beautiful.  We loved staying here!

We loved our stay at this lovely apartment! The place was clean and exactly as pictured, and Eric was a great host! The location is right by the festivals in downtown Montreal (we were there for the first week of Just For Laughs), and close to shopping as well as old port. Would highly recommend!

Nous avons été très bien reçus par Éric, l'appartement était très propre, mignon et bien équipé (sèche cheveux, équipement de cuisine, serviettes de bain...) et en plein centre ville, ce qui était très pratique (la bouche de métro est juste en bas de l'immeuble). L'hôte était toujours disponible par téléphone ! Nous avons pu profiter de notre séjour comme nous le voulions !
L'hôte à vérifié que nous puissions bien rentrer dans l'appartement que nous avons trouvé très confortable et très propre .

Eric's apartment was in a great location.  He was very accommodating and was reachable whenever we needed him. The description and pictures in the advertisement were a good representation of what you can expect. Overall, great experience and a very kind host.

The apartment is very conveniently located. Almost everything you would want to do in Montreal is within an easy walk. The apartment has a nice view of the fountains at the Metropolitan Art Centre. The shopping district of St Catherine street is a couple of blocks away. It's close to McGill and so lots of cafes and Bistros in the area to hop in and sip a latte. The apartment is well furnished. There is a washer dryer in the bathroom. 
The kitchen is well equipped but the cookware is limited to a large pot to boil pasta. So you may have to buy a cheap pan if you plan to cook at the apartment. Adequate crockery and cutlery is available. There are provision and departmental stores just around the corner. There is a cafe on the ground floor of the building. 
Eric made the check in process super simple and organised. It was like we were walking into an apartment we had lived in for months. Truly enjoyed our stay and would definitely consider staying at the same place in the future.

Great studio in a central and vibrant location! The Metro is a 2 minute walk away (if that), making it such a breeze to get most places. The space itself is perfectly suited to a solo or couple travelling, and was very clean when we arrived. Eric was a fantastic host who was very clear and helpful when we had questions. Would highly recommend!

I stayed for about 3 eeeks at Eric's while in MTL for business.  The location is central and steps for the metro which worked well for getting to the office and back this winter :)

Eric was very communicative before my arrival and once I arrived.
L'emplacement est génial.  Au coeur du centre ville, du quartier des spectacles et près du vieux port de Montréal.  Tout se fait à pied et en transport en commun.
Ottimo soggiorno. Posizione veramente centrale, vicino a tutti i servizi: bar, negozio alimentari e servizi pubblici nelle vicinanze. per raggiungere il centro non servivano i trasporti pubblici.
Eric's place was perfect for me. Great location and had everything I needed. Everything went very smoothly. Thank you Eric!

The location was perfect and the condo was comfortable, great location, well worth it, and clean.  Eric was great at communicating quickly with us and I would recommend Eric's Airbnb condo to anyone.  I hope to return and stay if you would have me.

I stayed at Eric's apartment for 2 weeks while working on research for my dissertation. I could not have asked for a more gracious, accommodating, and kind host. The apartment is spotless, comfortable, and in a prime location: a 15-20 minute walk from any major site in the city. The roof desk with great views of Mont Royal is an added plus! Eric responded almost immediately to all of my messages making check in and check out seamless. I cannot recommend Eric more highly!
Eric was amazing! As soon as I arrived, he contacted me to give me recommendations of the area. The place was very clean and comfortable. Great location, near Place des Arts.

Great value for money apartment. Public transport connections to all neighbourhoods very easy, or walkable if you are energetic. Number of local supermarkets and some very good eating place within striking distance. Our trip was a very pleasant experience.

Awesome location! Steps away from the train and from one of the public BIXI bike docks. Close to a bunch of restaurants and bars, lots of nightlife in the area. My girlfriend and I spent a week here and it worked out perfect for a simple smaller place. Would recommend.
Nice, quiet, well-furnished studio, well-equipped kitchen, very convenient location, friendly and responsive host, and a wonderful stay

The space is very clean, well located very closed of metro station, the infrastructure is excellent, quit, easy communication, even during the raining days it is easy to move and find anything that you need
The apartment has e everything you need, I strong recommend Eric’s apartment

I would have given this property 5 stars, expect for the noise factor due to the Jazz Fest. So like 11 out of the 12 months of the year 5 stars. I was in Montreal for school / work, so I needed to spend time studying, which proved to be difficult as the music from thr festival last until 1:00 am each and every day. 

Also, the a/c broke, but since i was there during the longest heat wave Montreal has ever experienced, a broken a/c was almost imminent. The city’s whole cooling system must have been and still is stressed to the maximum. The day I left Montreal, the temperature is the apartment was 83 degrees. 

I had to leave Montreal very early due to a serious medical emergency at home. My father is gravely ill, had a cardiac arrest and is still a patient in the ICU. So it’s been stressful. Eric was VERY helpful during this difficult situation, and helped me check out immediately. 

The apartment itself was great and clean. Loved the location. 

Thank you

My stay at the apartment was good. The location was perfect for walking to the office and grocery store, as well as right next door to all the festivals going on that week! The place was clean and comfortable. The main AC was not working at the time, but a small portable unit was brought in and it kept the place comfortable.  It's a great little downtown location and the rooftop patio is a cool bonus!

The apartment is in a great location, close to many restaurants and festivals. Eric is a very attentive host and responded quickly to any questions/concerns that we had.  The place is clean and comfortable. The rooftop patio is wonderful to enjoy the views in the evening!  I would definitely stay here again if I returned to Montreal

We had a great time staying at Eric’s. It is in a great location and is the perfect size for two people. The roof top patio is a giant plus and has a nice view of La Croix du Mont Royal. Eric responded promptly to any questions, and check in and check out were a breeze. We would love to stay here again.

Excelente apartamento. Tem tudo o que voce precisa. Metro e onibus só atravessar a rua. Localizacao muito boa. Tem um terraço com uma bela vista pra apreciar. E o Eric é comunicativo e sempre disposto a ajudar.  Recomendo.
The appartment is perfect and the location is one of the best in Montreal. Eric was very friendly and communicating with him was very effective.
Nous avons passé un excellent séjour dans ce studio très propre, très bien équipé et situé au cœur de Montréal. Le métro est juste en face de l’immeuble si vous voulez vous éloigner du centre.
Nice studio. Great downtown location! Thanks Eric!

reviews.comments: I spent almost 40 days in this apartment and it was really good experience live in the best neighborhood of Manhattan.

We stayed for 2 1/2 months and overall had a very good experience.  Pros:  Apartment was good sized, clean, and maintenance requests were done promptly.  Management company was very polite and professional.  Apartment furniture and kitchenware were adequate, TV and wifi were good.  Very large master bedroom with 3 good sized closets.  Washer/dryer in unit was very convenient.  The patio was a nice size and faces a quiet courtyard.  Neighbors were quiet.  Management company cleans monthly (for the monthly fee) and does an awesome job.  Great neighborhood, almost anything in walking distance.  There is a view from the kitchen window of the Greenwich hotel across the street which allows for good paparazzi and celebrity watching.

Cons:  Air conditioning is only in the bedrooms so you need to keep the bedroom doors open in order to cool the rest of the apartment.  The 2nd bedroom doesn't have a closet.   Heating in the 2nd bedroom is done with a portable heater.  Bathroom is small.  The only closets in the apartment are in the master bedroom.  Building is older, built in the 1970's.  The last few weeks of our stay the management company scheduled several showings of the apartment to potential new tenants.  Access to the apartment is stairs only, (one large flight of stairs outside) we did not have access to an elevator.

name: Appartement près du Stade Olympique
summary: Cet appartement magnifique est à 10 minutes à pied du Stade Olympique et 5 minutes à pied du métro qui amène directement au Centre-Ville de Montréal. Il a une chambre, une salle à manger, un petit bureau, une cuisine complète et une salle de bain.
space: Chacune des pièces de l'appartement comprend une grande fenêtre. La chambre comprend un grand lit queen et une télévision 46 pouces. Elle permet aussi un espace de rangement pour vos vêtements. Le petit bureau permet de déposer un ordinateur ou encore de coudre un peu grâce à la machine à coudre.  La salle à manger avec sa table de style bar permet à 4 personnes d'être assis confortablement.  La cuisine complète comprend micro-onde, frigidaire, cuisinière, machine à café Nespresso et bien plus. Vous pourrez vous faire de très bons repas ici. La salle de bain permet de prendre une douche en toute tranquillité. Le logement comprend également un balcon ensoleillé presque toute la journée avec un divan extérieur et un BBQ accessible.

La salle de bain permet de prendre une douche en toute tranquillité. Le logement comprend également un balcon ensoleillé presque toute la journée avec un divan extérieur et un BBQ accessible. Le quartier
neighborhood_overview: Le quartier offre plusieurs commodités en plus d'être très joli avec tous ces arbres. Si vous êtes à pied, vous pouvez aller prendre le métro qui vous amène directement au Centre-Ville de Montréal. (5 minutes de marche) Vous pouvez également avoir accès au Stade Saputo (stade de l'Impact de Montréal) ou encore au Stade Olympique entre 10 et 15 minutes de marche. Plusieurs petites épiceries sont disponible également à pied. Si vous voulez utiliser une voiture, le service d'auto-partage Car2go permet de prendre une voiture directement dans le quartier et de la laisser par la suite en face de l'appartement sans frais supplémentaire. Une crèmerie est disponible à pied également. (10 minutes de marche)
transit: La rue de l'appartement permet aux voitures de stationner sans payer de frais ou encore sans avoir besoin d'une vignette. Le métro Cadillac et L'Assomption sont tous les deux à 5 minutes environ de marche de l'appartement. Le service d'auto-partage Car2go est disponible dans le quartier.
access: Vous aurez accès à tout le logement intérieur et au balcon ensoleillé extérieur.
interaction: Si vous avez des problèmes avec quoi que ce soit, vous aurez accès à une personne ressource en tout temps en envoyant un courriel. Cette personne pourra alors se déplacer si nécessaire.

host.host_about:
Je suis une nouvelle diplômée vivant à Montréal et désirant faire le tour du monde à petit prix grâce à Airbnb. Je fais donc profiter aux amoureux des voyages d'un appartement peu cher où poser ses pieds un instant et profiter de la ville.
Je vous souhaite un très beau séjour dans cette ville remplie de couleurs.

reviews.comments: Logement conforme à la description et aux photos, deux stations de metro accessible à pied en 10-15 minutes, le seul problème que le quartier est résidentiel et les commerces super marchés épicerie se trouvent à 15-20 minutes a pied de l'appartement mais la promenade dans le quartier est très agréable en été, le dépanneur est à 2 minutes de l'appartement mais ce n'est pas suffisant pour manger
Everything was in order and as explained on the posting and during 1:1 conversations with Françoise.  Perfect, cute, clean apt with everything we needed for our 1 week stay near the Stadium!

We had an excellent stay and the apartment was perfect. The kitchen was well-stocked, making it very easy to cook meals. Everything was just as advertised. Free parking was always available on the street. The neighborhood was quiet and away from bustle of the city, yet everything was just a few metro stops away. We went to the Round of 16 World Cup match, so the proximity to the stadium was great. I'd definitely recommend the apartment to everyone, it couldn't have gone smoother. Thanks, Françoise!

name: Casa das Laranjas - Quarto Pássaros
summary: Casa das Laranjas is a charming 19th century house totally renovated in 2014 to provide homely accommodation in Foz Velha, one of the most beautiful heritage areas of Porto where the river Douro meets the Atlantic.
space: Casa das Laranjas is a charming 19th century house totally renovated in 2014 to provide homely accommodation in Foz Velha, one of the most beautiful heritage areas of Porto where the river Douro meets the Atlantic. Casa das Laranjas offers four suites, an ample living-room and dining-room with a cozy fireplace, a totally equipped kitchen, and even  a small patio for enjoying breakfast or a drink in total privacy.Each suite is unique and was decorated with family antiques with amusing contemporary touches.
description: Casa das Laranjas is a charming 19th century house totally renovated in 2014 to provide homely accommodation in Foz Velha, one of the most beautiful heritage areas of Porto where the river Douro meets the Atlantic.
